original: gang gi phyir bya ba dang ldan pa'i yan lag rnams la ni rnam par dbye ba skye la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bya ba dang ldan pa'i yan lag rnams la ni rnam par dbye ba skye la /
translated: Because the parts that possess activity arise with differentiation,

original: des kyang ldan pa 'du ba med pa'i rgyu ldog pa na rdzas 'jig par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des kyang ldan pa 'du ba med pa'i rgyu ldog pa na rdzas 'jig par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and that causes the destruction of the substance when the cause of nonpossession ceases.

original: rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan rgyu ldog pa na ni 'bras bu ldog par byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan rgyu ldog pa na ni 'bras bu ldog par byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: When the cause of the potter, etc., ceases, the effect does not cease.

original: 'du ba med pa'i rgyu ldan pa dang 'du ba dang 'du ba can gyi rgyu snal ma la sogs pa ldog pa ni snam bu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ldog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du ba med pa'i rgyu ldan pa dang 'du ba dang 'du ba can gyi rgyu snal ma la sogs pa ldog pa ni snam bu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ldog par byed pa yin no //
translated: But when the cause of nonpossession ceases, the effect of nonpossession ceases. When the cause of the cloth, etc., which is the cause of the assemblage and the possessor of the assemblage, ceases, the effect of the cloth, etc., ceases.

original: de bzhin du 'gal ba'i chos gzhan dang ldan par yang ston par byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gal ba'i chos gzhan dang ldan par yang ston par byed de /
translated: In the same way, it is shown that the possessor of another contradictory attribute also ceases.

original: 'di la mthong ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid kyis de'i tshe ma mthong bar ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di la mthong ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid kyis de'i tshe ma mthong bar ni mi 'thad de /
translated: Here, it is not tenable that what has the nature of being seen does not see at that time.

original: de'i phyir gcig ste lag pa la sogs pa bsgribs pa mthong ba'i gegs byas pa'i phyir de la gnas pa'i yan lag can gyi rdzas kyang bsgribs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig ste lag pa la sogs pa bsgribs pa mthong ba'i gegs byas pa'i phyir de la gnas pa'i yan lag can gyi rdzas kyang bsgribs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Therefore, since the hand and so on is one, it would be obscured because it obstructs seeing the hand and so on.

original: de nyid kyang yan lag thams cad la khyab pa yin pa des na bsgribs pa'i yan lag gcig la gnas pa'i yan lag can gyi rang bzhin las tha dad pa med pa'i yan lag gzhan la gnas pa'i rang bzhin bsgribs par 'gyur ba des na mi mthong bar
analyzed: de nyid kyang yan lag thams cad la khyab pa yin pa des na bsgribs pa'i yan lag gcig la gnas pa'i yan lag can gyi rang bzhin las tha dad pa med pa'i yan lag gzhan la gnas pa'i rang bzhin bsgribs par 'gyur ba des na mi mthong bar
translated: Since it pervades all the parts, the nature of the whole that exists in one obscured part would not be different from the nature that exists in another part that is not obscured.

original: 'gyur te / tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur te / tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is not different, the other part that is not obscured would not be seen.

original: ci ste yang ma bsgribs pa'i yan lag la gnas pa'i yan lag can gyi rang bzhin ma bsgribs pa'i phyir mthong na ni /
analyzed: ci ste yang ma bsgribs pa'i yan lag la gnas pa'i yan lag can gyi rang bzhin ma bsgribs pa'i phyir mthong na ni /
translated: But if the nature of the whole that exists in the unobstructed part is seen because it is unobstructed,

original: mthong ba de las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba de las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: then since it is not different from that which is seen,

original: bsgribs pa'i yan lag can yang mthong bar 'gyur ba des na tshang bar bzung bar thal lo //
analyzed: bsgribs pa'i yan lag can yang mthong bar 'gyur ba des na tshang bar bzung bar thal lo //
translated: the obscured whole would also be seen. Therefore it follows that the whole would be apprehended as complete.

original: der ni yan lag bsgribs par byas kyi yan lag can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: der ni yan lag bsgribs par byas kyi yan lag can ni ma yin te /
translated: There, the parts are covered, but not the whole.

original: des na thams cad bsgribs par thal zhes ci'i phyir brjod ces gal te gzhan dag sems na /
analyzed: des na thams cad bsgribs par thal zhes ci'i phyir brjod ces gal te gzhan dag sems na /
translated: Therefore, why do you say that it follows that all is seen?

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not reasonable.

original: yan lag rnams kyi @144b phyed gong yin pa'i phyed po de ji srid du bsgribs su zin kyang mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yan lag rnams kyi @144b phyed gong yin pa'i phyed po de ji srid du bsgribs su zin kyang mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Even if the half that is above the parts were covered, it would still be seen.

original: yan lag cung zhig bsgribs pa la lta ci smos zhes bya ba ni kyang gi sgra'o //
analyzed: yan lag cung zhig bsgribs pa la lta ci smos zhes bya ba ni kyang gi sgra'o //
translated: What need is there to speak of seeing the whole when some of the parts are uncovered?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: ma bsgribs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bsgribs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not covered.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it not covered?

original: snga ma kho na bzhin du ste /
analyzed: snga ma kho na bzhin du ste /
translated: Just as before,

original: ma bsgribs pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du yul ma tshang ba med par mthong bar thal lo //
analyzed: ma bsgribs pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du yul ma tshang ba med par mthong bar thal lo //
translated: it follows that it would be seen without any deficiency in the object, just as it is when it is uncovered.

original: ci ste yan lag ma mthong ba gang yin pa la yan lag can de rtogs par mi 'gyur te mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste yan lag ma mthong ba gang yin pa la yan lag can de rtogs par mi 'gyur te mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: But if the whole is not seen when some of its parts are not seen, then the whole is not perceived when some of its parts are not perceived.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it not perceived?

original: smras pa / snang ba'i yan lag gi sgo ni thabs te /
analyzed: smras pa / snang ba'i yan lag gi sgo ni thabs te /
translated: It is said: The parts of the lamp are the means of illumination.

original: tshogs pa mthong ba'i sgo de nas yan lag can de mthong ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro zhes gzhan dag dogs pa la ma yin te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: tshogs pa mthong ba'i sgo de nas yan lag can de mthong ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro zhes gzhan dag dogs pa la ma yin te zhes gsungs te /
translated: Because that is the cause for seeing the whole, having seen the parts.üîΩTo this, the response is ‚ÄúNo!‚Äù

original: yan lag cung zad cig ma mthong bas ni 'dir yan lag can mi mthong bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yan lag cung zad cig ma mthong bas ni 'dir yan lag can mi mthong bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that one does not see the whole here when one does not see some of the parts.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig bsgribs pa'i yan lag can gyi rang bzhin dang / gang yang ma bsgribs pa'i yan lag can gyi rang bzhin de ni tha dad pa med ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig bsgribs pa'i yan lag can gyi rang bzhin dang / gang yang ma bsgribs pa'i yan lag can gyi rang bzhin de ni tha dad pa med ba yin te /
translated: Thus, the nature of the whole that is obscured and the nature of the whole that is not obscured are not different.

original: tha dad pa med pa des na rnam par thams cad du bsgribs pa'i yan lag dang 'brel pa dang / ma bsgribs pa'i yan lag dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin du yan lag can ma rtogs par thal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa des na rnam par thams cad du bsgribs pa'i yan lag dang 'brel pa dang / ma bsgribs pa'i yan lag dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin du yan lag can ma rtogs par thal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because of that nondifference, it follows that the whole is not perceived as connected to obscured parts and as connected to unobstructed parts in every way.

original: ma rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that it is not perceived,

original: yan lag can gyi nges pa skye ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag can gyi nges pa skye ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is the arising of the ascertainment of the whole.

original: gal te yan lag 'ba' zhig mthong gi yan lag can ma yin na ni de'i tshe yan lag can mthong ba'i nges ba mi skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yan lag 'ba' zhig mthong gi yan lag can ma yin na ni de'i tshe yan lag can mthong ba'i nges ba mi skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one sees only the parts and not the whole, then one would not ascertain the seeing of the whole.

original: gzhan yang gal te yan lag cung zad cig bsgribs pa'i dus de'i tshe yan lag nyid mthong na ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te yan lag cung zad cig bsgribs pa'i dus de'i tshe yan lag nyid mthong na ni /
translated: Moreover, if one sees the parts when some of the parts are obscured,

original: thams cad kyi tshe yan lag can mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe yan lag can mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: then one would never see the whole.

original: tshu rol dang pha rol dang dbus kyi cha'i yan lag thams cad tshu rol mthong ba gcig gis cig car te dus gcig tu mthong bar mi nus pa'i phyir yan lag mthong ba 'jig par 'gyur na yan lag ni mthong ba'i yul du brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: tshu rol dang pha rol dang dbus kyi cha'i yan lag thams cad tshu rol mthong ba gcig gis cig car te dus gcig tu mthong bar mi nus pa'i phyir yan lag mthong ba 'jig par 'gyur na yan lag ni mthong ba'i yul du brtags pa yin no //
translated: Because one who sees the part in front would not be able to see simultaneously all the parts of the whole, such as the parts in the back and in the middle, the seeing of the parts would be destroyed, and the parts would be designated as the object of seeing.

original: ci ste yan lag cung zad cig mthong ba na yang /
analyzed: ci ste yan lag cung zad cig mthong ba na yang /
translated: But if one sees some of the parts,

original: yan lag can mthong ba yod pa yin na ni de'i tshe yan lag cung zad mthong bas kyang yan lag can mthong bar 'gyur zhing de las kyang ma bsgribs pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du yan lag thams cad khyab pa'i yan lag can rags pa gcig mthong bar 'gyur
analyzed: yan lag can mthong ba yod pa yin na ni de'i tshe yan lag cung zad mthong bas kyang yan lag can mthong bar 'gyur zhing de las kyang ma bsgribs pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du yan lag thams cad khyab pa'i yan lag can rags pa gcig mthong bar 'gyur
translated: If the possessor of parts were seen, then at that time, even if one part were seen, the possessor of parts would be seen. Also, just as when it is not obstructed, one would see the gross possessor of parts that pervades all the parts.

original: na yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: na yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But it does not exist.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang @145a * //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang @145a * //
translated: Also, in another way,

original: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa ston te /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa ston te /
translated: it demonstrates that it has contradictory attributes.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po de nyid ni dus de nyid kyi tshe 'brel pa can gyi dngos po gzhan des khyab pa dang ma khyab par 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po de nyid ni dus de nyid kyi tshe 'brel pa can gyi dngos po gzhan des khyab pa dang ma khyab par 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: Because it is not tenable that at that time, the very thing that is related to another thing is both pervaded by it and not pervaded by it.

original: des na yan lag gcig kha bsgyur te /
analyzed: des na yan lag gcig kha bsgyur te /
translated: Therefore, if one part is dyed,

original: tshon gyi rdzas dang 'brel na de la gnas pa'i yan lag can tshon dang 'dres pas so zhe na ni /
analyzed: tshon gyi rdzas dang 'brel na de la gnas pa'i yan lag can tshon dang 'dres pas so zhe na ni /
translated: and it is related to the substance of the dye, then the possessor of parts that resides in it would be dyed because it is mixed with the dye.

original: yan lag gzhan dang 'brel pa yang de nyid yin pa'i phyir kha bsgyur bar thal lo //
analyzed: yan lag gzhan dang 'brel pa yang de nyid yin pa'i phyir kha bsgyur bar thal lo //
translated: But if that were the case, then it follows that the other parts would also be dyed because they are related to it.

original: yod ba yang ma yin te ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod ba yang ma yin te ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it existent, because it is not seen.

original: ci ste phyogs gcig kha ma bsgyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste phyogs gcig kha ma bsgyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that one part is not changed,

original: de las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir de yang kha ma bsgyur te /
analyzed: de las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir de yang kha ma bsgyur te /
translated: then that also is not changed, because it is not different from that.

original: gcig bo de'i rang bzhin yul thams cad la khyad par yod pa'i phyir de kho na ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig bo de'i rang bzhin yul thams cad la khyad par yod pa'i phyir de kho na ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the nature of that one is not different in all objects, it would be understood just as it is.

original: ci ste yang yan lag kha bsgyur gyi yan lag can ma yin na /
analyzed: ci ste yang yan lag kha bsgyur gyi yan lag can ma yin na /
translated: But if the parts are changed, and the whole is not,

original: de lta na 'o na yang lag can kha ma bsgyur ba de'i phyir yan lag bsgyur ba dang / yan lag can ma bsgyur bar snang bar 'gyur na snang ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na yang lag can kha ma bsgyur ba de'i phyir yan lag bsgyur ba dang / yan lag can ma bsgyur bar snang bar 'gyur na snang ba yang ma yin no //
translated: then the parts would appear to be changed, and the whole would appear not to be changed, but that does not appear to be so.

original: de ltar 'dis 'gal ba 'du ba rnam pa gsum bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar 'dis 'gal ba 'du ba rnam pa gsum bstan to //
translated: Thus he shows three kinds of contradiction in the aggregation.

original: snang ba'i yul can ni gnyis te bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi rnam par 'gyur bar gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: snang ba'i yul can ni gnyis te bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi rnam par 'gyur bar gyur pa yin la /
translated: The object of appearance is twofold: the action is the change in the nature of the parts.

original: de yang dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gis tha dad par 'gyur la don gzhan dang 'brel pa yang tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gis tha dad par 'gyur la don gzhan dang 'brel pa yang tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, it would be different due to being different from things and non-things, and it would be different due to being related to a different object.

original: mthong ba'i yul can yang sgrib pa'i tha dad pas tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i yul can yang sgrib pa'i tha dad pas tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Also, the subject of seeing would be different due to the difference of obscuration.

original: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa 'di tsam du zad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa 'di tsam du zad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not just this much that has the quality of contradiction.

original: 'di ltar rdzas grub bzhi'i mtha' gcig yul gang du dmigs pa'i yul de ni yan lag gzhan dang 'brel pa'i yul las ldog pa yin te /üîΩde tshad mas yongs su bcad pas de'i rang bzhin nyams par rnam par gcad pa na de'i rang bzhin nyams pa dang ldan pa yang lag gzhan dang 'brel pa'i yul gzhan yang rnam par gcad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdzas grub bzhi'i mtha' gcig yul gang du dmigs pa'i yul de ni yan lag gzhan dang 'brel pa'i yul las ldog pa yin te / de tshad mas yongs su bcad pas de'i rang bzhin nyams par rnam par gcad pa na de'i rang bzhin nyams pa dang ldan pa yang lag gzhan dang 'brel pa'i yul gzhan yang rnam par gcad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one of the four established substances is the object that is observed. That object is the opposite of the object that is related to another part.üîΩWhen that is ascertained by valid cognition, the negation of the impairment of its nature, the impairment of its nature is also negated, and the other object that is related to another part is also negated.

original: de rnam par bcad na yang yongs su bcad pa'i yul khyab pa'i rang bzhin de dang 'brel ba las rnam par bcad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnam par bcad na yang yongs su bcad pa'i yul khyab pa'i rang bzhin de dang 'brel ba las rnam par bcad par 'gyur te /
translated: When that is negated, the object that is ascertained is pervaded by that nature, and it is also negated due to being related to that.

original: gang gi phyir de'i rang bzhin khyab pa'i yul ni yul gzhan gyi rang bzhin dang bral ba des na des khyab pa ni de med pas khyab par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i rang bzhin khyab pa'i yul ni yul gzhan gyi rang bzhin dang bral ba des na des khyab pa ni de med pas khyab par 'gyur la /
translated: Because the nature of that pervades the object, it is devoid of the nature of other objects. Therefore, that which is pervaded by it is pervaded by its absence.

original: gang zhig de med pa'i khyab pa de nyid ni de yod pas khyab pa ma yin pa des na rang bzhin gang zhig yul gang med pas khyab pa de ni de dang 'brel pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig de med pa'i khyab pa de nyid ni de yod pas khyab pa ma yin pa des na rang bzhin gang zhig yul gang med pas khyab pa de ni de dang 'brel pa ma yin la /
translated: That which is pervaded by its absence is not pervaded by its presence. Therefore, that nature which is pervaded by the absence of a certain object is not related to it.

original: gang zhig gang dang 'brel pa ma yin pa de nyid ni de dang 'brel @145b pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang dang 'brel pa ma yin pa de nyid ni de dang 'brel @145b pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is not related to something is not related to it.

original: gcig la cig car rang bzhin gcig bsgrub pa dang dgag pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la cig car rang bzhin gcig bsgrub pa dang dgag pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for a single thing to be both established and refuted at the same time.

original: des na rang bzhi na gcig gi yul dang phyogs dang dus gcig dang 'brel pa'i sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag ni med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na rang bzhi na gcig gi yul dang phyogs dang dus gcig dang 'brel pa'i sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag ni med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the establishment and refutation of a single nature related to a single object, place, and time are not non-arising.

original: phyogs de dang phyogs gzhan dang / yul de dang yul gzhan nyid ni phan tshun spangs pas 'gal ba yin no zhes mang du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs de dang phyogs gzhan dang / yul de dang yul gzhan nyid ni phan tshun spangs pas 'gal ba yin no zhes mang du bshad pa yin no //
translated: And the other side and the other place are mutually exclusive, since they are the negation of each other.

original: des na 'dir rang bzhin du gyur ba'i bya ba tha dad pas ni rang bzhin du gyur pa'i nus pa la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid kyi tha dad pa thams cad dang 'brel pa can tshon tha dad pas ni 'brel pa can gyi rgyuüîΩmtshan can gyi tha dad pa thams cad nye bar mtshon pa yin la /
analyzed: des na 'dir rang bzhin du gyur ba'i bya ba tha dad pas ni rang bzhin du gyur pa'i nus pa la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid kyi tha dad pa thams cad dang 'brel pa can tshon tha dad pas ni 'brel pa can gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi tha dad pa thams cad nye bar mtshon pa yin la /
translated: Thus, here, the difference in the nature of the action is related to the difference in the nature of the capacity, etc., which is the possessor of the nature of existence and non-existence. The difference in the color is related to the difference in the possessor of the color, which is the cloth.üîΩAnd the difference in the object is related to the difference in the possessor of the object, which is the cognition.

original: bsgribs pa'i sgo nas kyang shes pa'i yul dang yul ma yin pa nyid kyis byas pa'i du ma nyid nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgribs pa'i sgo nas kyang shes pa'i yul dang yul ma yin pa nyid kyis byas pa'i du ma nyid nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: And the difference in the object and non-object is related to the difference in the possessor of the object and non-object, which is the cognition.üîΩAnd the difference in the covered and uncovered is related to the difference in the possessor of the covered and uncovered, which is the cloth.üîΩAnd the difference in the many is related to the difference in the possessor of the many, which is the cloth.

original: de'i phyir de ltar yang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa de ni gcig ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa de ni gcig ma yin te /
translated: Thus, that which possesses contradictory properties is not one,

original: dper na tha dad pa'i bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na tha dad pa'i bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like, for example, a different pot, etc.

original: gcig tu mngon par 'dod pa'i don yang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan par mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu mngon par 'dod pa'i don yang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan par mthong ba yin no //
translated: And the object that is asserted to be one is seen to possess contradictory properties.

original: 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig las tha mi dad pa ni de la yod pa yin bas des na yod pa'i yul can gyi gcig nyid kyis tha snyad la ni dngos po yod pas khyab la /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig las tha mi dad pa ni de la yod pa yin bas des na yod pa'i yul can gyi gcig nyid kyis tha snyad la ni dngos po yod pas khyab la /
translated: Since that which is not different from something else exists in it, the convention of oneness, whose object is existence, is pervaded by existence.

original: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa ni gcig gi tha snyad kyis khyab par byed pa yod pa nyid dang 'gal ba med pa yin pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'i //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa ni gcig gi tha snyad kyis khyab par byed pa yod pa nyid dang 'gal ba med pa yin pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'i //
translated: Since the pervasion of the convention of oneness by the existence of the object is not contradicted by the observation of the pervasion of contradictory properties, the contradiction of the pervader is observed.

original: gcig nyid bkag pa na yang dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir du ma nyid du grub par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gcig nyid bkag pa na yang dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir du ma nyid du grub par 'gyur gyi /
translated: When oneness is refuted, multiplicity is established as the object of refutation, because it is an entity.

original: gcig bkag pa tsam gyis ni du ma nyid du 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig bkag pa tsam gyis ni du ma nyid du 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: But multiplicity is not established merely by the refutation of oneness.

original: dngos po med pa yang dngos po dang lhan cig gcig nyid yin pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang dngos po dang lhan cig gcig nyid yin pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because nonentity is also refuted as being identical with entity.

original: 'dir ni gcig pa nyid 'gog pa'am du ma nyid du sgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni gcig pa nyid 'gog pa'am du ma nyid du sgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, oneness is not refuted nor is multiplicity established.

original: mngon sum gyis tha dad par grub pa'i phyir yul med pas blo gros rmongs pa la de tsam gyi yul can gcig gi tha snyad med par bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis tha dad par grub pa'i phyir yul med pas blo gros rmongs pa la de tsam gyi yul can gcig gi tha snyad med par bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Because they are established as different by direct perception, the subject that has only that much as its object is to be established as not existing because of the nonexistence of the object.

original: des na don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning.

original: gang yod pa de ni cha med pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yod pa de ni cha med pa yin te /
translated: Whatever exists is partless,

original: dper na shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shes pa bzhin no //
translated: like consciousness.

original: snang ba'i dngos po yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba'i dngos po yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And the thing that appears does not exist.

original: cha shad dang bcas pa nyid yin na ni phyogs tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can yod pa'i 'gal zla med pa zhes bya bar 'gyur te /üîΩdes na rang bzhin 'gal @146a * //
analyzed: cha shad dang bcas pa nyid yin na ni phyogs tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can yod pa'i 'gal zla med pa zhes bya bar 'gyur te / des na rang bzhin 'gal @146a * //
translated: If it has parts, it would be the contradictory of the nonexistence that has a different place as its cause, and it would be called ‚Äúthe contradictory of nonexistence.‚Äù

original: ba dmigs pas yod pa nyid cha dang bcas pa nyid las ldog pa na cha med kyis khyab pa'i phyir rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: ba dmigs pas yod pa nyid cha dang bcas pa nyid las ldog pa na cha med kyis khyab pa'i phyir rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Therefore, since existence is excluded from having parts because of the observation of a contradictory nature, it is pervaded by partlessness.

original: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa de'i phyir gang zhig shes pa la 'dra bar byed pa 'dra ba'i bdag nyid du byed pa don gcig bu ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa de'i phyir gang zhig shes pa la 'dra bar byed pa 'dra ba'i bdag nyid du byed pa don gcig bu ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it has a contradictory attribute, therefore, there is no single object that is the same as consciousness, that is, that is made the same as consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir 'dra ba mi 'thad pa dang 'dra ba yod du chug kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid la 'khrul ba de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dra ba mi 'thad pa dang 'dra ba yod du chug kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid la 'khrul ba de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because similarity is untenable, and even if similarity were possible, because of the error of the characteristics of apprehendeds and apprehenders,

original: blo yis tha dad pa'i nyams su myong bar bya ba gzhan med de /
analyzed: blo yis tha dad pa'i nyams su myong bar bya ba gzhan med de /
translated: there is no other object of experience that is different from cognition.

original: de rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is not tenable.

original: blo'i di'i myong ba yang gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: blo'i di'i myong ba yang gzhan ma yin te /
translated: The experience of cognition is also not different,

original: gang gi phyir de la yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis pa dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid ma tshang ba de'i gnas skabs nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis pa dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid ma tshang ba de'i gnas skabs nyid yin te /
translated: because in that case also the nature of the two, the characteristics of apprehendeds and apprehenders, is incomplete, and that is its very condition.

original: de la yang de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis 'khrul pa ldog pa med do //
analyzed: de la yang de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis 'khrul pa ldog pa med do //
translated: In that case also, the error of the condition of the immediately preceding condition is not averted.

original: 'o na ji ltar shes pa dang shes bya'i rnam pa gzung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar shes pa dang shes bya'i rnam pa gzung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, how can the aspects of object of cognition and cognition be apprehended?

original: bshad pa / de ni de ltar te rang nyid khyad par gzhan med par kho nar bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / de ni de ltar te rang nyid khyad par gzhan med par kho nar bsal ba yin no //
translated: It is said: It is just so. It is just itself, without any other difference, that is the manifest object.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: shes pa gzhan gyis ni blo de da ltar gsal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis ni blo de da ltar gsal ba ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that the other consciousnesses illuminate that cognition,

original: blo'i rang bzhin nyid kyis de'i rang bzhin kho nas gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: blo'i rang bzhin nyid kyis de'i rang bzhin kho nas gsal ba yin no //
translated: because it is illuminated by its own nature alone, by its very nature.

original: des kyang don 'ga' zhig gsal ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des kyang don 'ga' zhig gsal ba ma yin gyi /
translated: And it does not illuminate any object at all.

original: 'on kyang ma rig pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir mi bden pa'i don ston par byed pa de'i rang gi ngo bo kho na gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma rig pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir mi bden pa'i don ston par byed pa de'i rang gi ngo bo kho na gsal ba yin no //
translated: However, because it is engaged with ignorance, it reveals an unreal object, and its own nature alone is illuminated.

original: 'di nyid rnam par dgrol ba bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par dgrol ba bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained in the following verse:

original: gang gi phyir 'khrul pa dang mi srid pa'i phyir yul gyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyus skyes pa dang 'dra ba bkag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'khrul pa dang mi srid pa'i phyir yul gyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyus skyes pa dang 'dra ba bkag pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because error is impossible, the cause for positing the characteristics of an object is refuted, as if it were produced.

original: deng na tha dad pa'i don 'ga' yang nyams su myong ba ma yin la /
analyzed: deng na tha dad pa'i don 'ga' yang nyams su myong ba ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, no different object is experienced at all.

original: nyams su myong ba 'di'i nyams su myong ba yang gzhan 'ga' zhig ma yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba 'di'i nyams su myong ba yang gzhan 'ga' zhig ma yin te /
translated: And the experience of this experience is not any other experience at all.

original: de la yang nyams su myong ba gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba la gzung bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang nyams su myong ba gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba la gzung bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the experience of one person cannot be the object of experience of another person.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir shes pa'am gzhan nyams su myong ba'i 'brel pa can gzhan 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir nyams su myong ba gang gi yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir shes pa'am gzhan nyams su myong ba'i 'brel pa can gzhan 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir nyams su myong ba gang gi yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin gyi /
translated: Thus, because there is no other consciousness that is related to the experience, the one who experiences is the nature of consciousness itself.

original: ji ltar phyi rol gyi don du smra ba rnams kyis nye bar brtags pa bzhin du nyams su myong bar bya ba'i dngos po la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol gyi don du smra ba rnams kyis nye bar brtags pa bzhin du nyams su myong bar bya ba'i dngos po la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the experience of consciousness depends on an object of experience, as it is imagined by those who advocate external objects.

original: de nyid kyis na nyams su myong ba de yang @146b gzhan 'ga' zhig gi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na nyams su myong ba de yang @146b gzhan 'ga' zhig gi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin te /
translated: For that very reason, that experience is not the nature of something else.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid gzhan gyir ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid gzhan gyir ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could the nature of consciousness be the nature of something else?

original: gzhan gyi bdag nyid ni gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bdag nyid ni gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of something else is not something else.

original: gal te 'o na blo gzhan gyis gzung bar bya ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na blo gzhan gyis gzung bar bya ba ma yin na /
translated: If it is not apprehended by another mind,

original: 'o na ji ltar 'di mngon sum gyis so sor rig par bya ba yang dag par myong bar bya ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'di mngon sum gyis so sor rig par bya ba yang dag par myong bar bya ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: then how is it that it is to be known by direct perception and to be experienced?

original: de yang 'di'i de'i bdag nyid kho na ste mngon sum gyi bdag nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'di'i de'i bdag nyid kho na ste mngon sum gyi bdag nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is just that nature of it, that is, the nature of direct perception.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: de nyid bdag nyid la mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid bdag nyid la mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin te /
translated: It is a direct valid cognition in regard to itself, but not in regard to another.

original: de ni myong ba'i ngo bor skye ba na rang gi bdag nyid la mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni myong ba'i ngo bor skye ba na rang gi bdag nyid la mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin no //
translated: When it arises in the nature of experience, it is a direct valid cognition in regard to itself.

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum de ni rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis rang nyid rab tu gsal ba nyid yin gyi sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan la ltos nas gsal ba yin pa'i rgyu des na de bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa bstan pa yin te
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum de ni rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis rang nyid rab tu gsal ba nyid yin gyi sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan la ltos nas gsal ba yin pa'i rgyu des na de bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa bstan pa yin te
translated: Because that direct perception is the nature of awareness, it is self-illuminating. It is not the case that it is illuminated in dependence on another, like blue and so on. For that reason, it is taught that it illuminates itself.

original: gsal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gsal ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like a lamp.

original: gang gi phyir snang ba ni rang nyid rab tu gsal ba na bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snang ba ni rang nyid rab tu gsal ba na bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Because when an appearance is itself illuminated, it is said to illuminate itself.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te rang rig pa 'di la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te rang rig pa 'di la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: This is what is being said: In this case of reflexive awareness, there is no difference between the apprehended object and the apprehending subject.

original: 'on kyang bdag nyid rab tu gsal ba na bdag nyid 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i rang bzhin du bstan pa yin no//
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag nyid rab tu gsal ba na bdag nyid 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i rang bzhin du bstan pa yin no//
translated: However, when it is itself illuminated, it is taught to be the nature of the valid knowledge of perception that apprehends itself.

original: 'o na sngon po la sogs pa gsal ba ji ltar de dag gi myong ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sngon po la sogs pa gsal ba ji ltar de dag gi myong ba yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it that the illumination of blue and so on is the experience of them?

original: bshad pa / sngon po la sogs pa nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba yang ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / sngon po la sogs pa nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba yang ste /
translated: It is said: The so-called experience of blue and so onüîΩis the nature of the experience of blue and so on.

original: tha snyad 'dis kyang tha dad pa brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tha snyad 'dis kyang tha dad pa brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: This conventional expression does not express difference.

original: 'on kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i nyams su myong ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i nyams su myong ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: However, it is the experience that is the nature of blue and so on.

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa 'khrul pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa 'khrul pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the aspect of the apprehended object mistaken?

original: de ltar nyams su myong ba'i rang gi ngo bor 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar nyams su myong ba'i rang gi ngo bor 'gyur /
translated: Thus, the nature of the experience is transformed.

original: bden te dngos po gzhan dgag pa lhur brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bden te dngos po gzhan dgag pa lhur brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is true, but the refutation of other entities is emphasized.üîΩThe meaning is as follows: The entity of blue, etc., which is illuminated by consciousness, does not exist as another.üîΩBut that consciousness itself, which is affected by the object, is like this: It is the manifestation of a nonexistent aspect.üîΩThe aspect that is taught by the nature of consciousness is transformed and illuminated from itself.

original: des na don 'di yin te gang rnam par shes pas gsal bar gyur pa /üîΩsngon po la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te gang rnam par shes pas gsal bar gyur pa / sngon po la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Since it is illuminated by itself alone, it is called the nature of consciousness.üîΩThe aspect that is taught by the nature of consciousness is transformed and illuminated from itself.üîΩSince it is illuminated by itself alone, it is called the nature of consciousness.üîΩThe aspect that is taught by the nature of consciousness is transformed and illuminated from itself.üîΩSince it is illuminated by itself alone, it is called the nature of consciousness.üîΩThe aspect that is taught by the nature of consciousness is transformed and illuminated from itself.

original: nye bar bslad pa'i rnam par shes pa de nyid ni 'di 'dra ba yin te /üîΩyod pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa nye bar ston pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar bslad pa'i rnam par shes pa de nyid ni 'di 'dra ba yin te / yod pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa nye bar ston pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Since it is illuminated by itself alone, it is called the nature of consciousness.üîΩThe aspect that is taught by the nature of consciousness is transformed and illuminated from itself.üîΩSince it is illuminated by itself alone, it is called the nature of consciousness.üîΩThe aspect that is taught by the nature of consciousness is transformed and illuminated from itself.üîΩSince it is illuminated by itself alone, it is called the nature of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bos bstan pa'i rnam pa ni rang las 'gyur zhing gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bos bstan pa'i rnam pa ni rang las 'gyur zhing gsal ba yin te /
translated: The aspect that is taught by the nature of consciousness is transformed and illuminated from itself.üîΩSince it is illuminated by itself alone, it is called the nature of consciousness.üîΩThe aspect that is taught by the nature of consciousness is transformed and illuminated from itself.üîΩSince it is illuminated by itself alone, it is called the nature of consciousness.üîΩThe aspect that is taught by the nature of consciousness is transformed and illuminated from itself.üîΩSince it is illuminated by itself alone, it is called the nature of consciousness.üîΩThe aspect that is taught by the nature of consciousness is transformed and illuminated from itself.üîΩSince it is illuminated by itself alone, it is called the nature of consciousness.üîΩThe aspect that is taught by the nature of consciousness is transformed and illuminated from itself.üîΩSince it is illuminated by itself alone, it is called the nature of consciousness.üîΩThe aspect that is taught by the nature of consciousness is transformed and illuminated from itself.

original: rang kho nas gsal ba na rang gi ngo bo zhes brjod pa yin no //üîΩrags pa dang @147a * //
analyzed: rang kho nas gsal ba na rang gi ngo bo zhes brjod pa yin no //üîΩrags pa dang @147a * //
translated: Since it is illuminated by itself alone, it is called the nature of consciousness.üîΩThe aspect that is taught by the nature of consciousness is transformed and illuminated

original: rnam par chad pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i gzung ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa 'di dang / gang yang dga' ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang de'i myong ba gang yin pa de rnams ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin de kho na nyid yin na rnam pa de gnyis dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin myong ba ste 'dod pa ma yin
analyzed: rnam par chad pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i gzung ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa 'di dang / gang yang dga' ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang de'i myong ba gang yin pa de rnams ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin de kho na nyid yin na rnam pa de gnyis dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin myong ba ste 'dod pa ma yin
translated: If the aspects of the apprehended that are experienced as discrete and the aspects of the apprehender that are by nature pleasure and so on and the experience of those are the way things really are, as experienced, then those two aspects and the experience of the nature of the apprehender would not be asserted.

original: pa'i dngos po gsum du thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: pa'i dngos po gsum du thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If the aspect of the apprehended object that is experienced as being separate and the aspect of the apprehender that has the nature of pleasure, etc., and the experience of that are reality just as they are experienced, then wouldn‚Äôt it follow that there would be three things: the two aspects and the experience of the apprehender that is not pleasure?

original: gang gi phyir gzung ba ni gzung bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzung ba ni gzung bar bya ba yin la /
translated: Because the apprehended object is that which is apprehended,

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par yang myong bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par yang myong bar bya ba yin te /
translated: and the aspect of the apprehender is that which is experienced,

original: nang gi yongs su gcod pa yang rang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nang gi yongs su gcod pa yang rang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the internal determination is the nature of reflexive awareness.

original: 'di la rnam par phye ba na rang bzhin gsum du 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di la rnam par phye ba na rang bzhin gsum du 'gyur la /
translated: When this is analyzed, it becomes three natures.

original: rang gi rang bzhin myong ba ni rnam pa gsum par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin myong ba ni rnam pa gsum par brjod pa yin no //
translated: The experience of its own nature is said to be the third aspect.

original: des na sngon po la sogs pa ni bzung ba'i rnam pa yin la de'i 'dzin pa'i bya ba nang gi rnam pa ni gnyis pa de'i sim pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin myong ba ni gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: des na sngon po la sogs pa ni bzung ba'i rnam pa yin la de'i 'dzin pa'i bya ba nang gi rnam pa ni gnyis pa de'i sim pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin myong ba ni gsum pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, blue and so on are the aspects of the apprehended, the aspect of the internal apprehender is the second, and the experience of the nature of the bliss of that is the third.

original: rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: rnam 'grel las /
translated: The Pramii(laviirttikam) says:

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa rnam par chad par snang ba la ni shes pa rnam par chad par 'dzin par snang gi rang gi rang bzhin la ni /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa rnam par chad par snang ba la ni shes pa rnam par chad par 'dzin par snang gi rang gi rang bzhin la ni /
translated: In the appearance of the apprehended aspect as divided, the consciousness appears to apprehend it as divided. But in its own nature

original: rnam par ma chad par nyams su myong bar snang ngo zhes te /
analyzed: rnam par ma chad par nyams su myong bar snang ngo zhes te /
translated: it appears to be experienced without division.

original: der ni bzung ba dmigs pa dang rang gi rang bzhin nyams su myong ba gnyis tha dad par snang bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: der ni bzung ba dmigs pa dang rang gi rang bzhin nyams su myong ba gnyis tha dad par snang bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: There, the two, the experience of the apprehended object and the experience of its own nature, appear to be different.

original: tha mi dad kyang 'on kyang gzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa ni don dam pa yin pa'i phyir gnyis su med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad kyang 'on kyang gzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa ni don dam pa yin pa'i phyir gnyis su med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though they are not different, the consciousness that has the aspect of the apprehended and the apprehender is not nondual because it is the ultimate.

original: dngos por gyur pa ma yin pa dag ni gsal bar snang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa ma yin pa dag ni gsal bar snang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Things that are not real do not appear clearly.

original: ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes dogs pa la /
translated: Like the horn of a rabbit.

original: bshad pa / gang la rig bya dang rig byed kyi rnam pa ni yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang la rig bya dang rig byed kyi rnam pa ni yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: To respond: The aspect of the object of cognition and the cognizer does not exist.

original: gal te de dag med na de lta na 'o na de dag ji ltar snang zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dag med na de lta na 'o na de dag ji ltar snang zhe na /
translated: If they do not exist, then how do they appear?

original: bshad pa gang gi tshe ste gang gi phyir ji ltar te rnam pa gang gis ma rig pa'i bag chags kyis nye bar bslad pa'i 'khrul pas mthong zhing rtogs par gyur pa de ltar 'di rnam par gzhag par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa gang gi tshe ste gang gi phyir ji ltar te rnam pa gang gis ma rig pa'i bag chags kyis nye bar bslad pa'i 'khrul pas mthong zhing rtogs par gyur pa de ltar 'di rnam par gzhag par byas pa yin no //
translated: When, because of the latent tendencies of ignorance, delusion sees and realizes in a certain way, it is posited in that way.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The point is this.

original: ma rig pa rnams kyi ma rig pa 'di nyid de /
analyzed: ma rig pa rnams kyi ma rig pa 'di nyid de /
translated: This is the ignorance of the ignorant.

original: mi bden pa'i rang bzhin rab tu ston pa'o //
analyzed: mi bden pa'i rang bzhin rab tu ston pa'o //
translated: It reveals the nature of unreality.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa med pa'i rang bzhin ston pa'i nus pa ni ma rig pa'i bag chags yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa med pa'i rang bzhin ston pa'i nus pa ni ma rig pa'i bag chags yin la /
translated: Therefore the latent tendencies of ignorance have the capacity to reveal the nature of consciousness to be nonexistent.

original: de dang ldan pa las kyang shes pa bdag nyid rab tu ston pa @147b nyid na yod pa ma yin pa'i gzung ba'i rnam pa dang / de la brten pa'i 'dzin pa nyid du bdag nyid ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa las kyang shes pa bdag nyid rab tu ston pa @147b nyid na yod pa ma yin pa'i gzung ba'i rnam pa dang / de la brten pa'i 'dzin pa nyid du bdag nyid ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: And when the self-illumination of consciousness is endowed with that, it is the appearance of the apprehended aspect that does not exist and the appearance of the apprehender that is based on that.

original: des na gzung 'dzin rnam phye ba'i mtshan nyid de rnam par phye ba'i rang bzhin du nyams su myong bar gyur ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: des na gzung 'dzin rnam phye ba'i mtshan nyid de rnam par phye ba'i rang bzhin du nyams su myong bar gyur ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Therefore, that which is experienced as the nature of the division of apprehended and apprehender

original: rnam par bslad pa can te /
analyzed: rnam par bslad pa can te /
translated: is distorted.

original: ma rig pas rab tu bstan pa na de ltar mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: ma rig pas rab tu bstan pa na de ltar mthong ba yin la /
translated: When taught by ignorance, it is seen in that way.

original: ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang myong ba'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang myong ba'i rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: And just as it is seen, the division of apprehended and apprehender and experience is also posited.

original: dper na rab rib kyis nye bar bslad pas shes pa'i skra shad pa la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i cha'i mtshan nyid tha dad ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i myong ba tha dad pa don dam pa ma yin pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rab rib kyis nye bar bslad pas shes pa'i skra shad pa la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i cha'i mtshan nyid tha dad ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i myong ba tha dad pa don dam pa ma yin pa de bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the characteristics of the apprehended object and apprehending subject, such as the visual consciousness that is affected by cataracts, which are different, and the experience of the aspect of the apprehending subject, which is ultimately unreal.

original: de tshe ste de lta yin pa de'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag gi mtshan nyid rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de tshe ste de lta yin pa de'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag gi mtshan nyid rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa ste /
translated: At that time, that is, when it is like that, therefore, the nature of the characteristics of the apprehended object and apprehending subject,

original: rnam par shes pa smra ba'i blo'i rab tu dbye bas gsum gang yin pa 'di la brtsad par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa smra ba'i blo'i rab tu dbye bas gsum gang yin pa 'di la brtsad par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: which are the three distinctions of the consciousness that is the mind of the proponent, should not be disputed.

original: gang yang gal te med pa gsal na ri bong gi rva yang ci'i phyir snang bar mi 'gyur zhes brjod pa de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang gal te med pa gsal na ri bong gi rva yang ci'i phyir snang bar mi 'gyur zhes brjod pa de ni ma yin te /
translated: Also, if the nonexistent appears, why does the horn of a rabbit not appear? That is not so.

original: de la med pa'i ri bong gi rva nye bar ston pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa ma rig pa'i ngo bor gyur ba ni rgyud la med kyi /
analyzed: de la med pa'i ri bong gi rva nye bar ston pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa ma rig pa'i ngo bor gyur ba ni rgyud la med kyi /
translated: In that case, the potential to generate the consciousness that reveals the nonexistent horn of a rabbit does not exist in the continuum, which is the nature of ignorance.

original: sngon po la sogs pa ston pa'i nus pa ni yod pa'i phyir ha cang thal bar mi 'gyur bas kha na mtho ba med do //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa ston pa'i nus pa ni yod pa'i phyir ha cang thal bar mi 'gyur bas kha na mtho ba med do //
translated: Since the potential to reveal blue and so on does exist, there is no fault of overextension.

original: 'di yang tshad ma'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di yang tshad ma'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: This is also explained for the purpose of positing the result of valid knowledge.

original: gang gi tshe phyi'i don med pa de'i tshe shes pa las gzhan rig pa'i rig pa med pa'i bdag nyid kho na rig par bya ba yin zhing de rig pa rang rig pa ni 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe phyi'i don med pa de'i tshe shes pa las gzhan rig pa'i rig pa med pa'i bdag nyid kho na rig par bya ba yin zhing de rig pa rang rig pa ni 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: When external objects do not exist, the object of awareness is only the nature of awareness that is not different from consciousness. The awareness of that is the result.

original: 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa bshad pa /
translated: This is explained in the Commentary on this:

original: rnam par shes par smra ba gang dag gi yod pa ma yin yang gang gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par nye bar ston pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes par smra ba gang dag gi yod pa ma yin yang gang gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par nye bar ston pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúFor those who assert consciousness, the object of awareness is only the nature of awareness that is not different from consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir de ni ma rig pas nye bar bslad pas med pa'i rnam pa yang nye bar ston par byed pa dang / bdag nyid rnam pa de'i 'dzin par byed pa ma yin yang 'dzin par byed pa nyid du ston par byed par skye ba de dag la ni rig par bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir phyin ci log gi rang bzhin du nye bar ston pa'i bdag nyid rig parüîΩbya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni ma rig pas nye bar bslad pas med pa'i rnam pa yang nye bar ston par byed pa dang / bdag nyid rnam pa de'i 'dzin par byed pa ma yin yang 'dzin par byed pa nyid du ston par byed par skye ba de dag la ni rig par bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir phyin ci log gi rang bzhin du nye bar ston pa'i bdag nyid rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are born with the nature of error, they are not suitable to be valid knowledge.üîΩBecause they are born with the nature of error, they are not suitable to be valid knowledge.üîΩBecause they are born with the nature of error, they are not suitable to be valid knowledge.üîΩBecause they are born with the nature of error, they are not suitable to be valid knowledge.

original: de rig pa 'bras bu yin no //üîΩbdag gis phyi rol gyi don rig go zhes nges kyi /
analyzed: de rig pa 'bras bu yin no // bdag gis phyi rol gyi don rig go zhes nges kyi /
translated: Because they are born with the nature of error, they are not suitable to be valid knowledge.üîΩBecause they are born with the nature of error, they are not suitable to be valid knowledge.üîΩBecause they are born with the nature of error, they are not suitable to be valid knowledge.üîΩBecause they are born with the nature of error, they are not suitable to be valid knowledge.üîΩBecause they are born with the nature of error, they are not suitable to be valid knowledge.üîΩBecause they are born with the nature of error, they are not suitable to be valid knowledge.üîΩBecause they are born with the nature of error, they are not suitable to be valid knowledge.üîΩBecause they are born with the nature of error, they are not suitable to be valid knowledge.üîΩBecause they are born with the nature of error, they are not suitable to be valid knowledge.üîΩBecause they are born with the nature of error, they are not suitable to be valid knowledge.üîΩBecause they are born with the nature of error, they are not suitable to be valid knowledge.üîΩBecause they are born with the nature of error, they are not suitable to be valid knowledge.üîΩBecause they are born with the nature of error, they are not suitable to be valid knowledge.

original: bdag nyid do zhes bya bar ni ma yin pa @148a * //üîΩma yin nam /üîΩrig pa yang nges pa la ltos nas 'bras bur brjod kyi rang nyid ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bdag nyid do zhes bya bar ni ma yin pa @148a * // ma yin nam / rig pa yang nges pa la ltos nas 'bras bur brjod kyi rang nyid ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Because they are born with the nature of error, they are not suitable to be valid knowledge.üîΩBecause they are born with the nature of error, they are not suitable to be valid knowledge.

original: bden te 'on kyang bdag nyid yul du rig par nges pa'i phyir ni rang rig pa 'bras bur brjod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bden te 'on kyang bdag nyid yul du rig par nges pa'i phyir ni rang rig pa 'bras bur brjod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Because they are born with the nature of error, they are not suitable to be valid knowledge.

original: 'on kyang don rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni rang rig pa de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang don rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni rang rig pa de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the realization of the object is the essence of that reflexive awareness.

original: gang gi phyir don rtogs pa don rig pa ni don dam par rang rig pa don yin pa de'i phyir gang zhig de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rig pa de nyid dngos po la gnas pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don rtogs pa don rig pa ni don dam par rang rig pa don yin pa de'i phyir gang zhig de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rig pa de nyid dngos po la gnas pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Because the realization of the object is reflexive awareness in the ultimate sense, therefore the awareness that is of the nature of that is the effect that is based on the thing.

original: de yang don rig pa'i rang bzhin du zhen pa na don rig par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang don rig pa'i rang bzhin du zhen pa na don rig par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, when it is conceived to be of the nature of the realization of the object, it is the realization of the object.

original: rig pa de phyi rol gyi yul can du nges pa nyid kyang rang rig pa nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: rig pa de phyi rol gyi yul can du nges pa nyid kyang rang rig pa nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
translated: The determination that that awareness is the subject of an external object is due to reflexive awareness.

original: gang gi phyir gal te 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i yul can nyams su myong ba'i nyams su myong ba de 'dod pa'i rnam pa ste /üîΩsim pa'i rnam pa can gyi 'dzin pa'i yul can nam /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gal te 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i yul can nyams su myong ba'i nyams su myong ba de 'dod pa'i rnam pa ste /üîΩsim pa'i rnam pa can gyi 'dzin pa'i yul can nam /
translated: Because if the experience of the subject of the aspect of the apprehender is the experience of the aspect of the object,üîΩthen the subject of the aspect of the apprehender is the aspect of the object.

original: gang gi tshe phyin ci log tu gyur pa de'i tshe yul du 'dod pa'i gzung ba'i rnam pa yang 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe phyin ci log tu gyur pa de'i tshe yul du 'dod pa'i gzung ba'i rnam pa yang 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun pa ste /
translated: When it is distorted, then the aspect of the apprehended object that is asserted as the object is asserted as concordant.

original: bde ba'i rgyu dang mi 'dod pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyur so sor rig cing rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu dang mi 'dod pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyur so sor rig cing rnam par 'jog go //
translated: One understands and posits the cause of pleasure and the cause of pain as undesirable.

original: de'i phyir don rtogs par mngon par rlom yang bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir don rtogs par mngon par rlom yang bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
translated: Therefore, even though one conceives of the object as understood, it is in accordance with the apprehended object of pleasure and so on.

original: de dang rjes su mthun par yul rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir don rig par nges kyang rig pa ni rang gi yul can kho nar rigs so //
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun par yul rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir don rig par nges kyang rig pa ni rang gi yul can kho nar rigs so //
translated: Since one posits the object in accordance with that, even though one ascertains that one knows the object, it is logical that the consciousness is only the subject of its object.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rnam par shes par smra ba la gzung ba'i rnam pa don du zhen par byas pa ni gzhal bya 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni tshad ma gzung ba'i rnam pa rig par rang gi rang bzhin rig pa'i bdag nyid yin yang gzung ba rig pa
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rnam par shes par smra ba la gzung ba'i rnam pa don du zhen par byas pa ni gzhal bya 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni tshad ma gzung ba'i rnam pa rig par rang gi rang bzhin rig pa'i bdag nyid yin yang gzung ba rig pa
translated: Therefore, in this way, for those who assert consciousness, the aspect of the apprehended object that is conceived to be the object is the object of comprehension. The aspect of the apprehender of the valid knowledge is the aspect of the object of comprehension. The aspect of the valid knowledge is the nature of the consciousness that is aware of itself. However, the aspect of the apprehended object is not the aspect of the valid knowledge.

original: nyid du nges pa ni 'bras bu yin no //üîΩji ltar 'dzin pa'i rnam par nyams su myong ba'i dbang gis don rig pa rnam par 'jog pa des na rnam par shes pa smra ba la rang rig pa kho na 'bras bu yin pa de bzhin du phyi rol gyi don yod kyang rang rig pa ji lta
analyzed: nyid du nges pa ni 'bras bu yin no // ji ltar 'dzin pa'i rnam par nyams su myong ba'i dbang gis don rig pa rnam par 'jog pa des na rnam par shes pa smra ba la rang rig pa kho na 'bras bu yin pa de bzhin du phyi rol gyi don yod kyang rang rig pa ji lta
translated: The ascertainment of the object is the effect.

original: ba bzhin zhes bya ba de la sogs pa'i rnam pa rang rig pa las ma 'das par don grub pa ste /
analyzed: ba bzhin zhes bya ba de la sogs pa'i rnam pa rang rig pa las ma 'das par don grub pa ste /
translated: Just as the cognition of an object is posited through the experience of the aspect that apprehends it, and in that case, the proponent of consciousness must accept reflexive awareness as the effect, in the same way, even though external objects exist, the cognition of the object is not established as something that transcends reflexive awareness.

original: rtogs par rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir rang rig pa de nyid 'bras bur rigs so //
analyzed: rtogs par rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir rang rig pa de nyid 'bras bur rigs so //
translated: The cognition of the object is posited as the realization of the object. Therefore it is reasonable that reflexive awareness is the effect.

original: phyi rol gyi don gzhan yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gzhan yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But don‚Äôt external objects exist?

original: de'i phyir de rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin no zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin no zhe na bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, the cognition of them is the effect.

original: phyi rol gyi don yod kyang don gyi rang gi ngo bo @148b las ma 'das par rnam par gzhag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don yod kyang don gyi rang gi ngo bo @148b las ma 'das par rnam par gzhag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Even though external objects exist, the cognition of the object is not posited as something that transcends the object‚Äôs own nature.

original: shes pa thams cad ces bya ba ni gal te don ji lta ba bzhin du don rnam par 'jog par 'gyur na de'i tshe phyi rol gyi yul ngo bo nyid gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dzin pa'i rnam pas gnas pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal skye ba na
analyzed: shes pa thams cad ces bya ba ni gal te don ji lta ba bzhin du don rnam par 'jog par 'gyur na de'i tshe phyi rol gyi yul ngo bo nyid gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dzin pa'i rnam pas gnas pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal skye ba na
translated: If consciousnesses were to apprehend objects as they are, then since external objects have a single nature, the consciousness that apprehends them would also have a single nature.üîΩHow could those who are to be benefited ascertain that a consciousness apprehending a single thing has the nature of apprehending many?

original: ji ltar rtogs par byed pa rnams dngos po gcig 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa la du ma'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa nyid du nges pa 'di ltar nges pa ni bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i yul yongs su bcad do zhes kha cig gis nges la /
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs par byed pa rnams dngos po gcig 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa la du ma'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa nyid du nges pa 'di ltar nges pa ni bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i yul yongs su bcad do zhes kha cig gis nges la /
translated: Some would ascertain that the object that is the cause of pleasure is excluded,

original: kha cig ni phyin ci log tu yin no //
analyzed: kha cig ni phyin ci log tu yin no //
translated: while others would ascertain the opposite.

original: de dag gis ni bde ba'i rgyu'am sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i yul yongs su bcad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ni bde ba'i rgyu'am sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i yul yongs su bcad pa ma yin no //
translated: They would not ascertain the object that is the cause of pleasure or the cause of pain.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i rnam grangs bde ba la sogs pa rnams la ni gzung ba'i yul gyi rang bzhin nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i rnam grangs bde ba la sogs pa rnams la ni gzung ba'i yul gyi rang bzhin nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The various aspects of apprehending pleasure and so on do not have the nature of the apprehended object.

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni goms pa'i rjes su byed pa des na yul nges par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni goms pa'i rjes su byed pa des na yul nges par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Since pleasure and so on conform to familiarity, how could they ascertain the object?

original: de'i phyir gal te don ji lta ba bzhin du yul rnam par 'jog na ni de'i tshe yul nges pa'i phyir rang bzhin gcig 'dzin par nges pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad rnam pa gcig tu 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te don ji lta ba bzhin du yul rnam par 'jog na ni de'i tshe yul nges pa'i phyir rang bzhin gcig 'dzin par nges pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad rnam pa gcig tu 'gyur ro /
translated: Therefore, if objects are posited in accordance with reality, then at that time, because the object is ascertained, all consciousnesses that apprehend a single nature would have a single aspect.

original: de lta ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: gang gi phyir yul de bde ba'i rgyu nyid du nges pa dang / de las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin du so sor shes pa de dag gis gzung bar nges pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul de bde ba'i rgyu nyid du nges pa dang / de las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin du so sor shes pa de dag gis gzung bar nges pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because those who ascertain that object as the cause of pleasure and who individually know its opposite nature ascertain that it is apprehended,

original: nges pa'i don gcig yul yin par lhag par zhen kyang bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyur nges pa'i yul can gyi shes pa rnam pa du mar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i don gcig yul yin par lhag par zhen kyang bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyur nges pa'i yul can gyi shes pa rnam pa du mar brjod pa yin no //
translated: even though they conceive that a single ascertained object exists, the consciousness that ascertains the cause of pleasure and so on is said to have many aspects.

original: 'di nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained:

original: rnam pa ni du mar rnam par rig ste /
analyzed: rnam pa ni du mar rnam par rig ste /
translated: Consciousness is cognized as having many aspects.

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin gcig nyid la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin gcig nyid la /
translated: Because a single nature

original: gcig gi ni yid la 'bab bas yid du 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: gcig gi ni yid la 'bab bas yid du 'ong ba ste /
translated: The first is pleasant, because it is agreeable to the mind.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is ‚Äúto be agreeable to the mind.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi ni yid du mi 'ong bar de las bzlog par mthong ba ste nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni yid du mi 'ong bar de las bzlog par mthong ba ste nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second is unpleasant, because it is disagreeable to the mind.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is as follows:

original: snang ba'i rang bzhin ni goms pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i bde ba la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gi yang nges par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba'i rang bzhin ni goms pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i bde ba la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gi yang nges par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The nature of appearance is not a cause that determines anything, such as pleasure, etc., that conforms to habit.

original: 'on kyang goms pa sad pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa la ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang goms pa sad pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa la ma nges pa yin no //
translated: However, pleasure, etc., are not determined because they are the cause that awakens the habit.

original: don de la rtogs par byed pa gang gis goms pa ci 'dra bar 'gyur ba de'i goms pa de 'dra ba sad pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: don de la rtogs par byed pa gang gis goms pa ci 'dra bar 'gyur ba de'i goms pa de 'dra ba sad pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: The cause that awakens the habit that is like that which is understood by means of that object is the cause that awakens the habit that is like that.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the cause of pleasure, etc.

original: @149a * // de ni de kho na ltar gzung ba nges par byas pa yin na de ltar nges pa ni med de /
analyzed: @149a * // de ni de kho na ltar gzung ba nges par byas pa yin na de ltar nges pa ni med de /
translated: If that object is ascertained as just that, then such an ascertainment does not exist.

original: bde ba dang bde ba ma yin pa la sogs pa shes pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir dang / de yang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ci lta ba bzhin rgyu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang bde ba ma yin pa la sogs pa shes pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir dang / de yang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ci lta ba bzhin rgyu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the aspects of the apprehending subject of the cognition of pleasure, pain, etc. are different, and because the object is posited as the cause of the aspect of the apprehending subject.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don du smra ba la yang rang rig pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas don rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir rang rig pa'i rang bzhin kho nar rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don du smra ba la yang rang rig pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas don rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir rang rig pa'i rang bzhin kho nar rigs so //
translated: Therefore, even for the proponents of external objects, it is reasonable that they are of the nature of autocognition, because they posit objects in dependence on autocognition.

original: 'dod pa'am mi 'dod par snang ba'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa de dag ni rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'am mi 'dod par snang ba'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa de dag ni rtog pa yin no //
translated: Those that have the mode of appearance of being desirable or undesirable are conceptual.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: dngos po gcig la 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rnam par 'jug pa ni rtog pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po gcig la 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rnam par 'jug pa ni rtog pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: The engagement of a single entity in the mode of being desirable or undesirable is conceptual.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the sense consciousness.

original: de'i phyir dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul bsam pa na rang rig pa ji lta ba bzhin du don rnam par 'jog go zhes bya ba mi rigs so snyam du dogs pa la ma yin te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul bsam pa na rang rig pa ji lta ba bzhin du don rnam par 'jog go zhes bya ba mi rigs so snyam du dogs pa la ma yin te zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, when the object of the sensory consciousnesses is being considered, it is not reasonable to posit the object in accordance with autocognition.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa de la yang 'chi ltas la sogs pa'i dus su bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa mtshams sbyor ba med pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa de la yang 'chi ltas la sogs pa'i dus su bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa mtshams sbyor ba med pa ste /
translated: To respond: No, because even in that sensory consciousness, at the time of the signs of death, etc., the aspect of pleasure, etc., is not connected,

original: rjes su 'jug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa med pa'o //
translated: that is, does not follow.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni nad kyi bye brag gis thebs pa'i dus na yang ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni nad kyi bye brag gis thebs pa'i dus na yang ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to the time of being struck by a specific illness.

original: 'ga' zhig 'dod pa mngon par dga' bar bya ba'i gnas su lan cig ma yin par nyams su myong ba yang dmigs pa de nyid la lta ba 'jug pa na de ma thag tu mig gi rnam par shes pa mi 'dod pa'i rnam par skye bar 'gyur ro
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'dod pa mngon par dga' bar bya ba'i gnas su lan cig ma yin par nyams su myong ba yang dmigs pa de nyid la lta ba 'jug pa na de ma thag tu mig gi rnam par shes pa mi 'dod pa'i rnam par skye bar 'gyur ro
translated: Even though one has repeatedly experienced a certain object that one desires and delights in, when one looks at that very object, immediately the eye consciousness arises with an aspect that one does not desire.

original: // de bzhin du nad kyi bye brag gis thebs pa'i tshe yang yul gang la sngon bde ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa de nyid la /
analyzed: // de bzhin du nad kyi bye brag gis thebs pa'i tshe yang yul gang la sngon bde ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa de nyid la /
translated: Likewise, when one is afflicted by a particular disease, the very object that previously gave rise to a consciousness having the aspect of pleasure,

original: mod la sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa can rnam par shes pa skye zhing gang las sun byung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mod la sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa can rnam par shes pa skye zhing gang las sun byung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: immediately gives rise to a consciousness having the aspect of pain, and one becomes disgusted with it.

original: kha cig na re 'chi ltas kyi tshe na gos dkar po sngon por snang ngo zhes zer ba de ni de ltar mi rigs te bden pa'i don can du 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid rig pa ji lta ba bzhin du don rnam par 'jog pa'i dperüîΩbya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'chi ltas kyi tshe na gos dkar po sngon por snang ngo zhes zer ba de ni de ltar mi rigs te bden pa'i don can du 'dod pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid rig pa ji lta ba bzhin du don rnam par 'jog pa'i dper bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Some say that at the time of the death omens, white things appear blue. That is not so, because a consciousness that is accepted as having the meaning of truth is an example that establishes the object in accordance with the way it is known.

original: log pa'i shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a mistaken consciousness.

original: dkar po sngon por snang ba ni log pa'i shes pa yin te /
analyzed: dkar po sngon por snang ba ni log pa'i shes pa yin te /
translated: A white thing appearing blue is a mistaken consciousness.

original: de'i phyir snga ma nyid skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir snga ma nyid skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, the former is faultless.

original: re zhig mtshams sbyor ba med par rim pa dang ldan pa'i rnam pa 'di ni rgyud gcig gi yul ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig mtshams sbyor ba med par rim pa dang ldan pa'i rnam pa 'di ni rgyud gcig gi yul ma yin no //
translated: For a while, this sequence of events is not the object of a single stream.

original: gzhan la yang @149b zhes bya ba rgyud tha dad pa rnams la cig car tha dad pa med pa'i glu'i sgras ri dags dga' bar byed pa'i sgra de nyid kyis srog chags kyi bye brag gzhan gyis thos pa las sdug bsngal bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gzhan la yang @149b zhes bya ba rgyud tha dad pa rnams la cig car tha dad pa med pa'i glu'i sgras ri dags dga' bar byed pa'i sgra de nyid kyis srog chags kyi bye brag gzhan gyis thos pa las sdug bsngal bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: In other streams, at the same time, there is no difference in the sound of the song, but other species of animals hear that sound of the song and experience suffering.

original: de bzhin du dri de nyid kyis mi dang phag dang / de bzhin du lan tshva zhes bya ba'i ro'i bye brag gis rnga mo dang mi dang / de bzhin du bad kan gyi rang bzhin dang / mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can dag ci rigs par bde ba dang sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dri de nyid kyis mi dang phag dang / de bzhin du lan tshva zhes bya ba'i ro'i bye brag gis rnga mo dang mi dang / de bzhin du bad kan gyi rang bzhin dang / mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can dag ci rigs par bde ba dang sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, humans and pigs experience pleasure and suffering from that same smell. In the same way, camels and humans experience pleasure and suffering from that same taste of salt. In the same way, those with a phlegm-dominant nature and those with a bile-dominant nature experience pleasure and suffering as appropriate.

original: de'i phyir te tha dad pa med kyang de dag gis srog chags kyi bye brag rnams kyi dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bde ba dang mi bde ba'i skyed pa'i rgyu'i phyir don rtogs pa ni rang rig pa'i ngo bo kho na'o //
