translated: Moreover, whatever is known by abandoning something is ultimately different from it.

original: ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis tha dad par gyur na ni 'o na ni sngon po la sogs pa gang zhig 'ga' las kyang tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis tha dad par gyur na ni 'o na ni sngon po la sogs pa gang zhig 'ga' las kyang tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were different by reason of reversal, then blue, etc., would not be different from anything at all,

original: tha dad pa'i rgyu gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rgyu gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other cause of difference.

original: gang gi tshe phyi'i don gyi tshul la rnam pa med pa'i phyogs bkag nas rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs rnam par 'jog pa de'i tshe ni rjes su dpag pa'i tha mi dad pa la brten nas 'di skad du ma rtogs pa las bzlog pa dang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe phyi'i don gyi tshul la rnam pa med pa'i phyogs bkag nas rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs rnam par 'jog pa de'i tshe ni rjes su dpag pa'i tha mi dad pa la brten nas 'di skad du ma rtogs pa las bzlog pa dang /
translated: When the position without aspects in the system of external objects is refuted and the position with aspects is posited, then, based on the nondifference of the inference, it is said that the opposite of noncomprehension is comprehension.

original: sngon po ma yin pa las bzlog pa ni rnam par shes pa gcig yin no zhes brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sngon po ma yin pa las bzlog pa ni rnam par shes pa gcig yin no zhes brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: But it is said that the opposite of not being blue is a single consciousness.üîΩ

original: nyams su myong bas grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong bas grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not established by experience.

original: de ji ltar na ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rang bzhin yang gzhan gyis ma shes te /
analyzed: de ji ltar na ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rang bzhin yang gzhan gyis ma shes te /
translated: How can the nature of something that is the basis of exclusion be unknown to others?

original: rang bzhin gsum ni @155b grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gsum ni @155b grub pa yin no //
translated: The three natures are established.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩdngos mthong med phyir gcig ma yin //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / dngos mthong med phyir gcig ma yin //
translated: Therefore,

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: it is not one, because the thing is not seen.üîΩThis is explained by the verses.üîΩThe verses teach this:

original: 'di nyid tshig le'ur byas pa dag gis ston par byed de blo'i bdag nyid rnam par dbye ba yod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid tshig le'ur byas pa dag gis ston par byed de blo'i bdag nyid rnam par dbye ba yod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The nature of cognition is not differentiated.

original: ma rig pas mthong ba phyin ci log tu gyur cing rnam par bslad par gyur pa gang yin pa de dag rnams kyis blo'i bdag nyid la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang / rig pa rnams tha dad pa gang yin pa de dang bcas par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma rig pas mthong ba phyin ci log tu gyur cing rnam par bslad par gyur pa gang yin pa de dag rnams kyis blo'i bdag nyid la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang / rig pa rnams tha dad pa gang yin pa de dang bcas par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Those whose vision is distorted and corrupted by ignorance perceive the nature of cognition as having the differentiation of apprehendeds and apprehenders and as having awareness.

original: dper na sngags grub pa dang sman la sogs pas mig bslad pa ste /
analyzed: dper na sngags grub pa dang sman la sogs pas mig bslad pa ste /
translated: medicines, and so on.

original: nyams par byas pa gang yin pa de rnams la 'jim du ma ni 'ji pa'i 'dzel  ma ste /
analyzed: nyams par byas pa gang yin pa de rnams la 'jim du ma ni 'ji pa'i 'dzel  ma ste /
translated: The clay is the clay lump,

original: de la sogs pa'i dngos po gang yin par shes pa'i bdag nyid la rnam pa gzhan nyid du snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i dngos po gang yin par shes pa'i bdag nyid la rnam pa gzhan nyid du snang ba bzhin no //
translated: and so on. The nature of those things is seen in another form.

original: 'di skad du 'khrul pa'i dbang gis gzhan du rnam par gnas pa yang gzhan du mthong ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du 'khrul pa'i dbang gis gzhan du rnam par gnas pa yang gzhan du mthong ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: ‚ÄúDue to the power of delusion, what exists as one thing is seen as another.‚Äù

original: sngags dang sman la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gzhan skyes pa yin no zhes dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: sngags dang sman la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'jim pa'i dum bu la sogs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gzhan skyes pa yin no zhes dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to stop the doubt that the nature of the clay lump and so on is generated as something else through the power of spells, medicines, and so on, it is said:

original: mig ma bslad pa ste mig bslad pa med pa'i mig 'khrul mkhan rnams kyi zur na 'jug pa'i lta ba po rnams kyis ji ltar mthong ba'i rang bzhin de ltar ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig ma bslad pa ste mig bslad pa med pa'i mig 'khrul mkhan rnams kyi zur na 'jug pa'i lta ba po rnams kyis ji ltar mthong ba'i rang bzhin de ltar ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those whose eyes are unaffected, whose eyes are not affected, the spectators standing in the corner, do not see the nature of the clay lump and so on as it is seen by those whose eyes are affected.

original: yan na gal te der dogs pa 'dir 'gyur ba yin yang gang mya ngam dag na dngos po chung du chen por snang ba zhes bya ba 'di la ni dogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yan na gal te der dogs pa 'dir 'gyur ba yin yang gang mya ngam dag na dngos po chung du chen por snang ba zhes bya ba 'di la ni dogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But if there is doubt about that, then there is no doubt about this: in a desert, a small thing appears to be large.

original: mya ngam shing dang chu med pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: mya ngam shing dang chu med pa'i phyogs te /
translated: A desert is a place without trees and water.

original: de lci ba'i dum bu yang rgyang ring po nas ri'i tshad tsam du mthong bar 'gyur ro //üîΩdon dam par gzung ba gzhal bya 'dzin pa tshad ma dang / rig pa 'bras bu nyid tha dad pa dang ldan pa rnams yod pa ma yin yang /
analyzed: de lci ba'i dum bu yang rgyang ring po nas ri'i tshad tsam du mthong bar 'gyur ro // don dam par gzung ba gzhal bya 'dzin pa tshad ma dang / rig pa 'bras bu nyid tha dad pa dang ldan pa rnams yod pa ma yin yang /
translated: Even a small piece of dung is seen from a distance as large as a mountain.üîΩIn reality, the object of apprehension, the valid cognition that apprehends it, and the cognition that possesses the result are not different.

original: gzhal bya dang / 'jal byed dang / 'bras bu gnas pa 'di ni ji ltar ma rig pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i 'khrul pa'i snang ba de las ma 'das bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhal bya dang / 'jal byed dang / 'bras bu gnas pa 'di ni ji ltar ma rig pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i 'khrul pa'i snang ba de las ma 'das bar byas pa yin no //
translated: However, this state of the object of apprehension, the means of apprehension, and the result is not beyond the appearance of error that follows ignorance.

original: gzhan du na gal te shes pa gcig la rang bzhin du mar snang ba'i gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa de kho na nyid du rnam par 'jog na de'i gcig pa nyid de nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na gal te shes pa gcig la rang bzhin du mar snang ba'i gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa de kho na nyid du rnam par 'jog na de'i gcig pa nyid de nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if the aspects of the object, etc., which appear as multiple natures to a single cognition, were posited as reality, then its oneness would be destroyed.

original: des na gcig nyid nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na gcig nyid nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because its oneness would be destroyed,

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa rnams ni de kho na nyid du rigs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa rnams ni de kho na nyid du rigs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù The aspects are not reality.

original: de lta na 'o na ni @156a * //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni @156a * //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case,

original: rnam pa gsum po rnams gcig nyid yin pas gcig las tha dad pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po rnams gcig nyid yin pas gcig las tha dad pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: since the three aspects are one, they would not be different from one another.‚ÄùüîΩIn response, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / gzhan gyi ste du ma rnams kyi du ma nyid ldog par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / gzhan gyi ste du ma rnams kyi du ma nyid ldog par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that the plurality of the other, i.e., the many, would be refuted.

original: du ba nyid kyi tha snyad yul med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: du ba nyid kyi tha snyad yul med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The convention of smoke would be baseless.

original: gsum po de rnams ni tha dad pa med pa gcig pa nyid du brtag par mi nus te /
analyzed: gsum po de rnams ni tha dad pa med pa gcig pa nyid du brtag par mi nus te /
translated: Those three cannot be conceived to be one, without being different.

original: dngos mthong med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos mthong med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the thing is not seen.

original: gcig gis dngos po mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig gis dngos po mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one does not see a thing.

original: blos dngos po tha dad pa med pa 'gal ba'i chos 'du bas stong ba'i rang bzhin mthong na ni tha dad pa med par nges par 'gyur ba yin na 'di la ni tha dad pa med pa mthong ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: blos dngos po tha dad pa med pa 'gal ba'i chos 'du bas stong ba'i rang bzhin mthong na ni tha dad pa med par nges par 'gyur ba yin na 'di la ni tha dad pa med pa mthong ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If one sees a thing as empty of a contradictory property that is not different from the cognition, then one would ascertain that it is not different. But here, one does not see that it is not different.

original: de'i phyir snang ba'i dngos po gcig dang du ma'i bdag nyid gang gis rnam par dpyad pa de'i rang bzhin ni de kho nar yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir snang ba'i dngos po gcig dang du ma'i bdag nyid gang gis rnam par dpyad pa de'i rang bzhin ni de kho nar yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the nature of the appearing thing, which is analyzed as being either one or many, does not exist in reality.

original: de nyid ston pa ni gang gi phyir na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni gang gi phyir na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: To demonstrate just that, it says, ‚ÄúBecause . . . ‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa gcig dang du ma'i kho na snang bas 'di gcig nyid du snang bas rigs pa yin na du mar snang ba de'i phyir 'di ni gcig gi rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa gcig dang du ma'i kho na snang bas 'di gcig nyid du snang bas rigs pa yin na du mar snang ba de'i phyir 'di ni gcig gi rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: because external objects do not exist, consciousness appears as one or many. If it is reasonable that it appears as one, then it is not reasonable that it appears as many.

original: de'i phyir snang ba 'di ni gcig ma yin la du ma yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir snang ba 'di ni gcig ma yin la du ma yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, this appearance is neither one nor many,

original: gzung 'dzin gyi rnam pa dag dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin gyi rnam pa dag dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the aspects of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject are not real entities.

original: gal te chos mthun pa 'dra ba'i mthong ba de'i phyir 'khrul pa skye ba zhes bya ba 'di ni 'jig rten na srid pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te chos mthun pa 'dra ba'i mthong ba de'i phyir 'khrul pa skye ba zhes bya ba 'di ni 'jig rten na srid pa yin te /
translated: If you say that error arises because of the appearance of similarity to a homogeneous object, this is possible in the world,

original: de ltar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because such an appearance exists.

original: 'khrul pa ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of error is it?

original: smras pa / de bdag min la de bdag tu zhen pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: smras pa / de bdag min la de bdag tu zhen pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: It is the nature of clinging to that which is not the self as the self.

original: zhen pa yis zhes bya ba ni de lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsum pa'o //
analyzed: zhen pa yis zhes bya ba ni de lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsum pa'o //
translated: Clinging is the third characteristic, which is of that kind.

original: rnam par shes pa smra ba 'dir ni chos mthun par mthong ba de yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa smra ba 'dir ni chos mthun par mthong ba de yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But this is not the case for the Proponents of Consciousness.

original: gtan tshigs smras pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs smras pa /
translated: The Logician says:

original: 'gro ba 'di la ni 'dra ba de'i bdag nyid gcig kyang mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di la ni 'dra ba de'i bdag nyid gcig kyang mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we do not see any such similarity in this world.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what he means:

original: gal te tshu rol mthong bas gzung pa dang 'dzin pa dang / rig pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa dang ldan par don dam pa 'ga' zhig nyams su myong bar gyur la /üîΩphyis de dang 'dra ba'i rnam par shes pa yang nyams su myong ba yin na ni de'i tshe gnyis mtshams sbyar bas 'khrul par 'thad par 'gyur na rnam par shes par smra ba la ni gang la @156b gang gi rang bzhin sgro gdags par bya ba 'dra ba'i
analyzed: gal te tshu rol mthong bas gzung pa dang 'dzin pa dang / rig pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa dang ldan par don dam pa 'ga' zhig nyams su myong bar gyur la / phyis de dang 'dra ba'i rnam par shes pa yang nyams su myong ba yin na ni de'i tshe gnyis mtshams sbyar bas 'khrul par 'thad par 'gyur na rnam par shes par smra ba la ni gang la @156b gang gi rang bzhin sgro gdags par bya ba 'dra ba'i
translated: If the ultimate were experienced by the perception of this side, which is endowed with the differentiation of object and subject and of knower and known,

original: don gnyi ga yang mthong ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: don gnyi ga yang mthong ba med pa yin no //
translated: and if later on the consciousness that is similar to that were also experienced, then at that time it would be tenable to say that the two are connected and that there is error. But for the Proponents of Consciousness, there is no seeing of either of the two, the object and the consciousness that is similar to it, which would be the basis for the superimposition of the nature of the other.

original: cig shos kyis kyang pha rol po'i rjes su brjod pa smras pa ni /
analyzed: cig shos kyis kyang pha rol po'i rjes su brjod pa smras pa ni /
translated: The other one, the Proponent of Consciousness, states the opponent‚Äôs response:

original: 'khrul pa de yang yod na ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa de yang yod na ste /
translated: If that error exists,

original: yang gi sgras ni gzhan yang yod do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni gzhan yang yod do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that it exists in another way.

original: chos mtshungs pa'i rgyu mtshan la ltos nas sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i 'khrul par 'gyur ba ni rtog pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: chos mtshungs pa'i rgyu mtshan la ltos nas sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i 'khrul par 'gyur ba ni rtog pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: The error that superimposes, in dependence on a reason of similarity, is a conception.

original: gzhan rtog pa med pa gang yin pa de yang chos mthun pa la ltos pa ni ma yin te /üîΩnang na gnas pa'i bslad pa las byung ba gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin gyis te /
analyzed: gzhan rtog pa med pa gang yin pa de yang chos mthun pa la ltos pa ni ma yin te / nang na gnas pa'i bslad pa las byung ba gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin gyis te /
translated: But that which is other than a conception, and does not depend on similarity,üîΩarises from an internal corruption.

original: rang gi ngo bo kho nas phyin ci log tu snang bar 'gyur te nyes pas skyed pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho nas phyin ci log tu snang bar 'gyur te nyes pas skyed pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: It is natural, that is, it appears erroneously by its very nature, because it is the cause of the production of error.

original: gang gi phyir nyes pa dang 'brel pa de ni mi bden pa'i don ston par byed de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyes pa dang 'brel pa de ni mi bden pa'i don ston par byed de /
translated: Because it is related to error, it reveals a false object,

original: mi bden pa'i don gyi ngo bo nyid du skye bar 'gyur ro //üîΩchos mthun mthong ba ni snang ba'o //
analyzed: mi bden pa'i don gyi ngo bo nyid du skye bar 'gyur ro // chos mthun mthong ba ni snang ba'o //
translated: and it arises as the nature of a false object.üîΩSeeing similarity is the appearance.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni 'dra bar mthong ba ste /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni 'dra bar mthong ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to seeing resemblance.

original: gang gi phyir sngar ni sgro 'dogs pa'i rang bzhin mthong bar 'gyur la /üîΩphyis sgro 'dogs pa'i yul yin zhing des na de 'dra ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngar ni sgro 'dogs pa'i rang bzhin mthong bar 'gyur la / phyis sgro 'dogs pa'i yul yin zhing des na de 'dra ba yin la /
translated: Because previously one sees the nature of superimposition,üîΩand later one sees the object of superimposition.üîΩTherefore, it is like that, and therefore superimposition is not different.

original: des na tha dad pa med par sgro 'dogs pa yin no zhes sogs pa smos pas rim gyis mtshon par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na tha dad pa med par sgro 'dogs pa yin no zhes sogs pa smos pas rim gyis mtshon par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: This is how it is indicated gradually by the statements above.

original: chos mthun pa mthong ba la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos mthun pa mthong ba la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is that which does not depend on seeing things that are similar and so on.

original: 'di ltar dper na rab rib las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa skra shad dang sbrang bu la sogs pa 'dra ba'i dngos po mthong nas sgro 'dogs par byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar dper na rab rib las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa skra shad dang sbrang bu la sogs pa 'dra ba'i dngos po mthong nas sgro 'dogs par byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: For example, a consciousness arisen from eye disease does not superimpose things that are similar to hairs, flies, and so on.üîΩHowever, it is produced to reveal itself as if it were like that.

original: 'on kyang de lta bur 'gyur ba'i rang gi ngo bor rab tu ston pa nyid du skyed pa de bzhin du log par 'dzin pa'i bag chags kyis bslad pa'i rnam par shes pa mi bden pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ston pa skye ba ni chos
analyzed: 'on kyang de lta bur 'gyur ba'i rang gi ngo bor rab tu ston pa nyid du skyed pa de bzhin du log par 'dzin pa'i bag chags kyis bslad pa'i rnam par shes pa mi bden pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ston pa skye ba ni chos
translated: In the same way, a consciousness that is affected by the latent propensities of wrong apprehension is produced to reveal the aspects of unreal apprehendeds and apprehenders.

original: mthun pa la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: mthun pa la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: It is not dependent on anything else, such as a cause.

original: rnam par phye ba'i rang bzhin du rab tu gsal ba de yang gcig ni ma yin te /üîΩde ltar nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdu ma yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par phye ba'i rang bzhin du rab tu gsal ba de yang gcig ni ma yin te / de ltar nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro // du ma yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not a single entity, because it is clearly manifest as a variety.

original: rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a plurality, because it is not separate from consciousness.

original: de ni bslad pa yin la bslad pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba dga' ba dang zhum pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rig pa tsam ni bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni bslad pa yin la bslad pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba dga' ba dang zhum pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rig pa tsam ni bden pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not real, because it is an error, and the mere awareness of the nature of pleasure, pain, etc., is free from the nature of error.

original: zha ra la 'ongs pa'i don tshig le'ur byas pas ma bzung ba 'chad par byed pa bar ma skabs su gnas pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zha ra la 'ongs pa'i don tshig le'ur byas pas ma bzung ba 'chad par byed pa bar ma skabs su gnas pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: The verses in the middle are the commentary on the meaning of the words of the treatise, which is not understood by the blind.

original: 'di rnam par rig pa tsam @157a * //
analyzed: 'di rnam par rig pa tsam @157a * //
translated: The words ‚Äúmere representation‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te phyi rol gyi don bzlog nas rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du rnam par gnas pa yin na ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te phyi rol gyi don bzlog nas rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du rnam par gnas pa yin na ni /
translated: mean that if external objects are refuted and only mere representation remains,

original: 'khrul pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas tshad ma la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas tshad ma la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If one follows error, then one would posit valid cognitions and so forth.

original: de nyid da rung yang rnam par gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid da rung yang rnam par gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: But that very error does not exist.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ji ltar zhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ji ltar zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: That is why it says, ‚ÄúHow could that be?‚Äù

original: slob dpon gyis kyang rnam pa med pa'i phyogs la shes pa 'dzin pa nyid dang / don gzung ba nyid sngar gsal la /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang rnam pa med pa'i phyogs la shes pa 'dzin pa nyid dang / don gzung ba nyid sngar gsal la /
translated: The Acarya also says that in the position of no aspects, the cognition of the object and the apprehension of the cognition are clear.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la yang rnam par rig pa smra ba rtsom pa nyid kyi tshe gzung ba'i mtshan nyid gsal ba yin no zhes gsungs ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la yang rnam par rig pa smra ba rtsom pa nyid kyi tshe gzung ba'i mtshan nyid gsal ba yin no zhes gsungs ba ni /
translated: And in the position of having aspects, the proponents of the theory of representation-only say that the characteristic of the object is clear at the time of the composition of the representation.

original: bshad zin to zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bshad zin to zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúexplained above.‚Äù

original: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid de dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid de dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: Because it is not endowed with that characteristic of the object.

original: rnam pa med pa'i phyogs la 'thad pa gzhan yang yod pas de nyid bstan pa'i don du gzhan yang zhes bsdu ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i phyogs la 'thad pa gzhan yang yod pas de nyid bstan pa'i don du gzhan yang zhes bsdu ba gsungs te /
translated: There is another argument for the position of no aspects, and in order to present that, it says, ‚ÄúMoreover,‚Äù

original: lhan cig ces bya ba ni lhan cig tu dmigs pa de nges pa ste de'i phyir ro //üîΩsdo dang de yi blo dag gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: lhan cig ces bya ba ni lhan cig tu dmigs pa de nges pa ste de'i phyir ro // sdo dang de yi blo dag gzhan ma yin /
translated: ‚ÄúTogether‚Äù means that the ascertainment of the simultaneous observation of the two is the reason.

original: zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition of the two is not different from them‚Äù means that they are not different.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i cha nyid bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i cha nyid bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
translated: In order to demonstrate the probandum, he says,

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúbecause . . . ‚Äù

original: gal te sngon po dang de dmigs pa dag tha dad pa med na ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dag tha dad par snang zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sngon po dang de dmigs pa dag tha dad pa med na ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dag tha dad par snang zhe na /
translated: If blue and the observation of it are not different, how is it that the aspects of the apprehended and apprehender appear to be different?

original: gang la tha dad par snang ba'i ngang tshul yod pa zhes rjes su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gang la tha dad par snang ba'i ngang tshul yod pa zhes rjes su brjod pa'o //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the appearance of difference . . . ‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir gang ji snyed snang ba de kho na ltar thams cad bden pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang ji snyed snang ba de kho na ltar thams cad bden pa ni ma yin te /
translated: As much as appears does not all exist in reality,

original: 'khrul pas med pa yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pas med pa yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because nonexistence appears due to error.

original: don gzhan pa'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba ston pa'o //
analyzed: don gzhan pa'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba ston pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not the nature of another object‚Äù demonstrates the probandum.

original: 'di skad du 'di dag gcig par ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di skad du 'di dag gcig par ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: This is what is being taught: ‚ÄúThese are not established as the same.

original: 'on kyang tha dad pa dag dgag pa tsam yin no zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang tha dad pa dag dgag pa tsam yin no zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: However, they are merely different and are negated.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir tha dad pa dgag pa tsam bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tha dad pa dgag pa tsam bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Why is it that the mere negation of difference is established,

original: gcig nyid du ni bsgrub pa ma yin no zhes smra /
analyzed: gcig nyid du ni bsgrub pa ma yin no zhes smra /
translated: but not the establishment of sameness?

original: gcig tu ni 'thad pa yin te /
analyzed: gcig tu ni 'thad pa yin te /
translated: It is tenable that they are the same,

original: gang gi phyir gal te gzung ba'i rnam pa gsal ba yang mi bden na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gal te gzung ba'i rnam pa gsal ba yang mi bden na /
translated: because if the clear appearance of the apprehended is not true,

original: rig pa yang bden pa nyid du gang gis rtog par byed /
analyzed: rig pa yang bden pa nyid du gang gis rtog par byed /
translated: then why imagine that the awareness is true?

original: yang gal te rnam par shes pa mi bden pa gsal bar byed na bden pa yang gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: yang gal te rnam par shes pa mi bden pa gsal bar byed na bden pa yang gsal bar byed de /
translated: Moreover, if consciousness is not true, it is clear.

original: bden pas ni nyes pa cung zad kyang byas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pas ni nyes pa cung zad kyang byas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if it is true, it is not clear, because it does not produce any faults.

original: gal te de ltar gzung ba'i rnam pa de gal te gcig gi ngo bo yin na ni phyogs chas byas pa'i 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gal te de ltar gzung ba'i rnam pa de gal te gcig gi ngo bo yin na ni phyogs chas byas pa'i 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa mi 'thad do //
translated: If the clear appearance of the apprehended is the same in essence, it is not tenable that it possesses contradictory properties in part.

original: @157b phyogs cha tha dad pa de yang gcig nyid yin na ni yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig ci'i phyir mi 'dod de khyad par ci yod /
analyzed: @157b phyogs cha tha dad pa de yang gcig nyid yin na ni yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig ci'i phyir mi 'dod de khyad par ci yod /
translated: If that directional part is also one, then why not accept that it is a single substantial entity that has parts? What is the difference?

original: yan lag can gyi rdzas la ni kha bsgyur ba dang ma bsgyur ba yod pa'i phyir 'gal gyi /
analyzed: yan lag can gyi rdzas la ni kha bsgyur ba dang ma bsgyur ba yod pa'i phyir 'gal gyi /
translated: Since a substantial entity that has parts has both that which is changed and that which is not changed, there is a contradiction.

original: blo la ni ma yin pa'i phyir 'di nyid khyad par yin no zhe na /
analyzed: blo la ni ma yin pa'i phyir 'di nyid khyad par yin no zhe na /
translated: But since that is not the case for cognition, this is the difference.

original: shes pa ma yin pa'i rags pa gcig ma shes pa yang rung ste khyad par ci yod de /
analyzed: shes pa ma yin pa'i rags pa gcig ma shes pa yang rung ste khyad par ci yod de /
translated: But if a coarse object that is not cognition, or even if it is not known, what is the difference?

original: blo'i rang bzhin nyid ni rags pa'i nyes pa nyams pa ma yin no //
analyzed: blo'i rang bzhin nyid ni rags pa'i nyes pa nyams pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of cognition itself is not impaired by the fault of coarseness.

original: gzhan yang kha bsgyur ba dang ma bsgyur ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa kho na ni 'gal ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang kha bsgyur ba dang ma bsgyur ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa kho na ni 'gal ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, it is not the case that only that which possesses that which is changed and that which is not changed is contradictory.

original: 'on kyang phyogs cha tha dad pa yang yin no zhes mang du bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyogs cha tha dad pa yang yin no zhes mang du bshad zin to //
translated: But rather, it has directional parts that are different, as has been explained many times.

original: de'i phyogs cha tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis kyang 'gal ba na /
analyzed: de'i phyogs cha tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis kyang 'gal ba na /
translated: If there is a contradiction due to its having directional parts,

original: gal te rnam par shes pa gcig yin na ni yan lag can yang gcig nyid yin la /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa gcig yin na ni yan lag can yang gcig nyid yin la /
translated: If consciousness is one, then the whole would be one also.

original: 'di du ma nyid yin na ni khyad par med pa'i phyir shes pa'i rags pa yang du ma nyid do //
analyzed: 'di du ma nyid yin na ni khyad par med pa'i phyir shes pa'i rags pa yang du ma nyid do //
translated: If it is many, then, since there would be no difference, the grossness of consciousness would be many.

original: gzhan yang rgyu can zhes bya ba ni don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu can zhes bya ba ni don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the so-called cause does not exist ultimately.

original: skad cig ma'i rdzas la ni gang du kha bsgyur ba dang / g-yo ba dang bsgribs pa yod pa dang med pas byas pa'i tha dad pa ma mthong ba de nyid rdzas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rdzas la ni gang du kha bsgyur ba dang / g-yo ba dang bsgribs pa yod pa dang med pas byas pa'i tha dad pa ma mthong ba de nyid rdzas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: In a momentary substance, one does not see a difference made by the presence or absence of color, movement, or obstruction. That is the same substance.

original: g-yo ba la sogs pas byas pa'i tha dad pa'i gnas skabs su tha dad pa mthong bas gzhan du yang rjes su 'jug par byas pa ni ma yin pas tshad ma 'ga' zhig yod pa yin no //
analyzed: g-yo ba la sogs pas byas pa'i tha dad pa'i gnas skabs su tha dad pa mthong bas gzhan du yang rjes su 'jug par byas pa ni ma yin pas tshad ma 'ga' zhig yod pa yin no //
translated: Since one sees a difference in the state made by the difference of movement, etc., it is not made to follow that it is different. Therefore, there is a valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir rags pa thams cad la phyogs gzhan dang 'brel pas cha shas yongs su bcad pa las gyur pa'i 'gal ba'i chos 'du bar mthong bas tha dad pa med pa spang par bya ba yin no zhes rig pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rags pa thams cad la phyogs gzhan dang 'brel pas cha shas yongs su bcad pa las gyur pa'i 'gal ba'i chos 'du bar mthong bas tha dad pa med pa spang par bya ba yin no zhes rig pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all gross objects are related to other directions, and because they are delimited by their parts, they are seen to be the locus of contradictory properties. Thus, they are to be rejected as not being partless.

original: gal te de lta na gzung ba'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin du ma yin na zhe na ;
analyzed: gal te de lta na gzung ba'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin du ma yin na zhe na ;
translated: If that is so, then the nature of the object of apprehension is not multiple.

original: 'di la yang ji ltar rdul phra rab rnams drug gi cig car sbyar bas dngos po med pa de bzhin du shes pa'i rdul phra rab rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la yang ji ltar rdul phra rab rnams drug gi cig car sbyar bas dngos po med pa de bzhin du shes pa'i rdul phra rab rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this regard, just as the nonexistence of an entity is due to the simultaneous conjunction of six atoms, so too it would follow, absurdly, that the atoms of consciousness would also be nonexistent.

original: lus can nyid la skyon 'dir 'gyur gyi lus can ma yin pa la ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: lus can nyid la skyon 'dir 'gyur gyi lus can ma yin pa la ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: This fault would apply only to those who have a body, not to those who do not.

original: lus can zhes bya bar rva zed de ba ni med kyi /
analyzed: lus can zhes bya bar rva zed de ba ni med kyi /
translated: There is no one who has a body that is like a hollow horn.

original: 'on kyang tshad chung du mang po rnams phan tshun gyi rang bzhin gyi yul yongs su spangs nas skyes pa'i phyir yul rgyas pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba ni lus can yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang tshad chung du mang po rnams phan tshun gyi rang bzhin gyi yul yongs su spangs nas skyes pa'i phyir yul rgyas pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba ni lus can yin la /
translated: But many small atoms, having arisen by completely abandoning the nature of their object, would have an extensive object, and they would have a body.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa la yang bye brag med pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu yod par mtshungs par thal bas de ni du mar yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa la yang bye brag med pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu yod par mtshungs par thal bas de ni du mar yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: And that is not reasonable, because it would follow that consciousness would be similar in having conventional existence, since there is no difference in consciousness.

original: gzhan yang @158a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang @158a * //
translated: Moreover,

original: rnam par shes pa'i rdul phra rab nyams su myong bar gyur pa rnams la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rdul phra rab nyams su myong bar gyur pa rnams la /
translated: the experience of the atoms of consciousness

original: rags pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong ba ni bzlog par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rags pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong ba ni bzlog par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: cannot be reversed as the experience of grossness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid gcig la ni rags pa yod pa ma yin zhig / rnam par shes pa'i rdul phra rab mang po rnams kyang so sor rags pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid gcig la ni rags pa yod pa ma yin zhig / rnam par shes pa'i rdul phra rab mang po rnams kyang so sor rags pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: And in a single consciousness there is no grossness, and many atoms of consciousness are not individually gross.

original: ji ltar phyi rol gyi rdul phra rab shes pa gcig la snang ba rnams kyi so sor snang ba'i chos rags pa yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol gyi rdul phra rab shes pa gcig la snang ba rnams kyi so sor snang ba'i chos rags pa yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as external subtle particles that appear to a single cognition are gross phenomena that appear individually,

original: 'dir yang shes pa gcig la snang ba'i phyir rags pa nyid du snang bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang shes pa gcig la snang ba'i phyir rags pa nyid du snang bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: here too, because they appear to a single cognition, they would appear as gross.

original: du ma rnams gzhan 'ga' zhig gis kyang ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ma rnams gzhan 'ga' zhig gis kyang ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not so, because many are not apprehended by anything else.

original: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba'i rjes su 'brangs ba na rags pa gsal bar snang bar nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na nyams su myong ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba'i rjes su 'brangs ba na rags pa gsal bar snang bar nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na nyams su myong ste /
translated: Therefore, when following experience, one would not experience the appearance of a clear gross object.

original: de'i phyir gang dang ldan pas yod pa ma yin pa'i rags pa'i bdag nyid la ston par byed pa shes pa'i med pa gsal bar byed nus pa yang yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang dang ldan pas yod pa ma yin pa'i rags pa'i bdag nyid la ston par byed pa shes pa'i med pa gsal bar byed nus pa yang yod pa nyid do //
translated: But that is experienced. Therefore, that which reveals the non-existent gross nature, the non-existence of cognition, is also possible.

original: rags pa'i rnam pa med na ni rnam par shes pa'i rdul phra rab gzhan ci zhig lus la de brtags pas kyang ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: rags pa'i rnam pa med na ni rnam par shes pa'i rdul phra rab gzhan ci zhig lus la de brtags pas kyang ci zhig bya ste /
translated: If there is no gross aspect, what other subtle particle of consciousness remains? What is the use of postulating it?

original: gang gi phyir rags pa'i rnam pa 'di nyid de kho na nyid ma yin par mi 'gyur ba dang / rnam par shes pa yang med pa gsal bar byed pa'i nus pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir gzung ba'i rnam pa rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du brtags pa yin na gzung ba'i rnam pa mi bden pa dang rnam par shes pa yang med
analyzed: gang gi phyir rags pa'i rnam pa 'di nyid de kho na nyid ma yin par mi 'gyur ba dang / rnam par shes pa yang med pa gsal bar byed pa'i nus pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir gzung ba'i rnam pa rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du brtags pa yin na gzung ba'i rnam pa mi bden pa dang rnam par shes pa yang med
translated: Because this very coarse aspect would not be suchness, and consciousness would not be endowed with the capacity to illuminate the nonexistent, the aspect of the apprehended is imputed to be of the nature of consciousness.üîΩ

original: pa gsal bar byed pa'i nus pa dang ldan par khas blangs na /
analyzed: pa gsal bar byed pa'i nus pa dang ldan par khas blangs na /
translated: Because this very coarse aspect would not be reality, and consciousness would not be endowed with the capacity to illuminate the nonexistent, in order to demonstrate that the aspect of the apprehended is imagined to be the nature of consciousness, you accept that the unreal aspect of the apprehended and consciousness endowed with the capacity to illuminate the nonexistentüîΩare the ultimate.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rdul phra rab rtog pa ni don dam pa yin no //üîΩdags par snang ba rnam par rtog pas sprul pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rdul phra rab rtog pa ni don dam pa yin no // dags par snang ba rnam par rtog pas sprul pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The atom of consciousness is the ultimate.üîΩThe appearance of the manifold as a creation of imagination is illogical,

original: gsal bar snang ba'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa rnams ni gsal bar snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa rnams ni gsal bar snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it appears clearly and because the imaginations do not appear clearly.

original: ji ltar smig rgyu dag la chur rnam par rtog pa gsal bar snang ba de bzhin du rags par rnam par rtog pa yang yin no zhes ni brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: ji ltar smig rgyu dag la chur rnam par rtog pa gsal bar snang ba de bzhin du rags par rnam par rtog pa yang yin no zhes ni brjod par mi nus te /
translated: But it cannot be said that the appearance of grossness is like the appearance of water in a mirage,

original: gang gi phyir smig rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa dang dus gcig tu 'jug pa'i chu'i rnam par rtog pa snang ba dang rnam par brtag pa dag gcig tu byed pa'i phyir gsal bar snang bar nges par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smig rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa dang dus gcig tu 'jug pa'i chu'i rnam par rtog pa snang ba dang rnam par brtag pa dag gcig tu byed pa'i phyir gsal bar snang bar nges par 'gyur na /
translated: because the appearance of the concept of water that occurs simultaneously with the consciousness that apprehends the characteristics of the mirage is definitely not a single entity, since it combines the appearance and the concept.

original: 'dir ni gang zhig dang lhan cig rgyu ba las rags pa'i rnam par rtog pa @158b gsal bar snang bar rtogs par 'gyur ba rags pa nyams su myong ba gsal bar snang ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni gang zhig dang lhan cig rgyu ba las rags pa'i rnam par rtog pa @158b gsal bar snang bar rtogs par 'gyur ba rags pa nyams su myong ba gsal bar snang ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But in this case, there is no appearance of the experience of grossness that would be understood as the appearance of grossness through its simultaneous occurrence with anything else.

original: gzhan yang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa yang bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de kho na nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa yang bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de kho na nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the experience of the nature of the conceptual consciousness itself were the appearance of grossness,

original: de la ni rags pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la ni rags pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But it does not exist in the gross,

original: de'i phyir snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and therefore it does not appear.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rang gi bdag nyid don med pa la don du lhag par zhen nas 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rang gi bdag nyid don med pa la don du lhag par zhen nas 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The conceptual consciousness engages by way of a superimposition of a meaning that does not exist in its own nature.

original: don med pa ston pa ni nges par brtags pa na med pa gsal bar byed pa nyid du gnas pa yin te /üîΩgang gi phyir don med pa gsal ba na bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: don med pa ston pa ni nges par brtags pa na med pa gsal bar byed pa nyid du gnas pa yin te / gang gi phyir don med pa gsal ba na bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa'am /
translated: The teaching of non-existence is established as the clarification of non-existence when it is ascertained.

original: gzhan gsal bar byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gsal bar byed par 'gyur te /
translated: When non-existence is clarified, it clarifies itself or it clarifies another,

original: rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because another mode is impossible.

original: re zhig bdag nyid ni gsal bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig bdag nyid ni gsal bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: First, it does not clarify itself,

original: rnam par shes pa nyid gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / don med pa ni dngos po ma yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / don med pa ni dngos po ma yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: because consciousness itself has the nature of clarity and because non-existence is not a thing.

original: gzhan gyis gsal bar byed na yang de gsal bar byed pa ni shes pa'i bdag nyid de nyid mi bden pa gsal bar byed par skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gsal bar byed na yang de gsal bar byed pa ni shes pa'i bdag nyid de nyid mi bden pa gsal bar byed par skyes pa yin no //
translated: If it is illuminated by another, then that which illuminates it is the nature of consciousness, and it is born as the illumination of what is unreal.

original: 'di snyam du ma rig pa'i dbang gis de ltar gsal ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du ma rig pa'i dbang gis de ltar gsal ba yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is illuminated in that way by the power of ignorance,

original: gal te ma rig pa de dngos po med pa yin na dngos po med pas dngos po med pa gsal bar byed do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi tshul 'di cir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa de dngos po med pa yin na dngos po med pas dngos po med pa gsal bar byed do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi tshul 'di cir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: if that ignorance is a non-entity, then it is not tenable in any way to say that a non-entity illuminates a non-entity.

original: ci ste dngos po yin pa de lta na yang de ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin na de las kyang dngos po med pa ji ltar gsal te /
analyzed: ci ste dngos po yin pa de lta na yang de ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin na de las kyang dngos po med pa ji ltar gsal te /
translated: But if it is an entity, then it is the nature of consciousness, and how could it be illuminated by that?

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag la ni 'brel pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag la ni 'brel pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no connection whatsoever between an entity and a non-entity.

original: de'i phyir ma rig pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i shes pa mi bden pa'i rang bzhin gsal ba'i byed pa yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa'i dbang gis gsal ba yin no zhes brjod pa la ni kha na ma tho ba yong pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i shes pa mi bden pa'i rang bzhin gsal ba'i byed pa yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa'i dbang gis gsal ba yin no zhes brjod pa la ni kha na ma tho ba yong pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since consciousness endowed with the potency of ignorance is the activity of the clear, unreal nature, it is not wrong to say that it is clear by the power of ignorance.

original: de'i phyir de ltar don med par 'dzin pa'i shes pa thams cad mi bden pa gsal bar byed pa'i ma rig pa'i bdag nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar don med par 'dzin pa'i shes pa thams cad mi bden pa gsal bar byed pa'i ma rig pa'i bdag nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, all consciousnesses apprehending unreal objects should be seen as having the nature of ignorance, which is the clear, unreal nature.

original: thams cad du gal te snang ba gang yin pa de thams cad yod pa yin na tshangs pas kyang shes pa 'ba' zhig kyang 'khrul par brtag par mi nus so //
analyzed: thams cad du gal te snang ba gang yin pa de thams cad yod pa yin na tshangs pas kyang shes pa 'ba' zhig kyang 'khrul par brtag par mi nus so //
translated: If everything that appears exists, then even Brahma cannot conceive of a mere consciousness that is mistaken.

original: ci ste mi bden pa yang yod na ni brgya byin gyis kyang /
analyzed: ci ste mi bden pa yang yod na ni brgya byin gyis kyang /
translated: But if something unreal exists, then even Indra cannot deny

original: shes pa mi bden pa gsal bar byed pa'i nus pa bsnyon par mi nus so //
analyzed: shes pa mi bden pa gsal bar byed pa'i nus pa bsnyon par mi nus so //
translated: the potency that makes unreal consciousness clear.

original: 'dod du @159a * //
analyzed: 'dod du @159a * //
translated: If you accept

original: zin kyang nyams su myong ba thams cad bden pa yin par ni sus kyang gzhag par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir shes pa'i mi bden pa gsal ba'i nus pa las 'da' bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: zin kyang nyams su myong ba thams cad bden pa yin par ni sus kyang gzhag par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir shes pa'i mi bden pa gsal ba'i nus pa las 'da' bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: And since no one can posit that all experiences of what is grasped are real, consciousness cannot escape being unreal.

original: mi bden pa'i rang bzhin nyid ma rig pa'i dbang gis ston par byed pa'i bden pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mi bden pa'i rang bzhin nyid ma rig pa'i dbang gis ston par byed pa'i bden pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the nature of unreality is taught by the power of ignorance, for

original: bden pa dang lhan cig 'brel pa nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa dang lhan cig 'brel pa nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is no certainty of a connection with reality.

original: nyams su myong ba nges pa'i rang bzhin mi slu ba ni spang bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba nges pa'i rang bzhin mi slu ba ni spang bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of a nondeceptive experience cannot be rejected,

original: de ni khas blang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni khas blang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it must be accepted.

original: yang gang nyams su myong yang gnod par byed pa mthong ba'i phyir slu ba de ni spang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yang gang nyams su myong yang gnod par byed pa mthong ba'i phyir slu ba de ni spang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: But that which is experienced and yet seen to be harmful is deceptive and so can be rejected,

original: dper na zla ba gnyis kyi rang bzhin lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na zla ba gnyis kyi rang bzhin lta bu'o //
translated: like the nature of two moons.

original: gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir 'khrul pa mi 'grub bo zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir 'khrul pa mi 'grub bo zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will be explained that error is not established because there is no harm.

original: de bzhin du rnam 'grel las kyang /üîΩgnod byed rig pa dam pa ni //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam 'grel las kyang / gnod byed rig pa dam pa ni //
translated: Likewise, the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika says:üîΩIf there is no awareness of the object of

original: med na nyams myong yang bya min //
analyzed: med na nyams myong yang bya min //
translated: refutation, there is no experience of it.

original: zhes so // dga' ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yang dag par rig pa ni spang par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes so // dga' ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yang dag par rig pa ni spang par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The nature of the experience of pleasure, etc. is not to be eliminated,

original: gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no object of refutation.

original: des na gcig ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: des na gcig ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is not the same.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'khrul pa'i shes pa dper brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'khrul pa'i shes pa dper brjod do //
translated: That is why it is given as an example of a mistaken consciousness.

original: gzhan du na sngon po dang sngon po'i rang bzhin dag lhan cig dmigs pas nges pa na tha dad pa yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan du na sngon po dang sngon po'i rang bzhin dag lhan cig dmigs pas nges pa na tha dad pa yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Otherwise, if it were certain that blue and the nature of blue were simultaneously observed, they would not be different.

original: 'on kyang gcig nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'on kyang gcig nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: However, just as they are the same,

original: sngon po dang de'i blo dag kyang zhes bya ba nyid brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon po dang de'i blo dag kyang zhes bya ba nyid brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it would have to be said that blue and the cognition of it are the same.

original: sngon po dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni nyams su myong ba las don gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: sngon po dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni nyams su myong ba las don gzhan pa ste /
translated: The nature that is related to blue is not a different object from the experience,

original: gzhan du gyur pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: it is not different.

original: gtan tshigs kyi don sbyor bar byed pa ni de dag lhan cig pa nyid du dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir zla ba gnyis la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don sbyor bar byed pa ni de dag lhan cig pa nyid du dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir zla ba gnyis la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The statement of the meaning of the reason is: because they are ascertained as observed as coexistent, like two moons.

original: ji ltar 'khrul pa'i shes pa gcig la snang ba'i zla ba gnyis dag lhan cig pa nyid du nges par dmigs pa'i phyir phan tshun dang shes pa las tha dad pa yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di dag la yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khrul pa'i shes pa gcig la snang ba'i zla ba gnyis dag lhan cig pa nyid du nges par dmigs pa'i phyir phan tshun dang shes pa las tha dad pa yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di dag la yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: Just as two moons that appear to a single mistaken consciousness are ascertained as observed as coexistent, and do not exist as different from each other and from the consciousness, so it is with these two.

original: gtan tshigs kyi don rang nyid ston par byed pa ni 'di dag las zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don rang nyid ston par byed pa ni 'di dag las zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The statement of the meaning of the reason is ‚Äúfrom these.‚Äù

original: shes pa dang shes bya 'di dag las shes pa'am shes bya'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya 'di dag las shes pa'am shes bya'i rnam pa ste /
translated: From these, consciousness and objects of consciousness, the aspect of consciousness or the aspect of the object of consciousness

original: rang bzhin gcig ma dmigs na gzhan te gnyis pa dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig ma dmigs na gzhan te gnyis pa dmigs pa med do //
translated: is not observed as different from a single nature, and a second, which is observed as different, does not exist.

original: des na 'di ni nges pa'i don du bstan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na 'di ni nges pa'i don du bstan pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore this is not taught to be definitive.

original: shes bya dmigs @159b pa ni shes pa dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can nyid yin gyi gzhan du ma yin la /
analyzed: shes bya dmigs @159b pa ni shes pa dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can nyid yin gyi gzhan du ma yin la /
translated: The observation of objects of consciousness is the nature of the observation of consciousness, not the other way around.

original: shes pa dmigs pa yang shes bya dmigs pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes gzhan du gyur pa nyid bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa dmigs pa yang shes bya dmigs pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes gzhan du gyur pa nyid bzlog pa yin no //
translated: And the consciousness that observes the object is of the nature of the object‚Äôs observation.

original: gar dang gyad la lta ba la sogs pa rnams la gang shes bya dmigs par mi 'gyur ba'i shes pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //üîΩde bas na shes bya mi dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: gar dang gyad la lta ba la sogs pa rnams la gang shes bya dmigs par mi 'gyur ba'i shes pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no // de bas na shes bya mi dmigs pa'am /
translated: In the case of observing dancing, wrestling, and so on, there is no consciousness that does not observe the object.üîΩTherefore, there is no object of knowledge that is not observed or that is observed without being observed by consciousness.

original: shes pa mi dmigs par shes bya dmigs pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes rnam pa gzhan nyid 'gog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa mi dmigs par shes bya dmigs pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes rnam pa gzhan nyid 'gog pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the otherness of the aspects is refuted,

original: dmigs pa thams cad la tha dad pa nyid 'gog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad la tha dad pa nyid 'gog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the difference of all objects of knowledge.

original: gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis shes bya dang thugs la lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa yod kyang /
analyzed: gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis shes bya dang thugs la lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa yod kyang /
translated: Moreover, it is not correct to say that although the object of knowledge and the mind are ascertained as observed simultaneously,

original: tha dad pa med pa ni ma yin no zhes smras pa de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa ni ma yin no zhes smras pa de ni mi rigs te /
translated: they are not nondifferent.

original: gang gi phyir de la ni lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa nyid med de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la ni lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa nyid med de /
translated: This is because they are not ascertained as observed simultaneously.

original: tha dad pa nyid du rgyud gzhan gyis rang gi sems dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid du rgyud gzhan gyis rang gi sems dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind of another is perceived by a different continuum.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sems dang sems las byung bas kyang 'khrul par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems dang sems las byung bas kyang 'khrul par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the mind and mental factors are not mistaken,

original: de dag rnams kyang so sor bdag nyid yang dag par rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyang so sor bdag nyid yang dag par rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are each individually aware of themselves.

original: gang zhig gcig dmigs pa na cig shos mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de dag la ni 'khrul pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gcig dmigs pa na cig shos mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de dag la ni 'khrul pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no mistake in the case of those who do not perceive one when the other is perceived.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs dmigs pa nyid ni shes bya dmigs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs dmigs pa nyid ni shes bya dmigs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The perception of the mind of the TathƒÅgata is not the perception of the knowable,

original: 'on kyang gzhan yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan yang yod pa yin no //
translated: but rather the perception of something else.

original: gcig gis sam gcig ces bya ba'i phyogs ni khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig gis sam gcig ces bya ba'i phyogs ni khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the position of one or the other is not accepted,

original: de la brjod pa'i skyon mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la brjod pa'i skyon mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: the fault mentioned is not possible.

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa ste /
translated: The difference is in their intrinsic natures.

original: rang bzhin phan tshun dben pa la ni nges par lhan cig tu 'dzin pa 'di 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin phan tshun dben pa la ni nges par lhan cig tu 'dzin pa 'di 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that they are definitely apprehended together, because their intrinsic natures are mutually exclusive.

original: 'brel pa nyid du gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa nyid du gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no reason for them to be related.

original: 'di skad du brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: phan tshun 'brel pa med par ni tha dad pa dag lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa ma yin la /
analyzed: phan tshun 'brel pa med par ni tha dad pa dag lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa ma yin la /
translated: Without mutual relation, it is not ascertained that different things are observed together.

original: de yang re zhig ni bdag nyid kyi rgyu mtshan can du ni rang nyid mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de yang re zhig ni bdag nyid kyi rgyu mtshan can du ni rang nyid mi 'dod do //
translated: Moreover, it is not accepted that the reason is itself.

original: de las byung ba yang me dang du bdag bzhin du lhan cig dmigs par ma nges so //
analyzed: de las byung ba yang me dang du bdag bzhin du lhan cig dmigs par ma nges so //
translated: Nor is it ascertained that fire and smoke are observed together, in the sense that one arises from the other, as in the case of fire and smoke.

original: yul dang yul can gyi mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la ni bkag zin to //
analyzed: yul dang yul can gyi mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la ni bkag zin to //
translated: The definition of object and object-possessor has already been refuted in the context of the theory of aspects.

original: rnam pa med pa'i phyogs la yang khyad par med pa'i shes pa 'ba' zhig nyams su myong ba na khyad par dang ldan par bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i phyogs la yang khyad par med pa'i shes pa 'ba' zhig nyams su myong ba na khyad par dang ldan par bstan par mi nus so //
translated: And in the context of the theory of no aspects, when only a non-differentiated cognition is experienced, it cannot be demonstrated that it has a differentiation.

original: yul yang shes pa dmigs pa las tha dad par @160a * //üîΩdmigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: yul yang shes pa dmigs pa las tha dad par @160a * // dmigs pa ma yin la /
translated: And the object is not observed as different from the observed cognition.

original: shes pa dmigs pa de la yang khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa dmigs pa de la yang khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And in that observed cognition, there is no differentiation.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong ba grub pa ni zlog pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong ba grub pa ni zlog pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The experience of the aspect of the apprehender is not refuted.

original: 'ba' zhig po de la yul so so las khyad par yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig po de la yul so so las khyad par yod pa ma yin la /
translated: And the object is not differentiated from the individual object.

original: ma dmigs pa'i khyad par yang khyad par du rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa'i khyad par yang khyad par du rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: And the difference of non-apprehension is not the cause of positing the difference.

original: des na mngon sum yang dag par rig pa la ni khyad par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na mngon sum yang dag par rig pa la ni khyad par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, there is no difference in the correct cognition of direct perception.üîΩThe conventional difference is based on the object of experience.

original: khyad par gyi tha snyad ni nyams su myong bar gyur pa'i don la brten pa yin no zhes gang smras pa de bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: khyad par gyi tha snyad ni nyams su myong bar gyur pa'i don la brten pa yin no zhes gang smras pa de bsal ba yin te /
translated: This is refuted.

original: gang gi phyir don nyams su myong bar grub na ni rnam par shes pa'i khyad par gyi tha snyad nyams su myong bar gyur pa la brten par gyur na de nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don nyams su myong bar grub na ni rnam par shes pa'i khyad par gyi tha snyad nyams su myong bar gyur pa la brten par gyur na de nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the experience of the object were established, the conventional difference of consciousness would be based on the experienced object. But that is not established.

original: 'di dag ji ltar snang ba bzhin du brtags pa'i tha dad pa ni kho na nyid ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ji ltar snang ba bzhin du brtags pa'i tha dad pa ni kho na nyid ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is said to be the non-difference of the object and consciousness, and the difference of the appearance is not real.

original: des na brtags pa'i tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can lhan cig pa'i sgra sbyar ba'i phyir 'gal ba ci yod /
analyzed: des na brtags pa'i tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can lhan cig pa'i sgra sbyar ba'i phyir 'gal ba ci yod /
translated: Therefore, since the term ‚Äúsimultaneous‚Äù is applied on the basis of the reason of being imputed as different, what contradiction is there?

original: da ni 'brel pa gzhan bsal ba na 'brel pa med par lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa gang yin pa zhes de ltar gtan tshigs khyad par du byas kyang ma grub pa ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: da ni 'brel pa gzhan bsal ba na 'brel pa med par lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa gang yin pa zhes de ltar gtan tshigs khyad par du byas kyang ma grub pa ma yin pa'am /
translated: Now, when other relations are eliminated, the reason is qualified as ‚Äúthat which is ascertained as simultaneous observation without a relation,‚Äù but it is not unestablished.

original: yang na gzungs dang snang ba dag 'khrul pa'i yul nyid du mi gnas pa'i phyir khyad par 'dod pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: yang na gzungs dang snang ba dag 'khrul pa'i yul nyid du mi gnas pa'i phyir khyad par 'dod pa ma yin te ;
translated: Or, since memory and appearance do not abide as objects of error, the distinction is not asserted.

original: de dag gnas na ni khyad par la ltos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gnas na ni khyad par la ltos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they did abide, they would depend on a distinction.

original: des na khyad par med pa gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: des na khyad par med pa gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason is without distinction.

original: gzugs dang snang ba dag gis 'khrul par dogs pa la /
analyzed: gzugs dang snang ba dag gis 'khrul par dogs pa la /
translated: With regard to the doubt of error by form and appearance,

original: bshad pa / gzugs dang snang ba dag la ni de'i shes pa skyed par rung ba gang yin pa de thob pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: bshad pa / gzugs dang snang ba dag la ni de'i shes pa skyed par rung ba gang yin pa de thob pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: it is said: That which is suitable to generate its consciousness in form and appearance has the characteristic of obtaining it or

original: ngo bo gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo gang yin pa'o //
translated: whatever its nature is.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs kyis shes pa skye bar rung ba nyid ni snang ba las thob pa'i phyir snang ba dang 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs kyis shes pa skye bar rung ba nyid ni snang ba las thob pa'i phyir snang ba dang 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Because the suitability of the arising of consciousness from form is obtained from the appearance, it is related to the appearance.

original: dbang po rung ba bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po rung ba bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa yin te /
translated: The suitability of the arising of the sense faculty is characterized by the relation.

original: yul la shes pa skyed par rung ba nyid snang ba las thob pa de'i phyir dbang po nyid rang gi yul gyi shes pa skyed par byed pa snang ba dang 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: yul la shes pa skyed par rung ba nyid snang ba las thob pa de'i phyir dbang po nyid rang gi yul gyi shes pa skyed par byed pa snang ba dang 'brel pa yin no //
translated: The suitability of the arising of consciousness from the object is obtained from the appearance. Therefore, the sense faculty itself, which produces the consciousness of its object, is related to the appearance.

original: de'i phyir gzugs ni snang ba dang lhan cig tu dmigs pa nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs ni snang ba dang lhan cig tu dmigs pa nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, form is ascertained as the object together with the appearance.

original: gtan tshigs bshad pa 'bras bu gzugs sam /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bshad pa 'bras bu gzugs sam /
translated: The reason is explained.

original: smig rgyu snang ba 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smig rgyu snang ba 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the appearance of a mirage is not mistaken.

original: 'bras bu rgyu'i rjes su 'gro ba yod kyang me dang du ba dag la @160b lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa 'khrul par mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu'i rjes su 'gro ba yod kyang me dang du ba dag la @160b lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa 'khrul par mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Even though the effect exists as the consequence of the cause, is it not seen that the simultaneity of the ascertainment of the object is mistaken in the case of fire and smoke?

original: gzugs dang lhan cig gzung ba'i snang ba ni gdon mi za bar gzung bar bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs dang lhan cig gzung ba'i snang ba ni gdon mi za bar gzung bar bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The appearance that is apprehended together with form is definitely apprehended.

original: me dang du ba dag ni gdon mi za bar gzung bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: me dang du ba dag ni gdon mi za bar gzung bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: But fire and smoke are not definitely apprehended.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: snang ba bar chad med pas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: snang ba bar chad med pas zhes gsungs te /
translated: Because the appearance is uninterrupted.

original: gzugs kyi shes pa skyed par rung ba ni bar du chod cing bar mtshams med pa'i snang ba med par mi 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi shes pa skyed par rung ba ni bar du chod cing bar mtshams med pa'i snang ba med par mi 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The consciousness of form is suitable to arise when the appearance is not interrupted and not obstructed.

original: 'di ltar bum pa ni snang ba mang po'i bar du zhugs par skye ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa ni snang ba mang po'i bar du zhugs par skye ba nyid yin na /
translated: In this way, a vase is generated in the midst of many appearances.

original: snang bas shes pa skyed par rung ba skyed pa yin te /
analyzed: snang bas shes pa skyed par rung ba skyed pa yin te /
translated: The appearance that is suitable to generate consciousness generates it.

original: snang bas khyab pa'i gzugs nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang bas khyab pa'i gzugs nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because form that is pervaded by appearance is seen.

original: gal te mig gis gzung bar bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na ni snang ba bar chad med pa nyid yin yang lhan cig spyod pa'i reg pa la sogs pa ltar gzung bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te mig gis gzung bar bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na ni snang ba bar chad med pa nyid yin yang lhan cig spyod pa'i reg pa la sogs pa ltar gzung bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: If it is not the nature of what is apprehended by the eye, then even if the appearance is uninterrupted, it is not apprehended, like the contact that accompanies it.

original: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa des na gzugs dang lhan cig gdon mi za bar gzung bar bya ba yin no ;
analyzed: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa des na gzugs dang lhan cig gdon mi za bar gzung bar bya ba yin no ;
translated: Since it is the nature of the object, it is necessarily apprehended together with form.

original: / dmigs pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa dag las gcig 'dzin par nges par byed pa'i rgyu ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / dmigs pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa dag las gcig 'dzin par nges par byed pa'i rgyu ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And there is no cause whatsoever that determines that one of the objects of perception is apprehended.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dus mtshungs pa'i gzugs dang snang ba dag kho na gsal bar bya ba dang gsal bar byed pa'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dus mtshungs pa'i gzugs dang snang ba dag kho na gsal bar bya ba dang gsal bar byed pa'i dngos po yin no //
translated: Therefore, form and light that are simultaneous in time are the things that illuminate and are illuminated.

original: de yang snang ba gzugs kyi rgyu las gzhan du 'thad pa ma yin pa de'i phyir rgyu'i dngos po rgyu mtshan du 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang snang ba gzugs kyi rgyu las gzhan du 'thad pa ma yin pa de'i phyir rgyu'i dngos po rgyu mtshan du 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, it is not tenable that light is a cause of form that is other than it. Therefore, the state of being a cause is asserted to be the reason.

original: rgyu dngos po nyid ni gsal bar byed pa'i ngo bo ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dngos po nyid ni gsal bar byed pa'i ngo bo ma yin no //
translated: The state of being a cause is not the nature of illumination.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyi yul na gnas pa nyid kyi snang ba ni mig dang rang gi rgyun skyed par byed pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyi yul na gnas pa nyid kyi snang ba ni mig dang rang gi rgyun skyed par byed pa /
translated: Similarly, light that exists in the domain of form generates the eye and its own continuum.

original: de las kyang gzugs snang ba dang bar chad med pa de'i phyir snang ba dang yul lhan cig tu mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: de las kyang gzugs snang ba dang bar chad med pa de'i phyir snang ba dang yul lhan cig tu mthong ba nyid do //
translated: Moreover, form and light are seen simultaneously because form is seen without obstruction.

original: snang ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid kyi me ni du ba'i skyed par byed pa ma yin pa des de dag la lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: snang ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid kyi me ni du ba'i skyed par byed pa ma yin pa des de dag la lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa med pa yin no //
translated: Since fire is not the cause of smoke, it is not certain that they are always perceived together.

original: de ltar na yang gzugs dang snang ba dag ni shes pa gcig gi yul gyi dngos po la phan tshun 'brel pa yin gyi ;
analyzed: de ltar na yang gzugs dang snang ba dag ni shes pa gcig gi yul gyi dngos po la phan tshun 'brel pa yin gyi ;
translated: In this way, form and light are the objects of a single cognition, and they are mutually related.

original: shes pa dang shes bya dag ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya dag ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But this is not the case with cognition and the cognized.

original: yang na gzugs dang snang ba dag la ni lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na gzugs dang snang ba dag la ni lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, form and light are not ascertained to be always perceived together,

original: gzugs dang bral ba'i snang ba 'ba' zhig kyang mthong ba'i phyir dang / snang ba med pa'i gzugs kyang byi ba la sogs pa'i srog chags kyi bye brag 'ga' @161a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang bral ba'i snang ba 'ba' zhig kyang mthong ba'i phyir dang / snang ba med pa'i gzugs kyang byi ba la sogs pa'i srog chags kyi bye brag 'ga' @161a * //
translated: because one sees light alone, without form, and form without light, as when some creatures such as mice, etc.,

original: zhig gis mthong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhig gis mthong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: see in the dark.

original: sngon bo'i dam ba dang rig pa dag ni lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: sngon bo'i dam ba dang rig pa dag ni lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa nyid do //
translated: The former and latter excellent scholars are certain that they are simultaneously perceived.

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa ste bral ba la ni de rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa ste bral ba la ni de rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable for them to be different in nature, or separate.

original: sngon po dang ser po dag bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po dag bzhin no //
translated: It is like blue and yellow.

original: gang gi phyir de dag ni phan tshun tha dad pa dang 'brel pa yang 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag ni phan tshun tha dad pa dang 'brel pa yang 'ga' yang med de /
translated: Because they are not related to each other in any way,

original: des na lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not certain that they are simultaneously perceived.

original: shes pa dang shes bya dmigs pa gcig nyid do zhes ji ltar brjod de /
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya dmigs pa gcig nyid do zhes ji ltar brjod de /
translated: How can it be said that consciousness and the object of consciousness are the same in being perceived?

original: gang gi phyir yul ni sngar dmigs te shes pa'i rgyu yin pas de ni sngar nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul ni sngar dmigs te shes pa'i rgyu yin pas de ni sngar nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object is perceived first, it is the cause of consciousness. It is closer.

original: de'i 'bras bu shes pa ni phyis nye ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu shes pa ni phyis nye ba yin la /
translated: The result of that, consciousness, is closer.

original: nye ba de'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i 'dzin pa'i gzhan skye pa des na ;üîΩyul gyi shes pa ni rang gi 'bras bu'i dus na dmigs la /
analyzed: nye ba de'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i 'dzin pa'i gzhan skye pa des na ; yul gyi shes pa ni rang gi 'bras bu'i dus na dmigs la /
translated: Because of the arising of the apprehender, which is the result of that,üîΩthe consciousness of the object is perceived at the time of its result.

original: yul ni rang gi 'bras bu shes pa'i dus na yin no //
