original: des na ste de'i phyir blo ni tshul gnyis te yul gyi rang bzhin gzung ba dang / shes pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa dag gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyis tshul gnyis su grub pa yin no //
analyzed: des na ste de'i phyir blo ni tshul gnyis te yul gyi rang bzhin gzung ba dang / shes pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa dag gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyis tshul gnyis su grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mind is twofold: it is the apprehender of the nature of the object and the apprehender of the nature of consciousness. It is established as twofold in terms of the nature of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: cig shos kyis snang ba shes pa las tha mi dad na phyi rol mi 'grub par rtogs pas ga las shes smra ste /
analyzed: cig shos kyis snang ba shes pa las tha mi dad na phyi rol mi 'grub par rtogs pas ga las shes smra ste /
translated: If the other, the appearance, is not different from consciousness, how do you know that external objects are not established?

original: mngon sum du grub pa de tha dad pa'i dngos po ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum du grub pa de tha dad pa'i dngos po ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that direct perception establishes them, they are not different things.

original: 'o na de yod par nges par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de yod par nges par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How then do you ascertain that they exist?

original: slob dpon gzu bor gnas par gyur nas smras pa /
analyzed: slob dpon gzu bor gnas par gyur nas smras pa /
translated: The master, having become sincere, said:

original: phyi rol ni 'bras bu ldog pa la ste /
analyzed: phyi rol ni 'bras bu ldog pa la ste /
translated: External objects are established from the cessation of the effect.

original: dngos po med pa las 'grub ste nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa las 'grub ste nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are established from the nonexistence of things.

original: dper na rgyu gzhan yod kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa res 'ga' 'gyur ba las mig rjes su dpog la /
analyzed: dper na rgyu gzhan yod kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa res 'ga' 'gyur ba las mig rjes su dpog la /
translated: For example, even when other causes exist, sometimes the eye consciousness changes, and from that the eye is inferred.

original: @166b de bzhin du nus pa'i rgyu gzhan dbang po dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid yod kyang 'bras bu rtsig pa la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir rjes su dpog la rgyu gzhan gang yin pa de yang phyi rol gyiüîΩdon yin par 'gyur ro //üîΩgal te rtsod pa 'dir rnam par shes par smra 'ba' zhig nye bar len pa ste bag chags yongs su smin pa de nyid ni khyad par yin te /
analyzed: @166b de bzhin du nus pa'i rgyu gzhan dbang po dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid yod kyang 'bras bu rtsig pa la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir rjes su dpog la rgyu gzhan gang yin pa de yang phyi rol gyi don yin par 'gyur ro // gal te rtsod pa 'dir rnam par shes par smra 'ba' zhig nye bar len pa ste bag chags yongs su smin pa de nyid ni khyad par yin te /
translated: If you say that the cause of the potential is the ripening of latent propensities alone, then the cause of the potential is the ripening of latent propensities alone.üîΩIf you say that the cause of the potential is the ripening of latent propensities alone, then the cause of the potential is the ripening of latent propensities alone.üîΩIf you say that the cause of the potential is the ripening of latent propensities alone, then the cause of the potential is the ripening of latent propensities alone.üîΩIf you say that the cause of the potential is the ripening of latent propensities alone, then the cause of the potential is the ripening of latent propensities alone.

original: phyi rol gyi lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen gzhan las khyad par du gyur pa de med pas 'bras bu ldog pa ste /üîΩmed par mi smra na ni /üîΩldog pa'i sgo nas 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen gzhan las khyad par du gyur pa de med pas 'bras bu ldog pa ste / med par mi smra na ni / ldog pa'i sgo nas 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that the cause of the potential is the ripening of latent propensities alone, then the cause of the potential is the ripening of latent propensities alone.üîΩIf you say that the cause of the potential is the ripening of latent propensities alone, then the cause of the potential is the ripening of latent propensities alone.üîΩIf you say that the cause of the potential is the ripening of latent propensities alone, then the cause of the potential is the ripening of latent propensities alone.üîΩIf you say that the cause of the potential is the ripening of latent propensities alone, then the cause of the potential is the ripening of latent propensities alone.

original: gal te rig par smra ba de yang kho bo dag la smra ba na rang gi phyogs la tshad ma dang cig shos ji ltar smra ci zhig byed pa na zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rig par smra ba de yang kho bo dag la smra ba na rang gi phyogs la tshad ma dang cig shos ji ltar smra ci zhig byed pa na zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cause of the potential is the ripening of latent propensities alone, then the cause of the potential is the ripening of latent propensities alone.

original: smras pa shes pa thams cad kyi yul bzlog pa na'o //
analyzed: smras pa shes pa thams cad kyi yul bzlog pa na'o //
translated: Response: When the objects of all consciousnesses are refuted.

original: de ltar byed pas tshad ma dang cig shos rnam par gzhag par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar byed pas tshad ma dang cig shos rnam par gzhag par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na smras pa /
translated: If one acts in that way, how is the presentation of valid knowledge and the other established?

original: bslad pa dang cig shos te /
analyzed: bslad pa dang cig shos te /
translated: Response: The adulterated and the other.

original: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa de nyid ni de dag dang 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa de nyid ni de dag dang 'brel pa yin la /
translated: That very valid knowledge and invalid knowledge are related to them.

original: gang zhig thams cad bslad par smra ba des ji ltar bslad pa dang ma bslad pa dang 'brel pa tshad ma dang cig shos rnam par 'jog te /
analyzed: gang zhig thams cad bslad par smra ba des ji ltar bslad pa dang ma bslad pa dang 'brel pa tshad ma dang cig shos rnam par 'jog te /
translated: But how could one who claims that everything is adulterated present the relationship between the adulterated and the nonadulterated as the presentation of valid knowledge and the other?

original: mi bzhag pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi bzhag pa nyid do //
translated: It is not presented at all.

original: gtan tshigs smras pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs smras pa /
translated: The reason is stated:

original: shes pa thams cad nye bar bslad par chad par med pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa thams cad nye bar bslad par chad par med pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because it is not possible that all consciousnesses are adulterated.

original: slob dpon gyis de la yang rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis de la yang rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: The master says that in response to that, in order to demonstrate the presentation, it is said:

original: nye bar bslad pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags de 'tshams sbyor ba med pa ni rjes su mi sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: nye bar bslad pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags de 'tshams sbyor ba med pa ni rjes su mi sbyor ba ste /
translated: The latent potentialities of the ignorance that is adulteration are not connected, that is, they are not related,

original: rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu byed pa med ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu byed pa med ba'o //
translated: because they do not produce a concordant effect.

original: de nyid ni skyon te skyon des na shes pa des bcug pa'i tha snyad la yid brtan med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni skyon te skyon des na shes pa des bcug pa'i tha snyad la yid brtan med pa ste /
translated: That is the fault. Because of that fault, the conventional that is posited by that consciousness is not reliable.

original: yid ches pa byar med par mthong bas rtogs pa gcig ni tshad ma ma yin par brjod do //
analyzed: yid ches pa byar med par mthong bas rtogs pa gcig ni tshad ma ma yin par brjod do //
translated: Because it is seen to be unreliable, it is said that one cognition is not a valid cognition.

original: gal te don dam pa'i rig pa tha snyad thams cad la yid brtan pa med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don dam pa'i rig pa tha snyad thams cad la yid brtan pa med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt the knowledge of ultimate reality unreliable with respect to all conventions?‚ÄùüîΩThat is true, but it is not unreliable for the unwise, that is, for those who are childish.

original: bden te / mi mkhas pas kyang ste tha snyad gang zhig byis pas kyang yid brtan du med pa des na tshad ma ma yin par rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: bden te / mi mkhas pas kyang ste tha snyad gang zhig byis pas kyang yid brtan du med pa des na tshad ma ma yin par rnam par 'jog go //
translated: That is why it is posited as a valid cognition.

original: mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i bag chags des ni sngon por snang ba'i blo 'ba' zhig bskyed de /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i bag chags des ni sngon por snang ba'i blo 'ba' zhig bskyed de /
translated: That latent ten dency that does not connect generates only a cognition that appears as blue.

original: de'i don byed par snang ba rnam par rig pas bag chags rgyas par mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i don byed par snang ba rnam par rig pas bag chags rgyas par mi byed do //
translated: The cognition that appears to function with respect to that object does not cause the latent ten dency to increase.

original: des na sngon por snang ba'i shes pa 'ba' zhig skyed kyi /
analyzed: des na sngon por snang ba'i shes pa 'ba' zhig skyed kyi /
translated: Therefore, it generates only a cognition that appears as blue.

original: snang ba de'i bsgrub par bya ba'i don du snang ba'i shes pa ni skyed pa ma yin no //üîΩyang dag pa'i chu'i 'bras bu ni dus ji srid par gos dang lus bangs pa'i gnas skabs dang / de bzhin du dus dang lus la ltos @167a * //
analyzed: snang ba de'i bsgrub par bya ba'i don du snang ba'i shes pa ni skyed pa ma yin no // yang dag pa'i chu'i 'bras bu ni dus ji srid par gos dang lus bangs pa'i gnas skabs dang / de bzhin du dus dang lus la ltos @167a * //
translated: The consciousness that appears as the object to be established by that appearance does not generate it.

original: nas dus ji srid khyab kyi bar du grang ba'i rig pa'i gnas skabs dang / lus rgyas pa dang / lci ba'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid rang bzhin yongs su 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: nas dus ji srid khyab kyi bar du grang ba'i rig pa'i gnas skabs dang / lus rgyas pa dang / lci ba'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid rang bzhin yongs su 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: The result of the true water is the state of washing the body and clothes for as long as the occasion lasts, and likewise, in dependence on time and body, for as long as the occasion lasts, the state of the sensation of cold, and the characteristics of the state of the body‚Äôs growth and heaviness are the complete transformation of the nature.

original: de'i gnas skabs su ni bden pa'i chu dang 'brel pa'i don bya ba 'di dag gi rang gi ngo bor 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa ma skyed pa des na /
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs su ni bden pa'i chu dang 'brel pa'i don bya ba 'di dag gi rang gi ngo bor 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa ma skyed pa des na /
translated: At that time, since the consciousness that apprehends the entity of these objects connected with true water is not generated,

original: chur snang ba'i rnam par shes pa slu ba yin te /
analyzed: chur snang ba'i rnam par shes pa slu ba yin te /
translated: the consciousness that appears as water is deceptive.

original: des na tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: des na tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not a valid cognition.

original: yang rnam par shes par gzhan 'khor ba ji srid par zhes bya bas ngas rgyas kyi go 'phang thob kyi bar du mthong ba'i don gyi 'bras bur snang ba'i shes pa'i chogs mi 'bral bar rjes su 'brel pa gang yin pa de ni tshad mar brjod do zhes
analyzed: yang rnam par shes par gzhan 'khor ba ji srid par zhes bya bas ngas rgyas kyi go 'phang thob kyi bar du mthong ba'i don gyi 'bras bur snang ba'i shes pa'i chogs mi 'bral bar rjes su 'brel pa gang yin pa de ni tshad mar brjod do zhes
translated: The phrase ‚Äúuntil the attainment of the state of a Buddha‚Äù indicates that the collection of consciousnesses that appear as the results of the objects of perception are not separated from the state of a Buddha.

original: 'brel to // ci'i phyir 'bras bu'i shes pa dang mi 'bul zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel to // ci'i phyir 'bras bu'i shes pa dang mi 'bul zhe na /
translated: Why is the result consciousness not separated from the state of a Buddha?

original: bag chags brtan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags brtan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the latent impressions are stable.

original: chur snang ba'i shes pa'i bag chags ni chur snang ba'i shes pa skyed par byed cing /
analyzed: chur snang ba'i shes pa'i bag chags ni chur snang ba'i shes pa skyed par byed cing /
translated: The latent impressions of the consciousness that appears as water generate the consciousness that appears as water.

original: chu'i bsgrub par bya bar snang ba'i shes pa'i bag chags kyang rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: chu'i bsgrub par bya bar snang ba'i shes pa'i bag chags kyang rgyas par byed do //
translated: They also cause the latent impressions of the consciousness that appears as the object of the establishment of water to increase.

original: des na bag chags de las chur snang ba'i shes pa dang / bag chags yongs su smin pa dang ldan pa'i chu'i 'bras bu snang ba'i shes pa rim gyis skye ba'i phyi mi 'bral bar rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: des na bag chags de las chur snang ba'i shes pa dang / bag chags yongs su smin pa dang ldan pa'i chu'i 'bras bu snang ba'i shes pa rim gyis skye ba'i phyi mi 'bral bar rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the consciousness that appears as water arises from those latent impressions, and the consciousness that appears as the result of water, which possesses the full ripening of the latent impressions, arises in sequence.

original: yang dper na phyi rol gyi don smra ba la yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid las yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'ga' zhig skyes pa ni /
analyzed: yang dper na phyi rol gyi don smra ba la yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid las yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'ga' zhig skyes pa ni /
translated: For example, for those who assert external objects, some mental consciousnesses arise from the mental consciousness itself.üîΩThe imprints of the consciousness that has ceased are placed in the continuum. When those imprints are fully ripened by the passage of time, they generate a consciousness that is similar to the former consciousness.

original: 'gag pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyud las bag chags gzhag pa de dus mthar phyin pas yongs su smin par byas pa na yang snga ma dang 'dra ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyud las bag chags gzhag pa de dus mthar phyin pas yongs su smin par byas pa na yang snga ma dang 'dra ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way, for those who assert consciousness, the imprints of the consciousness that has ceased are placed in the continuum. When those imprints are fully ripened by the passage of time, they generate a consciousness that is similar to the former consciousness.

original: rnam par shes par smra ba las yang yin pas pha rol po'i nyes pa'i skabs yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes par smra ba las yang yin pas pha rol po'i nyes pa'i skabs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the opponent‚Äôs fault does not exist.

original: gal te thams cad mkhyen pa'i mkhyen pa la ltos na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad mkhyen pa'i mkhyen pa la ltos na /
translated: If one relies on the omniscience of the Buddha,

original: shes pa 'di thams cad slu ba yin pa de ltar na yang 'khor ba 'di na thar pa'i snga rol du byis pa'i skye bos byas pa'i tha snyad gang yin pa de la mi slu ba de la ltos nas tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa 'di thams cad slu ba yin pa de ltar na yang 'khor ba 'di na thar pa'i snga rol du byis pa'i skye bos byas pa'i tha snyad gang yin pa de la mi slu ba de la ltos nas tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: all of these consciousnesses are deceptive. However, in this cyclic existence, the conventions that are created by na√Øve, ordinary beings are undeceiving. Therefore, in reliance on that, they are valid cognitions.

original: sangs rgyas pa nyid kyi gnas skabs la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa nyid kyi gnas skabs la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not dependent on the state of being a buddha.

original: don dam pa'i tshul la ltos nas mi slu ba gang yin pa de tshad mar brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: don dam pa'i tshul la ltos nas mi slu ba gang yin pa de tshad mar brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: If nondeception is dependent on the mode of the ultimate, then that is said to be valid knowledge.

original: tha snyad la ltos pas ni ma yin pa yin nam zhe na /üîΩ'di ni tha snyad kyi dgos pa can tha snyad kyi 'bras bu can /
analyzed: tha snyad la ltos pas ni ma yin pa yin nam zhe na / 'di ni tha snyad kyi dgos pa can tha snyad kyi 'bras bu can /
translated: But is it not the case that it is not dependent on conventional usage?

original: kun tu tha snyad pa'i tshad ma'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: kun tu tha snyad pa'i tshad ma'i rang bzhin te /
translated: This is the nature of valid knowledge that is conventional, which has a conventional purpose and a conventional result.

original: mtshan nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is the statement of the definition.

original: des na kun du tha snyad pa'i yul can nyid tshad ma dang chad ma ma yin pa @167b yin no //
analyzed: des na kun du tha snyad pa'i yul can nyid tshad ma dang chad ma ma yin pa @167b yin no //
translated: Therefore, the subject that is conventional is valid knowledge and not nonvalid knowledge.

original: don dam pa la 'jug pa'i don du tshad ma'i mtshan nyid bshad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: don dam pa la 'jug pa'i don du tshad ma'i mtshan nyid bshad pa yin gyi /
translated: The definition of valid knowledge is stated for the purpose of engaging with the ultimate.

original: mi bden pa'i yul can ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mi bden pa'i yul can ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that it does not have a nontrue object?

original: 'di ltar bdag dang gzhan mi bden pa'i rang bzhin spangs pa dang / bden pa'i rang bzhin thob par bya ba'i phyir mkhas pa rtsol par rig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag dang gzhan mi bden pa'i rang bzhin spangs pa dang / bden pa'i rang bzhin thob par bya ba'i phyir mkhas pa rtsol par rig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In this way, it is known that the wise strive to abandon the unreal nature of self and other and to attain the real nature.

original: 'di la yang zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes smos te /
translated: Here, also is stated.

original: gal te tha snyad la rab tu sbyor ba'i shes pa 'di la yang 'jig rten rmongs par ma gyur na ni don dam pa'i shes pa 'ba' zhig gi mtshan nyid bshad par rigs pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te tha snyad la rab tu sbyor ba'i shes pa 'di la yang 'jig rten rmongs par ma gyur na ni don dam pa'i shes pa 'ba' zhig gi mtshan nyid bshad par rigs pa yin na /
translated: If the world were not confused about this conventional knowledge, then it would be appropriate to explain the characteristic of the knowledge of the ultimate alone.

original: gang gi tshe 'di la yang gzhan dag bdag nyid rmongs shing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di la yang gzhan dag bdag nyid rmongs shing /
translated: But when others are confused about this,

original: gzhan yang rmongs par byed pa de'i tshe de dag don dam pa'i tshul la 'jug pa'i skabs ga la yod /
analyzed: gzhan yang rmongs par byed pa de'i tshe de dag don dam pa'i tshul la 'jug pa'i skabs ga la yod /
translated: and when they cause others to be confused, then how can there be an occasion for them to engage in the way of the ultimate?

original: don dam pa'i tshul la 'jug par bya ba kho na'i phyir kun du tha snyad pa'i shes pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i tshul la 'jug par bya ba kho na'i phyir kun du tha snyad pa'i shes pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: The conventional knowledge is explained only for the sake of engaging in the way of the ultimate.

original: bsams pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni tshul 'dis kyang skye bo don dam pa'i tshul la gzhug par nus pa yin no zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni tshul 'dis kyang skye bo don dam pa'i tshul la gzhug par nus pa yin no zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: The phrase arising from reflection shows that this method is able to introduce beings to the way of the ultimate.

original: 'di la kun du tha snyad pa'i tshad ma'i de kho na bshad na rigs pa'i tshul de nyid kyis don sems pa la zhugs pa na /
analyzed: 'di la kun du tha snyad pa'i tshad ma'i de kho na bshad na rigs pa'i tshul de nyid kyis don sems pa la zhugs pa na /
translated: If the reality of conventional valid knowledge is explained here, then by that very method of reasoning, when one engages in reflecting on the meaning,

original: de'i rgyu las byung ba'i shes rab khyad par du 'phags pa'i don snang ba'i blo goms par byas /
analyzed: de'i rgyu las byung ba'i shes rab khyad par du 'phags pa'i don snang ba'i blo goms par byas /
translated: The wisdom that arises from its cause is the mind that is accustomed to the appearance of the special object.

original: 'dris par byas pas rnam par 'khrul pas dben zhing bral ba dri ma med pa yongs su dag pa'i phyir phyogs pas na ldog pa ste don dam par las phyir ldog pa'o//
analyzed: 'dris par byas pas rnam par 'khrul pas dben zhing bral ba dri ma med pa yongs su dag pa'i phyir phyogs pas na ldog pa ste don dam par las phyir ldog pa'o//
translated: By being accustomed to it, it is turned away from the contaminated, because it is free from error and is stainless and completely pure.

original: de la ldog pa ni ldog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de la ldog pa ni ldog pa med pa ste /
translated: In that regard, ‚Äúturning away‚Äù is non-turning away.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is ‚Äúnot turning back.‚Äù

original: yang na ldog pa ni skyon yin la /
analyzed: yang na ldog pa ni skyon yin la /
translated: Or, ‚Äúturning away‚Äù is a fault.

original: 'khor bar slar ldog pa yang skyon yin no //
analyzed: 'khor bar slar ldog pa yang skyon yin no //
translated: Turning back into cyclic existence is also a fault.

original: de gang la med pa de ni ldog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de gang la med pa de ni ldog pa med pa'o //
translated: That which is free from that is ‚Äúwithout turning away.‚Äù

original: don dam par ni de kho na nyid kyi yul lam dgongs pa dam pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni de kho na nyid kyi yul lam dgongs pa dam pa'o //
translated: In the ultimate, it is the object of reality, or the highest intention.

original: de la rab tu sbyor ba ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: de la rab tu sbyor ba ni don dam pa'o //
translated: Application to that is the ultimate.

original: mngon du byed pa ni skyed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon du byed pa ni skyed pa'o //
translated: Actualization is production.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this:

original: don dam pa'i tshad ma yang rgyu med par ni ma yin la /
analyzed: don dam pa'i tshad ma yang rgyu med par ni ma yin la /
translated: The ultimate valid cognition is not without a cause.

original: rgyu yang goms pa las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu yang goms pa las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The cause of that is nothing other than familiarity.

original: goms pa'i yul yang kun du tha snyad pa'i tshad mas dpyad pa'i don yin pa de'i phyir kun du tha snyad pa'i tshad ma de yang dag par rtogs pa ni don dam pa pa'i shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: goms pa'i yul yang kun du tha snyad pa'i tshad mas dpyad pa'i don yin pa de'i phyir kun du tha snyad pa'i tshad ma de yang dag par rtogs pa ni don dam pa pa'i shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro ;
translated: The object of familiarity is the object analyzed by conventional valid knowledge. Therefore, that conventional valid knowledge is the cause of the realization of the ultimate consciousness.

original: / de nas de'i yul can gyi 'bad pa ni don dam pa'i yul can nyid do //
analyzed: / de nas de'i yul can gyi 'bad pa ni don dam pa'i yul can nyid do //
translated: Then, the exertion of the subject is the subject of the ultimate.

original: log pa'i shes pas yul du byas pa'i dngos po rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bsgoms pa ni don dam pa'i shes pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: log pa'i shes pas yul du byas pa'i dngos po rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bsgoms pa ni don dam pa'i shes pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur la /
translated: The cultivation of the aspect of a permanent thing, etc., which is the object of a mistaken consciousness, is not the cause of the ultimate consciousness.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bsgoms na ni 'gyur ba nyid yin pa des na /üîΩskye bo de las rmongs @168a * //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bsgoms na ni 'gyur ba nyid yin pa des na / skye bo de las rmongs @168a * //
translated: But if the cultivation of the aspect of impermanence, etc., is the cause.

original: pa bzlog nas don dam pa pa'i shes pa la 'jug par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: pa bzlog nas don dam pa pa'i shes pa la 'jug par bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, having turned people away from that delusion, they should be made to enter into the ultimate consciousness.

original: rmongs pa 'di'i yul ni rags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmongs pa 'di'i yul ni rags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of this delusion is gross.

original: don dam pa thob pa yang rmongs pa 'di log pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir 'di nyid la 'bad par rigs so //
analyzed: don dam pa thob pa yang rmongs pa 'di log pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir 'di nyid la 'bad par rigs so //
translated: And the attainment of the ultimate is preceded by the cessation of this delusion, so it is proper to strive for just this.

original: de phyir yang dag yang dag min //
analyzed: de phyir yang dag yang dag min //
translated: Therefore, correct and incorrect,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par nges pa 'dir ni ji ltar kun du tha snyad pa'i shes pa'i rim gyis /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par nges pa 'dir ni ji ltar kun du tha snyad pa'i shes pa'i rim gyis /
translated: and so on. In this ascertainment, the ultimate cognition is just as it is taught by the sequence of conventional cognition.

original: don dam pa pa'i shes pa de'i tshe ste /
analyzed: don dam pa pa'i shes pa de'i tshe ste /
translated: At that time,

original: bag tsam zhig bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: bag tsam zhig bstan pa yin la /
translated: only a small part is taught.

original: de ci 'dra ba'i tshad ma yin pa de'i yang cha tsam zhig bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ci 'dra ba'i tshad ma yin pa de'i yang cha tsam zhig bstan pa yin te /
translated: And of what kind of valid cognition that is, only a small part is taught.

original: de ni mngon sum gyi rang bzhin gyi tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum gyi rang bzhin gyi tshad ma yin no //
translated: That is a valid cognition of the nature of direct perception.

original: gal te don dam pa'i shes pa de ni gzung ba dang ; 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: gal te don dam pa'i shes pa de ni gzung ba dang ; 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba'am /
translated: If that ultimate cognition is free from the aspects of apprehended and apprehender,

original: don thams cad kyang 'dzin pa yin yang bla ste /
analyzed: don thams cad kyang 'dzin pa yin yang bla ste /
translated: or if all objects are apprehended,

original: gnyi ga ltar na yang de ni mngon sum nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar na yang de ni mngon sum nyid yin no //
translated: in both cases it is direct perception.

original: tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i 'grel bshad /
analyzed: tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i 'grel bshad /
translated: Commentary on Ascertainment of Valid Cognition

original: slob dpon chos mchog gis sbyar ba las le'u dang po'o /
analyzed: slob dpon chos mchog gis sbyar ba las le'u dang po'o /
translated: This concludes the first chapter, concerning the nature of valid cognitions, from the Ornament of the Middle Way.

original: // / stong phrag bzhi dang gsum dang bzhi //
analyzed: // / stong phrag bzhi dang gsum dang bzhi //
translated: Four thousand, three hundred and four,

original: brgya phrag lnga dang drug dang gsum //
analyzed: brgya phrag lnga dang drug dang gsum //
translated: five hundred and sixty, and three hundred,

original: nyi shu gnyis dang sum cu ste //
analyzed: nyi shu gnyis dang sum cu ste //
translated: twenty-two and thirty‚Äî

original: de ni gnyis drug gsum bcas so //
analyzed: de ni gnyis drug gsum bcas so //
translated: that is two times six plus three.

original: le'u dang po 'di la tshigs su bcad pa bzhi stong lnga brgya nyi shu rtsa gnyis yod do /
analyzed: le'u dang po 'di la tshigs su bcad pa bzhi stong lnga brgya nyi shu rtsa gnyis yod do /
translated: This first chapter has four thousand, five hundred and twenty-two verses.

original: // / mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i bye brag gis tshad ma gnyis su bstan pa las log par rtogs pa rnam pa bzhi bsal ba'i sgo nas mngon sum bshad zin nas /
analyzed: // / mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i bye brag gis tshad ma gnyis su bstan pa las log par rtogs pa rnam pa bzhi bsal ba'i sgo nas mngon sum bshad zin nas /
translated: Having explained direct perception in terms of the elimination of the four kinds of misconceptions in the context of the two valid cognitions, perception and inference,

original: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du skabs su so //
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du skabs su so //
translated: the author now explains inference.

original: ji ltar shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mngon sum bzhi char la rtogs pa bsal ba'i don du /
analyzed: ji ltar shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mngon sum bzhi char la rtogs pa bsal ba'i don du /
translated: In order to eliminate misconceptions about the four kinds of direct perception, which are characterized by knowledge,

original: rjes dpag rnams gnyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rjes dpag rnams gnyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: the author states, ‚ÄúInference is of two kinds.‚Äù

original: ji ltar shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mngon sum bzhi char la yang mtshan nyid thun mong ba gcig yod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mngon sum bzhi char la yang mtshan nyid thun mong ba gcig yod pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as there is a single common characteristic of the four types of direct perception that are characterized by knowledge,

original: rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis la ni mtshan nyid gcig yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis la ni mtshan nyid gcig yod pa ma yin te /
translated: there is not a single characteristic of the two types of inference.

original: rang bzhin shin tu tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin shin tu tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their natures are very different.

original: de la gcig ni shes pa yin la /
analyzed: de la gcig ni shes pa yin la /
translated: One of them is knowledge,

original: gzhan ni brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni brjod pa yin no //
translated: and the other is verbal expression.

original: rnam pa'i dbye ba brjod na ni rnam pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad par bstan par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa'i dbye ba brjod na ni rnam pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad par bstan par nus pa yin no //
translated: If we were to discuss their different aspects, we could demonstrate that their characteristics are different.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir mtshan nyid tsam bstan na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir mtshan nyid tsam bstan na /
translated: Therefore, when we teach their characteristics here,

original: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid gcig gam du mar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid gcig gam du mar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: we teach their characteristics as being either the same or different.üîΩWhat is the point of teaching their number?

original: de'i grangs bstan pas ci zhig bya zhes gang brtsad pa de spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i grangs bstan pas ci zhig bya zhes gang brtsad pa de spangs pa yin no //
translated: This is the response to that objection.

original: 'di ltar gsal ba'i khyad par nye bar bstan pa med par ni gsal ba so sor nges pa'i mtshan nyid bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gsal ba'i khyad par nye bar bstan pa med par ni gsal ba so sor nges pa'i mtshan nyid bstan par mi nus so //
translated: Without teaching the particularities of the manifestation of the characteristics, it is not possible to teach the characteristics that are ascertained for each manifestation.

original: des na gsal ba'i @168b dbye ba ni bstan par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: des na gsal ba'i @168b dbye ba ni bstan par bya ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the division of the manifestation is what is to be taught.

original: rnam pa'i dbye ba yang gsal ba'i dbye ba nyid yin pa des na /
analyzed: rnam pa'i dbye ba yang gsal ba'i dbye ba nyid yin pa des na /
translated: And the division of the mode is the division of the manifestation itself.

original: rnam pa'i dbye ba brjod pa ni mtshan nyid rtogs par bya ba'i don kho na yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa'i dbye ba brjod pa ni mtshan nyid rtogs par bya ba'i don kho na yin no //
translated: Thus, the statement of the division of the mode is for the sake of understanding the definition.

original: 'di rang gi ched yin pas na rang gi don la /
analyzed: 'di rang gi ched yin pas na rang gi don la /
translated: It is for one's own sake, so it is for one's own purpose.

original: gzhan gyi ched du yin pas na gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ched du yin pas na gzhan gyi don to //
translated: It is for the sake of others, so it is for the sake of others.

original: rang la dogs pa dang gzhan la dgos pa'o //
analyzed: rang la dogs pa dang gzhan la dgos pa'o //
translated: It is for one's own doubt and for the need of others.

original: rjes su dpag pa gang zhig rgyur gyur pas rang rtogs par 'gyur ba de ni rang gi don te shes pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gang zhig rgyur gyur pas rang rtogs par 'gyur ba de ni rang gi don te shes pa yin no //
translated: That inference which is the cause for one's own understanding is for one's own purpose, that is, for one's own understanding.

original: gal te rtogs pa ni shes pa nyid yin pa de lta na yang gcig nyid la yang bya ba dang byed pa las tha dad par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa ni shes pa nyid yin pa de lta na yang gcig nyid la yang bya ba dang byed pa las tha dad par bstan pa yin te /
translated: Even if understanding is itself understanding, it is taught as different from the action and agent in one thing.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa ni byed pa yin la /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa ni byed pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, inference is the agent.

original: khong du chud pa'i rang bzhin 'bras bu'i gnas skabs ni rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: khong du chud pa'i rang bzhin 'bras bu'i gnas skabs ni rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The state of the result, which has the nature of being understood, is understanding.

original: gal te skyes bu la nges pa'i tshul gsum pa'i rtags yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te skyes bu la nges pa'i tshul gsum pa'i rtags yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: But the sign of the triply characterized person does not exist.

original: de las skyes pa'i shes pa yang med la /
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i shes pa yang med la /
translated: Nor does the consciousness that arises from it exist.

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa yang med pa yin te /üîΩdes na rjes su dpag pa gang zhig bdag nyid kyi yin la /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa yang med pa yin te / des na rjes su dpag pa gang zhig bdag nyid kyi yin la /
translated: Nor does the expression of the triply characterized sign exist.

original: gzhan gyi ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ma yin pa'am /
translated: So how could there be any inference that is one‚Äôs own but not that of others,üîΩor that is that of others but not one‚Äôs own?

original: gzhan gyi yin la bdag nyid kyi ma yin pa de yod dam ci gang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yin la bdag nyid kyi ma yin pa de yod dam ci gang /
translated: What is that?

original: 'di ltar sgras kyang res 'ga' smra ba po 'di rtogs par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgras kyang res 'ga' smra ba po 'di rtogs par byed pa yin la /
translated: In this way, sometimes the sound itself causes one to understand the speaker,

original: res 'ga'i tshe ni gzhan la sgras rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: res 'ga'i tshe ni gzhan la sgras rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: and sometimes the sound causes one to understand another.

original: de las kyang ci srid du sgra yang gzhan don yin par ma nges pa ma yin nam zhes dgos pa la /
analyzed: de las kyang ci srid du sgra yang gzhan don yin par ma nges pa ma yin nam zhes dgos pa la /
translated: In response to the question, ‚ÄúHow could it be that even sound is not ascertained to be the object of another?‚Äù

original: bshad pa shes pa dang brjod pa'i go rims bzhin du rang bzhin gang dag yin pa de dag gi ngo bo de rgyur gyur pa'i las /
analyzed: bshad pa shes pa dang brjod pa'i go rims bzhin du rang bzhin gang dag yin pa de dag gi ngo bo de rgyur gyur pa'i las /
translated: The explanation is that the nature of those that are the nature of the object and the nature of the expression is the karma that is the cause.

original: gzhan de pha rol dang gzhan ma yin pa de nyid te /
analyzed: gzhan de pha rol dang gzhan ma yin pa de nyid te /
translated: The other is the other side, and that which is not other is that itself.

original: gzhan dag gzhan ma yin pa de dag gi rtogs pa'i rgyu rgyu mtshan ni rjes su dpag pa de dag ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag gzhan ma yin pa de dag gi rtogs pa'i rgyu rgyu mtshan ni rjes su dpag pa de dag ma yin no //
translated: The reason for the understanding of the other by the other is not the inference.

original: des na don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i shes pa gang gi rgyud la skyes pa de ni de'i don de nyid de /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i shes pa gang gi rgyud la skyes pa de ni de'i don de nyid de /
translated: The cognition that arises from a reason having the three modes is the object of that cognition.

original: des na gzhan rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na gzhan rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not the understanding of another.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin don du brjod pa yin gyi gang la ltos nas rang gi don du brjod par 'gyur ba shes pa 'ga' yang skyes bu 'ga' la nges pa yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin don du brjod pa yin gyi gang la ltos nas rang gi don du brjod par 'gyur ba shes pa 'ga' yang skyes bu 'ga' la nges pa yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the object of itself. But there is no certainty for any person that any cognition has arisen that would be said to be the object of itself, in dependence on which it would be said to be the object of itself.

original: de bzhin du brjod pa'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa skyes bu la nges pa yod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang gzhan gyi don nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du brjod pa'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa skyes bu la nges pa yod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang gzhan gyi don nyid yin no //
translated: In the same way, although the inference of the nature of the statement does not exist for a person, it is still for the sake of another.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig gang gi dbang du byas nas 'jug pa de ni don yin par brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig gang gi dbang du byas nas 'jug pa de ni don yin par brjod do //
translated: Thus, that which is engaged in dependence on something is said to be the object of that.

original: sgra ni gzhan gyi dbang du byas nas sbyor ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sgra ni gzhan gyi dbang du byas nas sbyor ba yin gyi /
translated: Sound is applied in dependence on another,

original: bdag nyid kyi ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi ni ma yin gyi /
translated: not on its own.

original: des na sgra gzhan gyi don du ma nges pa ma yin @169a * //
analyzed: des na sgra gzhan gyi don du ma nges pa ma yin @169a * //
translated: Therefore, sound is not uncertain with regard to another‚Äôs meaning.

original: no ; / gang gi phyir sbyor ba po mngon par 'dod pa'i yul gyi don la sbyor bar byed pa gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: no ; / gang gi phyir sbyor ba po mngon par 'dod pa'i yul gyi don la sbyor bar byed pa gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the one who applies it applies it to the object that is the one he desires.

original: gal te sgra gzhan gyi don yin pa de lta na yang rjes su dpag pa yin pa nyid kyis rang gi don las sgra la logs shig tu brjod pa smra bar ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: gal te sgra gzhan gyi don yin pa de lta na yang rjes su dpag pa yin pa nyid kyis rang gi don las sgra la logs shig tu brjod pa smra bar ni mi rigs te /
translated: Even if sound is another‚Äôs meaning, it is not reasonable to say that it is separate from its own meaning because of being an inference.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference.

original: de la dgos pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par yod grang na /
analyzed: de la dgos pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par yod grang na /
translated: If there is a difference in the definition of the purpose,

original: de la gnag zhig brjod par bya ba'i rtags des bsgrub par bya ba'i de nyid sgra'i don kyang yin pa'i phyir yul khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gnag zhig brjod par bya ba'i rtags des bsgrub par bya ba'i de nyid sgra'i don kyang yin pa'i phyir yul khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: then what is to be said? Because the object of the sign is the meaning of the word, there is no difference in the object.

original: 'di la rang gi ngo bor 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyang cung zad yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la rang gi ngo bor 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyang cung zad yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor does it have the slightest characteristic of being its own nature.

original: sgra ni rjod par byed pa tsam yin pa'i phyir 'di la mtshan nyid gzhan ci zhig brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra ni rjod par byed pa tsam yin pa'i phyir 'di la mtshan nyid gzhan ci zhig brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since sound is merely expressive, what other characteristic could be expressed?üîΩBut the characteristic is expressed in dependence on what is to be expressed.

original: brjod par bya ba la ltos nas ni mtshan nyid brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro / tshul gsum pa'i rtags 'chad pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir brjod par bya ba yang rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa
analyzed: brjod par bya ba la ltos nas ni mtshan nyid brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro / tshul gsum pa'i rtags 'chad pa ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir brjod par bya ba yang rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa
translated: Since the statement of the trimodal mark is for the sake of others' understanding, the object of expression is the inference for oneself,

original: de nyid 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: de nyid 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: which is just that.

original: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir brjod par nus pa ma yin gyi tshul gsum pa'i rtags nyid bsnyad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir brjod par nus pa ma yin gyi tshul gsum pa'i rtags nyid bsnyad par bya ba yin no //
translated: Since the inference for oneself is of the nature of cognition, it cannot be expressed, but the trimodal mark itself is to be stated.

original: des na brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid la yang khyad par yod pa ma yin no zhes pha rol po dogs pa la /
analyzed: des na brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid la yang khyad par yod pa ma yin no zhes pha rol po dogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, even the characteristic of the object of expression is not different.üîΩTo address the opponent's doubt,

original: lan du ma yin te zhes gsungs te ;
analyzed: lan du ma yin te zhes gsungs te ;
translated: The response is not so.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir logs shig tu brjod par mi bya'o zhes gang smras pa de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir logs shig tu brjod par mi bya'o zhes gang smras pa de ni ma yin te /
translated: You said that because there is no difference, it is not to be stated separately. That is not so,

original: 'jug pa tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jug pa tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: because there is a difference in engagement.

original: bya ba'i khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba'i khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is a difference in action.

original: brgyud pas yul khyad par med pa yin yang dngos kyis 'di dag gi bya ba ni tha dad yod pa yin no //
analyzed: brgyud pas yul khyad par med pa yin yang dngos kyis 'di dag gi bya ba ni tha dad yod pa yin no //
translated: Although the object is not different in terms of the continuum, there is a difference in the action of these two.

original: khyad par de nyid ston par byed de /
analyzed: khyad par de nyid ston par byed de /
translated: He shows that very difference.

original: don te tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa'i brjod bya rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni rtags can bsgrub par bya ba'i don rtogs par byed pa yin la bsgrub par bya ba'i don de'i go bar byed pa'i rtags ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags
analyzed: don te tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa'i brjod bya rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni rtags can bsgrub par bya ba'i don rtogs par byed pa yin la bsgrub par bya ba'i don de'i go bar byed pa'i rtags ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags
translated: The meaning is that the statement of the sign having three modes is called inference for oneself. It is that which causes the possessor of the sign to understand the meaning to be proven. The sign that causes understanding of that meaning to be proven is the sign having three modes.

original: brjod par grags pa'i sgras yin no //
analyzed: brjod par grags pa'i sgras yin no //
translated: It is by means of a term that is renowned as an expression.

original: cig shos ni khyad par 'dis tha dad pa brjod par mi rigs te /
analyzed: cig shos ni khyad par 'dis tha dad pa brjod par mi rigs te /
translated: The other is not suitable to be stated as different by this difference.

original: 'di ltar bsgrub bya'i dbye bas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid rnam pa du ma yin yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsgrub bya'i dbye bas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid rnam pa du ma yin yang /
translated: Thus, the natural inferential sign itself has many varieties because of the varieties of the probandum.

original: de tsam gyis ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid tha dad par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid tha dad par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But that alone does not make the definition of the inferential sign different.

original: de ltar gyur na rjod par byed pa'i bya ba'i khyad par yod kyang brjod par bya ba'i sgo nas mtshan nyid gzhan brjod par byar @169b med pa'i phyir logs shig tu brjod par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na rjod par byed pa'i bya ba'i khyad par yod kyang brjod par bya ba'i sgo nas mtshan nyid gzhan brjod par byar @169b med pa'i phyir logs shig tu brjod par mi rigs so //
translated: If that were the case, although there is a difference in the activity of the expression, it is not possible to express a different definition by way of the expressed object, and therefore it is not reasonable to express it separately.

original: 'di snyam du tshul gsum pa'i rtags bshad pas ni rtogs par bya ba rtags shes par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di snyam du tshul gsum pa'i rtags bshad pas ni rtogs par bya ba rtags shes par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúBy explaining the trimodal criterion, the object to be understood becomes known through the inferential sign,

original: tshig shes par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: tshig shes par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: but the words do not become known,

original: de'i phyir tshig gi ni rim pa bstan par bya ba nyid yin no zhes dogs na /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig gi ni rim pa bstan par bya ba nyid yin no zhes dogs na /
translated: therefore the order of the words must be taught,‚Äù

original: ci ltar mtshan nyid brjod pa nyid kyis tshig gi rim pa yang bstan par 'gyur ba de bstan pa'i phyir go bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid ston par byed de //
analyzed: ci ltar mtshan nyid brjod pa nyid kyis tshig gi rim pa yang bstan par 'gyur ba de bstan pa'i phyir go bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid ston par byed de //
translated: in order to show how the definition itself teaches the order of the words, he teaches the definition of the indicator.

original: du ba dang byas pa la sogs pa'i dngos po gang phyogs sam sgra 'ga' zhig tu mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa 'ga' zhig gis mthong ba nges pa ste /
analyzed: du ba dang byas pa la sogs pa'i dngos po gang phyogs sam sgra 'ga' zhig tu mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa 'ga' zhig gis mthong ba nges pa ste /
translated: Smoke and the like, which are things, are seen by some means of valid knowledge, direct perception or inference, in some place or time.

original: 'dis ni phyogs kyi chos nyid brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyogs kyi chos nyid brjod do //
translated: This expresses the property of the subject.

original: mthong ba'i du ba la sogs pa de me dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba gang dang de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag gis 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i du ba la sogs pa de me dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba gang dang de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag gis 'brel pa'o //
translated: That seen smoke and so on are related to the probandum, fire and impermanence, by identity and origination.

original: 'brel pa shes pa ni de shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa shes pa ni de shes pa ste /
translated: Knowledge of the relation is the knowledge of that.

original: rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the understanding.

original: 'dis ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i stobs kyi rjes su 'gro ldog dag nges pa dang / rjes su dpag pa'i dus su de gnyis dran pa yang bshad par lta'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i stobs kyi rjes su 'gro ldog dag nges pa dang / rjes su dpag pa'i dus su de gnyis dran pa yang bshad par lta'o //
translated: This shows that the ascertainment of positive and negative concomitance by the power of invalidating valid knowledge and the memory of those two at the time of inference are explained.

original: 'di thams cad kyis ni rtogs pa po'i go bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa dang / rjes su dpag pa'i dus kyi dran pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyis ni rtogs pa po'i go bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa dang / rjes su dpag pa'i dus kyi dran pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: All of this explains the understanding of the one who comprehends, the definition of knowledge, and the memory at the time of inference.

original: 'brel pa shes shing dran pa'i rtags chos can la mthong ba dang ldan pa'i rtogs pa po de la 'brel pa'i yul gyi bsgrub bya de /
analyzed: 'brel pa shes shing dran pa'i rtags chos can la mthong ba dang ldan pa'i rtogs pa po de la 'brel pa'i yul gyi bsgrub bya de /
translated: The one who has the realization of seeing the evidence of the relationship and memory on the subject,

original: rtags nges gang du mthong ba de nyid du go bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rtags nges gang du mthong ba de nyid du go bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: that one understands the probandum of the object of the relationship right where one sees the evidence.üîΩIt is not elsewhere.

original: chos can gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes de ltar mtshan nyid brjod pa las brjod par bya ba'i rtags kyi dngos po rtogs te /
analyzed: chos can gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes de ltar mtshan nyid brjod pa las brjod par bya ba'i rtags kyi dngos po rtogs te /
translated: In that way, one understands the entity of the evidence that is to be expressed from the expression of the definition.

original: nges pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa yin no //
translated: It is ascertained.

original: de la dngos po de rtogs pa yin na go bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid brjod pas rtogs par 'dod pa'i rjod byed kyi rim pa ste tshul bstan par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de la dngos po de rtogs pa yin na go bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid brjod pas rtogs par 'dod pa'i rjod byed kyi rim pa ste tshul bstan par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If one understands that entity, the expression of the definition that causes understanding will have been taught, and the sequence or method of the expression that is to be understood will have been taught.

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: rang gi bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa shes pa'i don gang du mthong ba der rtogs par byed pa la /
analyzed: rang gi bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa shes pa'i don gang du mthong ba der rtogs par byed pa la /
translated: The one who understands the object that is related to one‚Äôs probandum will understand right where one sees the evidence.

original: de go bar byed pa yin no zhes de ltar shes pa la /
analyzed: de go bar byed pa yin no zhes de ltar shes pa la /
translated: That is what causes understanding.

original: don 'di gzhan la nye bar ston pa na rang gi bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa dang / phyogs 'ga' zhig dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin nye bar bstan par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: don 'di gzhan la nye bar ston pa na rang gi bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa dang / phyogs 'ga' zhig dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin nye bar bstan par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di yang yod pa yin no //
translated: When one teaches this meaning to others, one should teach the nature of the reason that is related to one‚Äôs own probandum and that is related to some part of it.

original: gzhan du phyin ci log tu brjod na go bar byed pa'i chos rang bzhin nges pa'i yul gang yin pa de ma bstan par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan du phyin ci log tu brjod na go bar byed pa'i chos rang bzhin nges pa'i yul gang yin pa de ma bstan par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: This is the rule. If one states the reason in a different way, then the property that is the basis for the understanding is not taught, because it is not stated.

original: ma @170a * //üîΩbshad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma @170a * // bshad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not taught.

original: ci ltar go bar byed par shes pa de ltar bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: ci ltar go bar byed par shes pa de ltar bstan par bya ste /
translated: One should teach the reason in the way that it is understood.

original: gzhan du bstan na ni gzhan nyid du bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du bstan na ni gzhan nyid du bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one teaches it in a different way, then it is taught in a different way.

original: gal te go bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid brjod pa gzhan la bsgrub par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te go bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid brjod pa gzhan la bsgrub par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the statement of the definition of the reason a proof for others?

original: 'di ni 'di ltar brjod par bya'o zhes rjod par byed pa'i rim pa mi shes na ci ltar bsgrub par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di ltar brjod par bya'o zhes rjod par byed pa'i rim pa mi shes na ci ltar bsgrub par bya zhe na /
translated: If one does not know the order in which one should state, ‚ÄúThis should be stated in this way,‚Äù how can one prove it?

original: 'di ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /üîΩtshig shes pa sgra'i don rig pa ni don nyid nye bar bstan pa la ltos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni gang gi phyir gyi don te / tshig shes pa sgra'i don rig pa ni don nyid nye bar bstan pa la ltos pa yin gyi /
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúbecause.‚ÄùüîΩThe knowledge of words, the awareness of the meaning of the words, depends on the demonstration of the meaning itself.

original: ci ltar rnam pa gnag gis shes pa de nyid ni yang rtogs par bya ba'i phyir nye bar bstan pa gzhan te rang gi ngo bo'i yul can gyi nye bar bstan pa las /
analyzed: ci ltar rnam pa gnag gis shes pa de nyid ni yang rtogs par bya ba'i phyir nye bar bstan pa gzhan te rang gi ngo bo'i yul can gyi nye bar bstan pa las /
translated: But the demonstration of the meaning is not dependent on the demonstration of the other, the speaker, in order to make known the meaning that is already known by the form of the words.

original: gzhan pha rol po dag gis nye bar bstan pa la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan pha rol po dag gis nye bar bstan pa la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: The demonstration of the meaning is not dependent on the demonstration of the other, the speaker, in order to make known the meaning that is already known by the form of the words.

original: de'i phyir tshig shes pa don gyi rang bzhin yongs su shes pa nye bar bstan pa gzhan la ltos par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig shes pa don gyi rang bzhin yongs su shes pa nye bar bstan pa gzhan la ltos par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of words, the awareness of the nature of the meaning, depends on the demonstration of the meaning.

original: de'i rjod par byed pa yongs su shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rjod par byed pa yongs su shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the awareness of the expression is not dependent on the demonstration of the meaning.

original: don ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i dus su yongs su bcad pa yin la /
analyzed: don ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i dus su yongs su bcad pa yin la /
translated: The meaning is ascertained at the time of the inference for oneself.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa de ni rjod par byed pa tsam yin pa'i phyir logs shig tu brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa de ni rjod par byed pa tsam yin pa'i phyir logs shig tu brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The inference for the sake of others is not to be stated separately, because it is merely the expression of that.

original: slob dpon gyis rjes su brjod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis rjes su brjod pa gsungs pa /
translated: The master responds:

original: nye bar bstan pa la ltos pa ma yin pa dang / tshig shes pa la mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de ltar bden mod kyi 'on kyang ci ltar yang dag pa'i shes pa yang mkhas pa la bstan pa'i don du brtsams pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa la ltos pa ma yin pa dang / tshig shes pa la mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de ltar bden mod kyi 'on kyang ci ltar yang dag pa'i shes pa yang mkhas pa la bstan pa'i don du brtsams pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is true that the teaching does not depend on demonstration, and that the definition is not stated for the sake of knowing the word. However, just as the correct consciousness is not composed for the sake of teaching the wise,

original: 'on kyang rang nyid rtogs par mi nus pa de dag la yin pa de bzhin du tshig kyang rang nyid brjod par mi nus pa la ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang nyid rtogs par mi nus pa de dag la yin pa de bzhin du tshig kyang rang nyid brjod par mi nus pa la ston pa yin no //
translated: in the same way, the word is not taught for the sake of expressing itself, which is incapable of doing so.

original: 'di nyid rjod par byed pa ni brtsams pa gang yin pa ni byis pas rtogs pa'i rgyur yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid rjod par byed pa ni brtsams pa gang yin pa ni byis pas rtogs pa'i rgyur yin no //
translated: This is what the author intends to express. The composition is for the sake of understanding the childish.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni rtogs par mi nus pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni rtogs par mi nus pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't the correct consciousness incapable of understanding?

original: sgra don gyi 'brel pa shes pa don shes kyang de rtogs par byed pa'i sgra'i sbyor ba mi shes pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis mi shes pa ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: sgra don gyi 'brel pa shes pa don shes kyang de rtogs par byed pa'i sgra'i sbyor ba mi shes pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis mi shes pa ston par mdzad de /
translated: The master teaches the unknown, in order to avert the doubt that one who knows the meaning does not know the application of the words that cause its understanding.

original: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du rtags las ma 'das par rtags can gyi don rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du rtags las ma 'das par rtags can gyi don rtogs pa ste /
translated: The object of the mark is understood just as it is, without going beyond the mark.

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags du ba las bsgrub bya rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags du ba las bsgrub bya rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The probandum is understood from the mark having the three modes, such as smoke.

original: de ltar rtogs kyang rtags de bzhin du smra ba brjod pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs kyang rtags de bzhin du smra ba brjod pa mthong ngo //
translated: Even though it is understood in that way, one sees the expression of the mark as it is spoken.

original: gzhan nyid ston par byed pa ni rtags de'i chos te ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ma khyab par zin pa dang / ldog pa lhag pa de dag gis zhes bya ba de @170b lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ston par byed pa ni rtags de'i chos te ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ma khyab par zin pa dang / ldog pa lhag pa de dag gis zhes bya ba de @170b lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid gsum pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of difference is the property of that mark, and that nature is not pervaded by the inclusion of the reversed remainder. Those are the three characteristics that are like that.

original: gnas pa spong ba dang lhag pa ston pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnas pa spong ba dang lhag pa ston pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is in order to abandon the remaining and to teach the remainder.

original: rigs pa can la sogs pa dag rtags de'i chos yod pa btang nas lhag pa dang ldan par smra ba yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa can la sogs pa dag rtags de'i chos yod pa btang nas lhag pa dang ldan par smra ba yin no //
translated: The NaiyƒÅyikas and others, having abandoned the property of the reason, speak of the remainder as the reason.

original: ma khyab par ston par byed pa ni med na mi 'byung ba de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa mi brjod pa'i phyir ma khyab pa brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: ma khyab par ston par byed pa ni med na mi 'byung ba de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa mi brjod pa'i phyir ma khyab pa brjod pa yin te /
translated: The demonstration of nonpervasion is the statement of nonpervasion because it does not state the relation that is the nature of the invariable relation of identity or causality.

original: rtags ni med na mi 'byung bas go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rtags ni med na mi 'byung bas go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The reason is understood through the invariable relation.üîΩThe demonstration of the remainder is

original: lhag pa ston par byed de /
analyzed: lhag pa ston par byed de /
translated: the demonstration of the remainder.

original: nye bar sdud pa ni nye bar gtod pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar sdud pa ni nye bar gtod pa'o //
translated: The summary is the application.

original: dpe la nus pa mthong ba'i rtags yang bsgrub bya'i chos can la sdud pa de ni nye bar sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: dpe la nus pa mthong ba'i rtags yang bsgrub bya'i chos can la sdud pa de ni nye bar sdud pa yin no //
translated: The summary is the application of the seen capacity in the example to the property of the subject of the thesis.

original: de yang mthun pa'i dpe la ltos nas de bzhin du sgra yang byas pa yin no zhes de ltar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang mthun pa'i dpe la ltos nas de bzhin du sgra yang byas pa yin no zhes de ltar bya ba yin te /
translated: That is done in this way: Sound is also a product in the same way.

original: des na nye bar gtod pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: des na nye bar gtod pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is called the application.

original: nye bar sdom pa ni nye bar gtod pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar sdom pa ni nye bar gtod pa yin no //
translated: The summary is the application.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i don bca' ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i don bca' ba'i don to //
translated: The purpose of the statement is to establish the point to be proven.

original: de zlos pa ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de zlos pa ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: The conclusion is the reiteration of that.

original: de yang nus pa mthong ba'i gtan tshigs chos can la nye bar bsdus pa'i bya ba log par rtogs pa bzlog pa'i don du de'i phyir sgra mi rtag go zhes mjug sdud pa'i rang bzhin yin par blta'o //
analyzed: de yang nus pa mthong ba'i gtan tshigs chos can la nye bar bsdus pa'i bya ba log par rtogs pa bzlog pa'i don du de'i phyir sgra mi rtag go zhes mjug sdud pa'i rang bzhin yin par blta'o //
translated: And that is seen to be the purpose of the statement, ‚ÄúSound is impermanent,‚Äù which is the nature of the conclusion, in order to reverse the understanding that the activity of the reason, which is the property of the subject, is negated.

original: 'di dag gi brjod pa yang de dag gi sbyor bas tha dad par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gi brjod pa yang de dag gi sbyor bas tha dad par brjod pa yin no //
translated: The statement of these is also expressed as different applications of them.

original: dpe la brten nas med na mi byung bar shes pa'i gtan tshigs chos can la sngar bstan pa nyid na chos can dang 'brel pa nges pa yin te ;
analyzed: dpe la brten nas med na mi byung bar shes pa'i gtan tshigs chos can la sngar bstan pa nyid na chos can dang 'brel pa nges pa yin te ;
translated: When the reason, which is known to be invariably concomitant with the example, is applied to the subject, the relation of the reason to the subject is ascertained.

original: de la nye bar gtad pa ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de la nye bar gtad pa ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of applying it to the subject?

original: med na mi 'byung bar rab tu grub pa'i gtan tshigs ni rang nyid kyi bsgrub par bya ba'i yang 'ga' zhig yod par ston par byed de /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung bar rab tu grub pa'i gtan tshigs ni rang nyid kyi bsgrub par bya ba'i yang 'ga' zhig yod par ston par byed de /
translated: A reason that is established as invariably concomitant shows that the probandum exists somewhere.

original: med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is invariably concomitant.

original: de la gtan tshigs kyi yul la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la gtan tshigs kyi yul la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the object of the reason is non-erroneous.

original: de bzlog pa'i don du mjug bsdu bas kyang cung zad kyang byan med do //
analyzed: de bzlog pa'i don du mjug bsdu bas kyang cung zad kyang byan med do //
translated: In order to refute that, the summary is not useless at all.

original: des na byis pa rtogs par bya ba'i don dang / log par rtogs pa yang mthong ba'i phyir brjod par bya ba'i mtshan tha dad pa med kyang sgrub par byed pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa brjod par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na byis pa rtogs par bya ba'i don dang / log par rtogs pa yang mthong ba'i phyir brjod par bya ba'i mtshan tha dad pa med kyang sgrub par byed pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa brjod par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, although the expression is not different, the expression of inference for the sake of others is itself taught in order to teach the stages of proof, for the sake of understanding for the childish and also for seeing wrong understanding.

original: de ltar rnam par dbye ba bstan nas mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par dbye ba bstan nas mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Having thus taught the divisions, in order to teach the characteristics, it is said:

original: de las rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa dag gi nang nas /
analyzed: de las rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa dag gi nang nas /
translated: From among those, inference for one's own sake and inference for the sake of others,

original: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni /
translated: inference for one's own sake is as follows:

original: tshul gsum gang yod pa ni tshul gsum rtags te /
analyzed: tshul gsum gang yod pa ni tshul gsum rtags te /
translated: That which has the three modes is the reason with the three modes.

original: de las lkog tu gyur pa'i don mthong ba ni shes pa ste /
analyzed: de las lkog tu gyur pa'i don mthong ba ni shes pa ste /
translated: Seeing the hidden object from that is knowledge.

original: nges pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa yin no //
translated: It is ascertainment.

original: gal te tshul gsum pa'i rtags las rang @171a * //
analyzed: gal te tshul gsum pa'i rtags las rang @171a * //
translated: If it is argued that the three modes of the reason are not established, then it would follow that the subject is not established.üîΩ

original: bdag nyid la yang shes pa skye pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag nyid la yang shes pa skye pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt knowledge produced in the self itself from a reason having the three modes?

original: mod las lkog tu gyur pa'i don ni smos pa ma byas te /
analyzed: mod las lkog tu gyur pa'i don ni smos pa ma byas te /
translated: But the object that is to be inferred is not mentioned.

original: des na tshul gsum pa'i rtags smos pa nyid kyis de mthong ba rjes su dpag par thal bar ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: des na tshul gsum pa'i rtags smos pa nyid kyis de mthong ba rjes su dpag par thal bar ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na smras pa /
translated: So why shouldn‚Äôt it follow that by mentioning a reason having the three modes, seeing that is inferred?

original: rtags ni go bar byed pa yin pa /
analyzed: rtags ni go bar byed pa yin pa /
translated: A reason is that which causes understanding.

original: go bar byed ba'i yang bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa shes shing dran pa yin no //
analyzed: go bar byed ba'i yang bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa shes shing dran pa yin no //
translated: And that which causes understanding is the knowledge of the relation between the probandum and the sign, and the memory of that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dran pas bar du chod pa'i rtags go bar byed pa 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dran pas bar du chod pa'i rtags go bar byed pa 'dod pa yin te /
translated: For that very reason, it is accepted that a reason that is interrupted by memory causes understanding,

original: bsgrub bya med na ma 'byung ba 'dren pas bar du chod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub bya med na ma 'byung ba 'dren pas bar du chod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is interrupted by the bringing in of the probandum that does not occur if the probandum is absent.

original: de'i rang gi yul can gyi mthong ba skyes pa'i dus na ni rtags nyid dngos po nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i rang gi yul can gyi mthong ba skyes pa'i dus na ni rtags nyid dngos po nyid yin te /
translated: When the seeing that has that as its object is produced, the reason itself is a thing.

original: da rung du yang rtags su grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: da rung du yang rtags su grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not yet established as a reason.

original: 'brel pa mthong ba zhing dran pas skyes pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni shugs kyis rtags kyis shes pa las gzhan nyid du gyur ba'i lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can du gnas so //
analyzed: 'brel pa mthong ba zhing dran pas skyes pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni shugs kyis rtags kyis shes pa las gzhan nyid du gyur ba'i lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can du gnas so //
translated: The cognition that arises from the recollection of the object that was seen in the relation is different from the cognition that is obtained by implication from the reason. It is a cognition of a hidden object.

original: shugs kyis thob pa de nyid ston pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs pa de ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: shugs kyis thob pa de nyid ston pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs pa de ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The statement that the same is obtained by implication is ‚ÄúThe understanding of the object to be inferred is inference for oneself.‚Äù

original: de ltar mtshan nyid bstan nas 'bras bu la log par rtogs pa sel par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid bstan nas 'bras bu la log par rtogs pa sel par byed do //
translated: Having thus taught the definition, he removes a false conception about the result.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i 'bras bu'i rnam par rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i 'bras bu'i rnam par rtogs pa ni /
translated: The understanding of the result of inference

original: 'bras bu'i khyad pa'i ni mngon sum bzhin du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad pa'i ni mngon sum bzhin du shes par bya ste /
translated: should be understood to be like the understanding of the result of perception.

original: don dang 'dra ba'i ni tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: don dang 'dra ba'i ni tshad ma yin la /
translated: That which is similar to the object is valid knowledge.

original: don rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ni 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: don rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ni 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The nature of the understanding of the object is the result.

original: yul la log par rtogs pa ni mngon sum gyi yul gtan la dbab pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: yul la log par rtogs pa ni mngon sum gyi yul gtan la dbab pa'i skabs su /
translated: The false conception about the object is removed in the section on determining the object of perception.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i yul ni don med pa yin no zhes brjod pas gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i yul ni don med pa yin no zhes brjod pas gsal ba yin no //
translated: The object of conceptual thought is an object that is ascertained as nonexistent.

original: 'on kyang 'di la rtsod pa 'di yod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di la rtsod pa 'di yod de /
translated: It is not possible to obtain it.üîΩIf the object of conceptual thought is the object of the sign of inference, how can it be a valid cognition?üîΩFor a valid cognition is a cognition that obtains an object that has been ascertained.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtag pa'i gzung ba'i gzung ba'i rtags pa'i don yin na'o na ci ltar tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtag pa'i gzung ba'i gzung ba'i rtags pa'i don yin na'o na ci ltar tshad ma yin te /
translated: The object of conceptual thought is an object that is ascertained as nonexistent.üîΩIt is not possible to obtain it.üîΩIf the object of conceptual thought is the object of the sign of inference, how can it be a valid cognition?üîΩFor a valid cognition is a cognition that obtains an object that has been ascertained.

original: tshad ma ni zhe na par byas pa'i yul thob par byed pa las yin na /
analyzed: tshad ma ni zhe na par byas pa'i yul thob par byed pa las yin na /
translated: The object of conceptual thought is an object that is ascertained as nonexistent.üîΩIt is not possible to obtain it.üîΩIf the object of conceptual thought is the object of the sign of inference, how can it be a valid cognition?üîΩFor a valid cognition is a cognition that obtains an object that has been ascertained.

original: gzung ba'i don ni don med pa zhen par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: gzung ba'i don ni don med pa zhen par byas pa yin te /
translated: The object of conceptual thought is an object that is ascertained as nonexistent.üîΩIt is not possible to obtain it.üîΩIf the object of conceptual thought is the object of the sign of inference, how can it be a valid cognition?üîΩFor a valid cognition is a cognition that obtains an object that has been ascertained.üîΩThe object of conceptual thought is an object that is ascertained as nonexistent.üîΩIt is not possible to obtain it.üîΩIf the object of conceptual thought is the object of the sign of inference, how can it be a valid cognition?üîΩFor a valid cognition is a cognition that obtains an object that has been ascertained.üîΩThe object of conceptual thought is an object that is ascertained as nonexistent.

original: de ni thob par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni thob par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible to obtain it.üîΩIf the object of conceptual thought is the object of the sign of inference, how can it be a valid cognition?üîΩFor a valid cognition is a cognition that obtains an object that has been ascertained.

original: ci ste zhen pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rjes su dpag pas thob par bya ba des na tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: ci ste zhen pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rjes su dpag pas thob par bya ba des na tshad ma yin la /
translated: The object of conceptual thought is an object that is ascertained as nonexistent.üîΩIt is not possible to obtain it.üîΩIf the object of conceptual thought is the object of the sign of inference, how can it be a valid cognition?üîΩFor a valid cognition is a cognition that obtains an object

original: 'on te ci ltar 'khrul pa don med pa'i yul can yin 'khrul pa dang tshad ma yin no zhes gnyi ga ltar yang dam bcas pa ni yin no zhes rtsod pa'i yul la log par rtogs pa'i lhag ma bsal ba'i don du 'khrul pa dang tshad ma yangüîΩbstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'on te ci ltar 'khrul pa don med pa'i yul can yin 'khrul pa dang tshad ma yin no zhes gnyi ga ltar yang dam bcas pa ni yin no zhes rtsod pa'i yul la log par rtogs pa'i lhag ma bsal ba'i don du 'khrul pa dang tshad ma yang bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to eliminate the remainder of the object of dispute, which is the misconception, in order to demonstrate that it is error and that it is valid knowledge, it is explained:

original: rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa de ni 'khrul kyang tshad ma nyid ces 'brel to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa de ni 'khrul kyang tshad ma nyid ces 'brel to //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthat inferential cognition is error but is still valid knowledge‚Äù is connected.

original: ci ste 'khrul zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste 'khrul zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow is it error?‚Äù
