original: @171b de ma yin la de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa la yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin der 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: @171b de ma yin la de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa la yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin der 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is because it apprehends as existent a nature that does not exist in what is not that, in what is not of the nature of that.

original: sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Because of superimposition, inference is error.

original: gal te 'khrul na 'on ci ltar tshad ma yin zhen na /
analyzed: gal te 'khrul na 'on ci ltar tshad ma yin zhen na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúIf it is error, then how is it valid knowledge?‚Äù

original: bshad pa / 'brel pa'i phyir te 'brel pa las tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'brel pa'i phyir te 'brel pa las tshad ma yin no //
translated: It is explained: It is valid knowledge because of its relation, because it is valid knowledge in relation to its object.

original: 'khrul pa nyid bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni rang gi snang ba ni bdag nyid kyi rnam pa ste /üîΩphyir rol gyi me'i rang bzhin gyi don med pa don du zhen nas 'jug pa'i phyir te 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid bshad pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni rang gi snang ba ni bdag nyid kyi rnam pa ste / phyir rol gyi me'i rang bzhin gyi don med pa don du zhen nas 'jug pa'i phyir te 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to explain error itself, he says:üîΩBecause of the conception of an external object, which is nonexistent, one engages, i.e., apprehends, one‚Äôs own appearance, i.e., one‚Äôs own form.

original: bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo phyi rol ma yin pa la phyi rol du 'dzin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo phyi rol ma yin pa la phyi rol du 'dzin pa yin gyi /
translated: One apprehends one‚Äôs own nature, which is not external, as external.

original: de la phyi rol gyi rang bzhin yod pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la phyi rol gyi rang bzhin yod pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that there is an external nature in that.

original: de'i phyir don med pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ni 'khrul pa yin yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir don med pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ni 'khrul pa yin yang /
translated: Therefore, because of the apprehension of a nonexistent object, there is error.

original: don phyi rol gyi me dang 'brel pa des na don de la mi 'khrul pa yin la /
analyzed: don phyi rol gyi me dang 'brel pa des na don de la mi 'khrul pa yin la /
translated: But because of the connection with the external object, fire, that object is not erroneous.

original: mi 'khrul pa de'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'khrul pa de'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
translated: And because of that non-error, there is valid cognition.

original: 'di ltar bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bshad pa yin te /
translated: The explanation is as follows.

original: gzung ba la 'khrul pa yin yang nges par byas pa 'jug pa'i yul dang 'brel pa des na tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba la 'khrul pa yin yang nges par byas pa 'jug pa'i yul dang 'brel pa des na tshad ma yin no //
translated: Although there is error in regard to the object, because of the connection with the object of engagement, which is ascertained, there is valid cognition.

original: rjes su dpag pa phyi rol gyi don dang 'brel pa de nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa phyi rol gyi don dang 'brel pa de nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very inference related to external objects by way of exclusion,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says ‚Äúthus,‚Äù and so on.

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir te ngo bo dang rang bzhin dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir de med na rang bzhin srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir te ngo bo dang rang bzhin dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir de med na rang bzhin srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Because of non-difference, because of the non-difference of nature and essence, if that does not exist, essence is not possible.

original: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid sgrub par byed pa ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir de med na med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid sgrub par byed pa ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir de med na med pa yin no //
translated: Because the cause is the producer of the nature of the effect, if that does not exist, it does not exist.

original: ci ltar rgyu med na 'bras bu mi 'byung ba de bzhin du 'bras bu dang rang bzhin de dag med na de las skyes pa 'bras bu dang rang bzhin las skyes pa'i shes pa med pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: ci ltar rgyu med na 'bras bu mi 'byung ba de bzhin du 'bras bu dang rang bzhin de dag med na de las skyes pa 'bras bu dang rang bzhin las skyes pa'i shes pa med pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: Just as the effect does not occur if the cause does not exist, in the same way, if those effects and essences do not exist, the consciousness arisen from them, the consciousness arisen from the effect and essence, does not exist.

original: de las skyes pa'i shes pa yang rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul pa nyid kyi yul can yin gyi /
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i shes pa yang rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul pa nyid kyi yul can yin gyi /
translated: The consciousness arisen from that is also the subject that is non-mistaken with regard to its own object of comprehension.

original: rtags kyi rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtags kyi rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the apprehender of the definition of the reason.

original: du ba'am byas pa rang gi ngo bos gzung ba ni rtags ma yin gyi /
analyzed: du ba'am byas pa rang gi ngo bos gzung ba ni rtags ma yin gyi /
translated: Smoke and the product are not the evidence.üîΩ

original: 'on kyang bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung bar gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung bar gzung ba yin no //
translated: Smoke and the effect are not apprehended as their own nature, but rather as the invariable concomitants of the object to be established.

original: de'i phyir rtags bsgrub bya dang 'brel par 'dzin pa ni rtags shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtags bsgrub bya dang 'brel par 'dzin pa ni rtags shes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of the evidence as related to the object to be established is the cognition of the evidence.

original: de yang ji ltar rtags las skye ba de bzhin du rtags can las kyang skye ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar rtags las skye ba de bzhin du rtags can las kyang skye ba yin te /
translated: And just as it arises from the evidence, so it arises from the evidence-possessor.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu rang bzhin dag gi med na mi 'byung ba shes pa ni bsgrub bya'i rgyu can du khyad par med pa yin no //üîΩde las rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa skye ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu rang bzhin dag gi med na mi 'byung ba shes pa ni bsgrub bya'i rgyu can du khyad par med pa yin no // de las rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa skye ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the invariable concomitance of effects and of intrinsic nature is not distinguished as to whether it is caused by the object to be established.

original: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul pa nyid dran pa nyid las yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul pa nyid dran pa nyid las yin te /
translated: The cognition of the evidence-possessor does not arise from that, but rather from the memory of the invariable concomitance.üîΩAnd that memory is the evidence.

original: de'i dran pa nyid ni rtags yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'brel pa 'dis dran pas bar du chod pa'i rtags rjes su dpag pa skyed pa la nye bar sbyor ba @172a * //
analyzed: de'i dran pa nyid ni rtags yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'brel pa 'dis dran pas bar du chod pa'i rtags rjes su dpag pa skyed pa la nye bar sbyor ba @172a * //
translated: This explanation of the relation of the evidence to the object to be established is applied to the production of inference that is interrupted by memory.

original: yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúYes, it is!‚Äù

original: de las skyes pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de las skyes pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that which arises from that, it is said:

original: de las byung ba'i ngo bo dang rgyu rtogs pa gang yin pa de mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i ngo bo dang rgyu rtogs pa gang yin pa de mi 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is the nature and cause of that which arises is not non-arisen.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du mi dmigs pa'i yang rang bzhin 'brel pa bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi dmigs pa'i yang rang bzhin 'brel pa bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Similarly, in order to demonstrate the nature of the connection of non-apprehension, it is said:

original: de bzhin du snang ba ltar rung ba'i dngos po yod na /
analyzed: de bzhin du snang ba ltar rung ba'i dngos po yod na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf a thing that is suitable to appear in that way exists,

original: de las gzhan gyi rgyu ma tshang ba med pa can gyi mthong ba gang yin pa de ldog pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan gyi rgyu ma tshang ba med pa can gyi mthong ba gang yin pa de ldog pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: then it is not reasonable for the perception of that which is complete with other causes to be reversed.‚Äù

original: dngos po yod pa la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIf a thing exists‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: de'i phyir dngos po med pa dang 'brel pa dang 'brel pa snang ba mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi mthong ba ldog pa yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med pa dang 'brel pa dang 'brel pa snang ba mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi mthong ba ldog pa yang /
translated: Therefore, the connection of non-existence and the appearance of the connection are the nature of non-apprehension. The reversal of seeing is

original: dngos po med pa'am med pa'i tha snyad kyi tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'am med pa'i tha snyad kyi tshad ma yin no //
translated: the valid knowledge of non-existence or the convention of non-existence.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa dngos po thob par byed par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa dngos po thob par byed par 'dod na /
translated: If inference is asserted to be the means of obtaining a thing,

original: 'o na ni gang gis 'khrul pa med par 'gyur pa'i dngos po snang ba rjes su dpag pa nyid du ci ste mi brjod ce na bshad pa rjes su dpag pa la snang ba de nyid ni don byed nus pa'i don dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni gang gis 'khrul pa med par 'gyur pa'i dngos po snang ba rjes su dpag pa nyid du ci ste mi brjod ce na bshad pa rjes su dpag pa la snang ba de nyid ni don byed nus pa'i don dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: We reply: The appearance in inference does not have a meaning that is able to perform a function.

original: don byed par nus pa de ni mngon sum gyi gzhan du de ltar ma yin par gsal ba'i snang ba mthong ba'i phyir te gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don byed par nus pa de ni mngon sum gyi gzhan du de ltar ma yin par gsal ba'i snang ba mthong ba'i phyir te gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is able to perform a function is a direct perception, but it is not like that. It is seen to be a clear appearance.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: dngos po gcig la phan tshun 'gal ba'i rnam pa gnyis yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la phan tshun 'gal ba'i rnam pa gnyis yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that two mutually exclusive aspects exist in one entity.

original: rnam pa gang yang rung ba gcig 'dzin na ni rjes su dpag pa'i rnam pa dngos por mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa gang yang rung ba gcig 'dzin na ni rjes su dpag pa'i rnam pa dngos por mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one aspect is apprehended, the aspect of inference does not become an entity.

original: de las don bya ba mi 'grub ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las don bya ba mi 'grub ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a function is not accomplished from that.

original: dngos po'i rnam pa ni 'ga' zhig mngon sum gyis yongs su bcad pa de nyid yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rnam pa ni 'ga' zhig mngon sum gyis yongs su bcad pa de nyid yin te /
translated: The aspect of an entity is just that which is ascertained by direct perception.

original: de las don bya ba grub pas na bden pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las don bya ba grub pas na bden pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is true, since it is the means of accomplishing the goal.

original: tshad mar bstan pa'i phyir dngos po gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: tshad mar bstan pa'i phyir dngos po gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis brjod do //
translated: In order to demonstrate the validity of the reason, two verses are stated beginning with ‚ÄúWhatever entity . . .‚Äù

original: dngos po gang ci lta zhes bya ba ni me la sogs pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa las rtogs par bya ba dang / rtag pa'i dngos po las bzlog pas rnam par gnas pa'i mi rtag pa nyid do //üîΩde ni khyad par can gyi zhen pas rtogs par bya ba de 'dra ba'i rtags gang yin pa de'i sems kyi ste /
analyzed: dngos po gang ci lta zhes bya ba ni me la sogs pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa las rtogs par bya ba dang / rtag pa'i dngos po las bzlog pas rnam par gnas pa'i mi rtag pa nyid do // de ni khyad par can gyi zhen pas rtogs par bya ba de 'dra ba'i rtags gang yin pa de'i sems kyi ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever entity‚Äù means that which is to be understood from the apprehension of fire, etc., and impermanence is the opposite of permanent entity.

original: bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul par 'dzin pa de'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul par 'dzin pa de'i rgyu yin no //
translated: That is to be understood by the apprehension of the specific, and whatever sign is like that is the cause of the mind that apprehends the object of affirmation without error.

original: de las khyad par can gyi zhen pa'i yul gyi rgyu dang rang bzhin de lta bu la rtags can blo rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa rtags kyi sems las skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de las khyad par can gyi zhen pa'i yul gyi rgyu dang rang bzhin de lta bu la rtags can blo rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa rtags kyi sems las skye ba yin no //
translated: From that, the mind that infers the sign, which has the cause and nature of the object of the apprehension of the specific, is born from the sign.

original: 'di ltar gyi sgra ni gang gi phyir don yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gyi sgra ni gang gi phyir don yin la /
translated: The word ‚Äúthus‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir zhes kyang smos pa des na 'di ltar 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes kyang smos pa des na 'di ltar 'brel pa yin te /
translated: Also, the word therefore indicates the following connection:

original: gang gi phyir rim pa 'dis rtags dang rtags can gyi blo skye ba de'i phyir de @172b ltar brgyud pa yin no //üîΩbrgyud pa des na gnyi ga yang bsgrub par bya ba'i don dang 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rim pa 'dis rtags dang rtags can gyi blo skye ba de'i phyir de @172b ltar brgyud pa yin no // brgyud pa des na gnyi ga yang bsgrub par bya ba'i don dang 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Since the awareness of the reason and the awareness of the property to be proven arise in this order, the reason is said to be indirectly related to the property to be proven.üîΩSince the reason is indirectly related to the property to be proven, the reason is said to be indirectly related to the object to be established.

original: gang gi phyir des na skye ba'i rim pa 'di yin pa de'i phyir gnyi ga yang brgyud nas bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir des na skye ba'i rim pa 'di yin pa de'i phyir gnyi ga yang brgyud nas bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since the order of arising is like this, the reason is indirectly related to the object to be established. This is the meaning.

original: rtags dang rtags can gyi blo'i yul gyi dngos po dang 'brel pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags dang rtags can gyi blo'i yul gyi dngos po dang 'brel pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the connection between the object that is the domain of the awareness of the reason and the awareness of the property to be proven.

original: dngos po der snang ba gang yin pa des ston pa yang slu ba nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po der snang ba gang yin pa des ston pa yang slu ba nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: The object that appears as that is not deceptive.

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag de ltar skye pa yin pa de'i phyir brgyud nas dngos po dang 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag de ltar skye pa yin pa de'i phyir brgyud nas dngos po dang 'brel pa yin la /
translated: Since these arise in this way, they are indirectly related to the object.

original: 'brel pa des na dngos po snang bas stong pa yin yang mi slu ba yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa des na dngos po snang bas stong pa yin yang mi slu ba yin te /
translated: Because of that connection, even though emptiness appears as an entity, it is undeceiving.

original: des na tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: des na tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a valid cognition.

original: gal te ji ltar zhen pa'i dngos po thob par byed pa mi bslu ba ma yin nam rtags kyi shes pas nges pa ni rtags yin na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar zhen pa'i dngos po thob par byed pa mi bslu ba ma yin nam rtags kyi shes pas nges pa ni rtags yin na /
translated: If it is not undeceiving in obtaining the entity as it is conceived, then if the ascertainment by the cognition of the reason is the reason,

original: de ci ltar rtags kyi blo bsgrub bya'i don la mi slu ba yin /
analyzed: de ci ltar rtags kyi blo bsgrub bya'i don la mi slu ba yin /
translated: how is the cognition of the reason undeceiving with regard to the object to be established?

original: gzhan yang de ltar rtags can gyi blo'i yul la mi slu bar brjod pa'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de ltar rtags can gyi blo'i yul la mi slu bar brjod pa'i skabs yin te /
translated: Moreover, this is the context of stating that the object of the cognition possessing the reason is undeceiving.

original: de'i phyir rtags kyi blo mi slu bar brjod pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtags kyi blo mi slu bar brjod pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: Therefore, what is the point of stating that the cognition of the reason is undeceiving?

original: de ltar ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ltar ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul par 'dzin pa ni rtags shes par gzung bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul par 'dzin pa ni rtags shes par gzung bar bya ba yin la /
translated: Because that which apprehends without error with regard to the object to be established is to be taken as the cognition of the reason.

original: de yang ci ltar rtags kyi yul can yin pa de bzhin du rtags srid pa'i rgyu mtshan bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can yang yin no //
analyzed: de yang ci ltar rtags kyi yul can yin pa de bzhin du rtags srid pa'i rgyu mtshan bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can yang yin no //
translated: And just as it is the subject of the reason, in the same way, it is also the reason that is possible, the reason that is the object to be established.

original: de'i phyir rtags kyi shes pa ni mi 'khrul pa'i yul bsgrub par bya ba nges pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtags kyi shes pa ni mi 'khrul pa'i yul bsgrub par bya ba nges pa kho na ste /
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of the reason is only the ascertainment of the object to be established, which is nonerroneous.

original: rtags mi 'khrul par rtogs pa ni de nges pa med na med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags mi 'khrul par rtogs pa ni de nges pa med na med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the realization of the nonerroneous reason is nonexistent without that ascertainment.

original: mi 'khrul pa'i shes pa mi slu ba'i phyir na de sngon du 'gro ba can gyi shes pa yang mi bslu ba yin te /
analyzed: mi 'khrul pa'i shes pa mi slu ba'i phyir na de sngon du 'gro ba can gyi shes pa yang mi bslu ba yin te /
translated: Because the nonerroneous consciousness is nondeceptive, the consciousness that precedes it is also nondeceptive.

original: 'di ltar med na mi 'byung bar 'dzin pa la 'khrul par gyur na ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar med na mi 'byung bar 'dzin pa la 'khrul par gyur na ni /
translated: Thus, if the apprehension of the invariable concomitance were erroneous,

original: de sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rjes su dpag par bya ba'i shes pa mi 'khrul par 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rjes su dpag par bya ba'i shes pa mi 'khrul par 'thad pa yin no //
translated: it would be untenable that the inferential consciousness that precedes it is nonerroneous.

original: de'i phyir 'di 'dra ba'i rtags nyid ni rgyu mtshan yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di 'dra ba'i rtags nyid ni rgyu mtshan yin la /
translated: Therefore, the reason itself is the reason,

original: de me 'khrul pas ni rjes su dpag pa 'khrul pa med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du rtags kyi shes pa yang dngos po la mi slu ba nyid du brjod pa yin na ;
analyzed: de me 'khrul pas ni rjes su dpag pa 'khrul pa med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du rtags kyi shes pa yang dngos po la mi slu ba nyid du brjod pa yin na ;
translated: and because that is nonerroneous, the inference is nonerroneous. In order to demonstrate this, the knowledge of the reason is said to be nondeceptive with respect to the thing.

original: / gang gis na rtags nyid dngos por brjod par 'gyur brtags kyi dngos po nyid las ni shes pa brgyud nas skyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / gang gis na rtags nyid dngos por brjod par 'gyur brtags kyi dngos po nyid las ni shes pa brgyud nas skyes pa ma yin te /
translated: The sign is said to be a real entity because it is the cause of the cognition that is produced from the real entity.

original: des na mi 'khrul ba 'dzin pa rtags kyis shes par 'dod pa yin no //üîΩdngos po nyams su myong ba'i bag chags kyis bskyed pa'i gzung ba'i rnam pa can nyid kyis rnam par @173a * //
analyzed: des na mi 'khrul ba 'dzin pa rtags kyis shes par 'dod pa yin no // dngos po nyams su myong ba'i bag chags kyis bskyed pa'i gzung ba'i rnam pa can nyid kyis rnam par @173a * //
translated: Therefore, the sign is accepted as the cause of the cognition that apprehends the nonerroneous.

original: rtog pa thams cad dngos po dang 'brel pa yin yang /
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad dngos po dang 'brel pa yin yang /
translated: All conceptual thoughts are related to real entities because they are produced from the latent potentialities of the experience of real entities.

original: dngos po dang 'brel pa'i rtags mthong ba med na mi 'byung ba nyid thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos pa dang 'brel pa 'di ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i rgyu mtshan du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po dang 'brel pa'i rtags mthong ba med na mi 'byung ba nyid thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos pa dang 'brel pa 'di ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i rgyu mtshan du bshad pa yin no //
translated: However, the relation to a real entity that is the uncommon cause of the nonerroneous is the reason for inferential valid knowledge.

original: 'on gal te mi slu ba yin na 'khrul pa nyid du ji ltar rnam par gzhag chen /
analyzed: 'on gal te mi slu ba yin na 'khrul pa nyid du ji ltar rnam par gzhag chen /
translated: If it is nondeceptive, how can it be posited as erroneous?

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: de dngos slu byed nyid min yang //
analyzed: de dngos slu byed nyid min yang //
translated: Although it is not deceptive with regard to that,

original: mi slu ba nyid yin na yang rtags kyi blo de 'khrul par rnam par gzhag pa byas pa yin /
analyzed: mi slu ba nyid yin na yang rtags kyi blo de 'khrul par rnam par gzhag pa byas pa yin /
translated: Even though it is nondeceptive, the cognition of the reason is posited as mistaken.

original: ci ltar 'khrul pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'khrul pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it mistaken?

original: de'i ngo bos stong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bos stong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is empty of its nature.

original: gal te yang sngon po'i shes pa ser bos stong ba de lta na yang la 'khrul ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang sngon po'i shes pa ser bos stong ba de lta na yang la 'khrul ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Even though the cognition of blue is empty of yellow, it is not mistaken,

original: ser por ma zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ser por ma zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not attached to yellow.

original: rtags rnams kyi shes pa'i 'di ni me'i rang bzhin gyis stong ba la /
analyzed: rtags rnams kyi shes pa'i 'di ni me'i rang bzhin gyis stong ba la /
translated: The cognition of the reason is empty of the nature of fire,

original: de'i ngo bor zhen pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bor zhen pa yin te /
translated: but it is attached to that nature.

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: For that reason, it is posited as mistaken.

original: gal te gang zhig med pa'i ngo bo nyid 'dzin par ni mi slu ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te gang zhig med pa'i ngo bo nyid 'dzin par ni mi slu ba ma yin te /
translated: If something is not nondeceptive with regard to the nature of what does not exist,

original: dper na 'dra ba la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'dra ba la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: then it is like the cognition of a double moon.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa yang 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa yang 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: Inferential cognition is also mistaken,

original: des na mi slu ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mi slu ba ma yin no //
translated: and therefore it is not nondeceptive.

original: gzhan yang gang zhig ma bzung ba de zhen par byas pa ma yin pa des na de thob par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang zhig ma bzung ba de zhen par byas pa ma yin pa des na de thob par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, that which is not apprehended is not adhered to, and therefore it is not to be attained.

original: dper na ba lang gi shes pas rta bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba lang gi shes pas rta bzhin no //
translated: For example, a cognition of a cow is not a horse.

original: de bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid kyang gzung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid kyang gzung ba ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, a particular also is not apprehended.

original: des na thob par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na thob par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not to be attained.

original: thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ni de 'dzin par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ni de 'dzin par byed pa yin la /
translated: Because it is to be attained, it is apprehended.üîΩBecause it is apprehended, it is not erroneous.

original: 'dzin par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ni ma 'khrul pa nyid yin no zhes de ltar dogs pa la len gdab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ni ma 'khrul pa nyid yin no zhes de ltar dogs pa la len gdab pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to remove such doubts, he explains the example,

original: nor bu sgron ma'i 'od dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa dpe 'chad do //üîΩnor bu dang sgron ma'i 'od kyi yul dag la /
analyzed: nor bu sgron ma'i 'od dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa dpe 'chad do // nor bu dang sgron ma'i 'od kyi yul dag la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe light of a jewel and a lamp,‚Äù etc.üîΩWith regard to the objects of the light of a jewel and a lamp,

original: nor bu'i blo byed par gyur pas mngon du rgyug pa'i skyes bu dag /
analyzed: nor bu'i blo byed par gyur pas mngon du rgyug pa'i skyes bu dag /
translated: a person who is attracted to the jewel and the lamp

original: log pa'i shes pa ste slu bar khyad par med kyang ngo //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa ste slu bar khyad par med kyang ngo //
translated: has a false cognition, i.e., is deceived, but there is no difference.

original: nor bu'i 'od dang mar me'i 'od la nor bur shes pa gang yin pa de dag log pa'i shes pa slu ba nyid du ni khyad yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od dang mar me'i 'od la nor bur shes pa gang yin pa de dag log pa'i shes pa slu ba nyid du ni khyad yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The cognition of the light of the gem and the cognition of the light of the lamp are not different in being deceptive, erroneous cognitions.

original: gnyi gas kyang zhen par byas pa'i yul mi thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi gas kyang zhen par byas pa'i yul mi thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because neither of them obtains the object as it is conceived.

original: 'di ltar sgron ma'i 'od la nor bur shes pa don byed nus pa thob pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid gtan ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgron ma'i 'od la nor bur shes pa don byed nus pa thob pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid gtan ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: In this way, the cognition of the light of the lamp is not the cause of obtaining the gem, which is capable of effective action.

original: nor bu'i 'od la nor bur 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od la nor bur 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, the cognition apprehending the light of the gem is not the cause of obtaining the gem.

original: 'on kyang 'dir rang gi yul thob par byed pa ma yin yang brgyud pas nor bu dang 'brel pa'i phyir thob par byed pa'i shes pa @173b gzhan gyi rgyu yin pa na nor bu thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir rang gi yul thob par byed pa ma yin yang brgyud pas nor bu dang 'brel pa'i phyir thob par byed pa'i shes pa @173b gzhan gyi rgyu yin pa na nor bu thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: However, here, although it does not obtain its own object, it is the cause of another cognition that obtains the gem, because it is indirectly related to the gem. Thus it is the cause of obtaining the gem.

original: des na don byed pa la khyad par yod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na don byed pa la khyad par yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is a difference in their capacity for effective action.

original: ci ltar 'di dag rang gi yul la slu ba khyad par med kyang don byed par nus pa thob pa'i rgyu mtshon gyi shes pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa dang ma yin pas na khyad par yod pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar 'di dag rang gi yul la slu ba khyad par med kyang don byed par nus pa thob pa'i rgyu mtshon gyi shes pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa dang ma yin pas na khyad par yod pa yin te /
translated: Although there is no difference in the way these deceive their objects, there is a difference in that the cause of a valid cognition is a cause that obtains the ability to perform a function, and the cause of an invalid cognition is not.

original: gcig rgyud nas nor du dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig rgyud nas nor du dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the former is related to a non-erroneous object.

original: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa dang der snang ba dag ji bzhin don can ma yin yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa dang der snang ba dag ji bzhin don can ma yin yang /
translated: Similarly, although inference and the appearance of that do not have a real object,

original: don med pa can gzung ba'i rnam pa la 'khrul pa yin yang /
analyzed: don med pa can gzung ba'i rnam pa la 'khrul pa yin yang /
translated: they are mistaken with respect to the apprehended aspect that does not exist as an object.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni don byed pa dang rjes su 'brel pas na tshad ma nyid do //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni don byed pa dang rjes su 'brel pas na tshad ma nyid do //
translated: However, inference is a valid cognition because it is related to the performance of a function.

original: de la ni ci 'dra ba sgro btags pa byas pa de 'dra ba thob par byed pa yin te ;
analyzed: de la ni ci 'dra ba sgro btags pa byas pa de 'dra ba thob par byed pa yin te ;
translated: In that case, it is the superimposition of a certain kind that is obtained,

original: rtags kyis bar du chod pas dngos po de dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags kyis bar du chod pas dngos po de dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is related to that thing that is obstructed by the reason.

original: cig shos ni thob par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: cig shos ni thob par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The other is not obtained.

original: de ni sgro btags pa dang 'dra ba'i phyi rol dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sgro btags pa dang 'dra ba'i phyi rol dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not related to an external object, as if it were superimposed.

original: des na don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning:

original: ji snyed don med pa 'dzin par mtshungs pa'i shes pa de thams cad nges pa'i don thob par byed pa la yang mtshungs par mi rigs te /
analyzed: ji snyed don med pa 'dzin par mtshungs pa'i shes pa de thams cad nges pa'i don thob par byed pa la yang mtshungs par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that all consciousnesses that are the same in apprehending a nonexistent object are the same in bringing about the attainment of the definitive meaning.üîΩJust as the jewels and the light of the lamp are not different in deceiving the object, but the difference is whether or not they are connected in a continuum, in the same way, although there is no difference in the error of the apprehended object, the difference is whether or not there is a connection with the object.üîΩThe one that is connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,

original: ci ltar nor bu dang sgron ma'i 'od kyi yul dag la slu ba khyad med kyang rgyud nas 'brel pa dang ma 'brel pa dag gi thob pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa dang ma yin pa de bzhin du gzung ba'i don 'khrul par khyad par med kyang 'brel paüîΩdag ma 'brel pa dag gis ni rjes su dpag pa gcig pu nyid sgro btags de 'dra ba dngos su thob par byed pa ni tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: ci ltar nor bu dang sgron ma'i 'od kyi yul dag la slu ba khyad med kyang rgyud nas 'brel pa dang ma 'brel pa dag gi thob pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa dang ma yin pa de bzhin du gzung ba'i don 'khrul par khyad par med kyang 'brel pa dag ma 'brel pa dag gis ni rjes su dpag pa gcig pu nyid sgro btags de 'dra ba dngos su thob par byed pa ni tshad ma yin la /
translated: the one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,üîΩthe one that is not connected,

original: cig shos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: cig shos ni ma yin no //
translated: the one that is not connected,

original: de'i phyir gang gzhig med pa 'dzin pa de ni med pa 'dzin pa gzhan dag las khyad par med pa yin te zhes gang brjod pa de 'dis ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gzhig med pa 'dzin pa de ni med pa 'dzin pa gzhan dag las khyad par med pa yin te zhes gang brjod pa de 'dis ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this statement ‚ÄúThat which apprehends the non-existent is not different from other apprehensions of the non-existent‚Äù is not established.

original: ma bzung ba gang yin pa de nyid nges pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa de yang 'di nyid kyis 'khrul pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: ma bzung ba gang yin pa de nyid nges pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa de yang 'di nyid kyis 'khrul pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThat which is not apprehended is not ascertained‚Äù is also erroneous, because

original: 'di ltar nor bur rtogs pa yin gyi gzung ba ni ma yin pa de bzhin du rnam par rtog pas kyang ma bzung ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar nor bur rtogs pa yin gyi gzung ba ni ma yin pa de bzhin du rnam par rtog pas kyang ma bzung ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid nges pa yin no //
translated: just as the gem is recognized but not apprehended, so too the own-character is ascertained but not apprehended by the conceptual consciousness.

original: gal te don byed pa mi 'dzin na ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid nges pa yin zhes bya ba 'di brjod dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don byed pa mi 'dzin na ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid nges pa yin zhes bya ba 'di brjod dgos so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is necessary to explain how the own-character is ascertained if the functioning thing is not apprehended,

original: brjod pa / shes pa de ni bdag nyid kyi rnam pa la me ma yin pa las ldog pa dang / yul gzhan dang 'brel pa las ldog pa mngon par 'dod pa'i yul gyi me'i rang bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa / shes pa de ni bdag nyid kyi rnam pa la me ma yin pa las ldog pa dang / yul gzhan dang 'brel pa las ldog pa mngon par 'dod pa'i yul gyi me'i rang bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: The response is: That cognition is a superimposition of the nature of fire on the object that is desired, which is the opposite of what is not fire, and the opposite of what is related to another object.

original: des na ci 'dra ba sgro btags pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyang de 'dra ba nyid yin te /üîΩde'i phyir sgro @174a * //
analyzed: des na ci 'dra ba sgro btags pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyang de 'dra ba nyid yin te / de'i phyir sgro @174a * //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the superimposition is also like that.

original: btags pa'i don nyid nges pa na rang gi mtshan nyid nges pa yin gyi /
analyzed: btags pa'i don nyid nges pa na rang gi mtshan nyid nges pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, when the meaning of the superimposition is ascertained, the intrinsic identity is ascertained.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid nges pa zhes bya ba sgro 'dogs pa las bya ba gzhan du gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid nges pa zhes bya ba sgro 'dogs pa las bya ba gzhan du gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The so-called ascertainment of the intrinsic identity is not a different action from the superimposition.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid de yang gang la ji ltar nges pa yod pa de la 'jug pas de thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid de yang gang la ji ltar nges pa yod pa de la 'jug pas de thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, that intrinsic identity is valid knowledge because it is ascertained in relation to that and it causes the attainment of that.

original: dper na rtags mthong ba las skyes pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rtags mthong ba las skyes pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the cognition that arises from seeing a sign.

original: shes pa gzhan ni tshad ma ma yin gyi de nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan ni tshad ma ma yin gyi de nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: Other cognitions are not valid cognitions, but that is a valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir de ltar nor bu'i shes pa slu ba yin yang dngos po dang 'brel pa'i phyir brgyud pas byas pa'i thob pa'i rgya'i dngos pos slu bar byed pa gzhan dag las khyad par yod pa ci lta ba de de ltar log bar 'dzin pa nyid du khyad
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar nor bu'i shes pa slu ba yin yang dngos po dang 'brel pa'i phyir brgyud pas byas pa'i thob pa'i rgya'i dngos pos slu bar byed pa gzhan dag las khyad par yod pa ci lta ba de de ltar log bar 'dzin pa nyid du khyad
translated: Therefore, although the cognition of the gem is deceptive, since it is related to the thing, it is distinguished from other deceptive things that are produced by an indirect process, such as the mirage of water.

original: par med kyang rjes su dpag pa ni dngos po dang 'brel pa'i phyir mi slu ba nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba las khyad par du gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di 'dir 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: par med kyang rjes su dpag pa ni dngos po dang 'brel pa'i phyir mi slu ba nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba las khyad par du gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di 'dir 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Although there is no difference in the fact that both are mistaken, still inference is distinguished from the semblance of inference because it is related to a thing and is nondeceptive. This is the point that is being made here.

original: gzhan dag nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa ni rjes su dpag par dgongs nas slob dpon gyis nye bar bkod pa yin no zhes zer ba de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan dag nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa ni rjes su dpag par dgongs nas slob dpon gyis nye bar bkod pa yin no zhes zer ba de ni mi rigs te /
translated: Others say that the master intended to show that the cognition of the gem is an inference when he said that the light of the gem is an inference. That is incorrect.

original: gang gi phyir gzung ba'i rnam pa la phyin ci log pa de ni slu ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzung ba'i rnam pa la phyin ci log pa de ni slu ba nyid yin te /
translated: Because the aspect of the object is erroneous, it is deceptive.üîΩFor example, it is like an inference that is fallacious.

original: dper na rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba bzhin no zhes de ltar rjes su dpag pa ma lus pa la bsnyon pa la rjes su dpag pa cung zhig ni grub la gzhan dag ma grub par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: dper na rjes su dpag pa ltar snang ba bzhin no zhes de ltar rjes su dpag pa ma lus pa la bsnyon pa la rjes su dpag pa cung zhig ni grub la gzhan dag ma grub par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: Thus, how can it be that some inferences are established and others are not established, in the refutation of all inferences?

original: 'di don med pa 'dzin pa dang mi slu ba nyid du ni gzhan las khyad par yod pa ma yin no //üîΩci ltar nor bur shes pa las nor bu thob pa de bzhin du ba las skyes pa me shes pa las /
analyzed: 'di don med pa 'dzin pa dang mi slu ba nyid du ni gzhan las khyad par yod pa ma yin no // ci ltar nor bur shes pa las nor bu thob pa de bzhin du ba las skyes pa me shes pa las /
translated: It is not the case that there is a difference between it and others in terms of apprehending a nonexistent object and being nondeceptive.üîΩJust as one obtains a jewel from knowing a jewel,

original: me thob pa 'jig rten na grags pa yin te /
analyzed: me thob pa 'jig rten na grags pa yin te /
translated: in the same way, in the world, one obtains fire from knowing fire that is produced from kindling.

original: de'i phyir gang gis 'di gzhan gyi dper 'gyur ba 'di rjes su dpag pa gzhan dag las grags pas byas pa'i khyad par yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis 'di gzhan gyi dper 'gyur ba 'di rjes su dpag pa gzhan dag las grags pas byas pa'i khyad par yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since this is well known in other inferences, it is not the case that there is a difference in the function of this inference.

original: 'di ni slob dpon rjes su dpag par bzhed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni slob dpon rjes su dpag par bzhed pa ma yin no //
translated: The master does not assert that this is an inference.

original: gzhan yang 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa ni med na mi 'byung bar nges pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa ni med na mi 'byung bar nges pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin na /
translated: Moreover, if an inference is certain to occur when the reason is present,

original: 'di ni nor bu'i 'od la ni nor bu'i 'od nyid du nges pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ni nor bu'i 'od la ni nor bu'i 'od nyid du nges pa med de /
translated: then the light of a jewel is not ascertained to be the light of a jewel.

original: des na 'di ci ltar rjes su dpag pa yin ;
analyzed: des na 'di ci ltar rjes su dpag pa yin ;
translated: So how could it be an inference?

original: 'di ltar mig ni rang bzhin gyis ma mthong bar don gsal bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig ni rang bzhin gyis ma mthong bar don gsal bar byed pa yin la /
translated: The eye, by its very nature, illuminates objects without seeing them.

original: sgron ma ni rang bzhin gyis mthong ba na don gsal bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sgron ma ni rang bzhin gyis mthong ba na don gsal bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: A lamp, by its very nature, illuminates objects while seeing them.

original: 'bras bu ni ngo bo nyid kho nas mthong ngam ma mthong yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni ngo bo nyid kho nas mthong ngam ma mthong yang rung ste /
translated: But the effect is either seen or not seen by its very nature.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no //üîΩdes na lkog tu gyur pa @174b rtogs par byed pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no // des na lkog tu gyur pa @174b rtogs par byed pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa la ltos pa yin te /
translated: It is not the cause for realizing a hidden object.üîΩTherefore, the realization of a hidden object depends on the relation of concomitance and contradiction.

original: de'i phyir rtags kyi lkog tu gyur ba rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni 'di kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtags kyi lkog tu gyur ba rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni 'di kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, this alone is the reason for realizing a hidden object through a reason.

original: de med na mi 'byung ba nyid nges pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de med na mi 'byung ba nyid nges pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the certainty that the latter does not occur without the former.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes par byed pa'i byed pa la tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes par byed pa'i byed pa la tha dad pa yin no //
translated: That is why the function of the probans is different from the function of the intimation.

original: 'di ltar med na med pa rnam pa thams cad du ma nges par ni du ba me rtogs par byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar med na med pa rnam pa thams cad du ma nges par ni du ba me rtogs par byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: For, if the invariable concomitance were not ascertained in every respect, smoke would not intimate fire.

original: phyogs 'ga' zhig tu du ba me'i 'bras bu nyid du gzung ba 'di nyid me rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs 'ga' zhig tu du ba me'i 'bras bu nyid du gzung ba 'di nyid me rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: But it is just the apprehension of smoke as the effect of fire in some place that makes it intimate fire.

original: des na gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin du des na bsgrub par bya ba'i don rtogs par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin du des na bsgrub par bya ba'i don rtogs par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the probans is the nature of the probandum, and thereby the meaning of the probandum is understood.

original: go bar byed pa'i dngos po gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: go bar byed pa'i dngos po gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: There is no other entity that intimates.

original: shugs kyis 'di ni me yod do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / sgrub byed yan lag ma grub pa la zhes bya ba dang / rtags ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la ltos pa yin no zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shugs kyis 'di ni me yod do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / sgrub byed yan lag ma grub pa la zhes bya ba dang / rtags ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la ltos pa yin no zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: And it is said, ‚ÄúThe reason is dependent on the pervasion and the counter-pervasion.‚Äù

original: rtags mi 'khrul par 'dzin pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rtags mi 'khrul par 'dzin pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The apprehension of the non-erroneous reason is of two kinds.

original: gcig ni chos can la mi ltos par khyab pa spyir 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: gcig ni chos can la mi ltos par khyab pa spyir 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: One is the apprehension of the pervasion in general, without regard to the subject.

original: gzhan ni phyogs kyi chos bzung ba na bzung zin pa nyid kyi mi 'khrul pa gang yin pa dran pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni phyogs kyi chos bzung ba na bzung zin pa nyid kyi mi 'khrul pa gang yin pa dran pa ste /
translated: The other is the memory of the non-erroneous apprehension of the property of the subject, which is apprehended at the same time.

original: bzung zin pa'i ma 'khrul pa ma dran na ni bsgrub bya rtogs pa med pa phyir ro //
analyzed: bzung zin pa'i ma 'khrul pa ma dran na ni bsgrub bya rtogs pa med pa phyir ro //
translated: If one does not remember the non-erroneous apprehension of the subject, then the probandum is not understood.

original: 'di ltar du ba mthong nas 'di ni thams cad du me las skyes pa'i phyir 'dir yang me las skye ba yin no zhes rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar du ba mthong nas 'di ni thams cad du me las skyes pa'i phyir 'dir yang me las skye ba yin no zhes rtogs par byed do //
translated: Thus, having seen smoke, one understands, ‚ÄúThis is born from fire in every case, and so it is born from fire here.‚Äù

original: thams cad du me las skye ba dran pa gang yin pa 'di ni rtags shes pa yin la /
analyzed: thams cad du me las skye ba dran pa gang yin pa 'di ni rtags shes pa yin la /
translated: This memory of fire‚Äôs production everywhere is the knowledge of the reason.

original: 'dir yang mes bskyed pa yin no zhes bsgrub bya'i chas can la mi 'khrul ba nyid dran pa gang yin pa 'di nyid ni lkog tu gyur ba'i don rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang mes bskyed pa yin no zhes bsgrub bya'i chas can la mi 'khrul ba nyid dran pa gang yin pa 'di nyid ni lkog tu gyur ba'i don rtogs pa yin no //
translated: And here, the memory of the invariable concomitance of the probandum, ‚ÄúIt is produced by fire,‚Äù is the knowledge of the hidden object.

original: de yang spyir khyab pa 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin no //
analyzed: de yang spyir khyab pa 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin no //
translated: And that is preceded by the apprehension of the universal.

original: des na 'di skad du rtags shes pa ni rtags can shes pa'i rgyu yin no zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: des na 'di skad du rtags shes pa ni rtags can shes pa'i rgyu yin no zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the knowledge of the reason is the cause of the knowledge of the property-possessor.

original: spyir mi 'khrul par 'dzin pa ni chos can la mi 'khrul pa dran pa'i yan lag yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyir mi 'khrul par 'dzin pa ni chos can la mi 'khrul pa dran pa'i yan lag yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The apprehension of the invariable concomitance is the component of the memory of the invariable concomitance with respect to the property-possessor.

original: 'o na 'di snyam du 'di ni gdon mi za bar nor bu'am nor bu'i 'od yin pa de'i phyir go skabs 'di na nor bu yod pa yin no nyam pa'i shes pa skye ba de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'di snyam du 'di ni gdon mi za bar nor bu'am nor bu'i 'od yin pa de'i phyir go skabs 'di na nor bu yod pa yin no nyam pa'i shes pa skye ba de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: But how is it that when one sees a light in a place where there is a jewel, the knowledge ‚ÄúThere is a jewel here‚Äù arises?

original: de yang rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not inference.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni gdon mi za bar lha sbyin nam mchod sbyin yin no zhes shes pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni gdon mi za bar lha sbyin nam mchod sbyin yin no zhes shes pa na /
translated: Thus, when it is known with certainty that this is Devadatta or Yaj√±adatta,

original: lha sbyin yang yod pa dang med par the tshom za bar rigs pa yin la mchod sbyin @175a * //
analyzed: lha sbyin yang yod pa dang med par the tshom za bar rigs pa yin la mchod sbyin @175a * //
translated: it is reasonable to doubt whether Devadatta exists or does not exist,

original: yang yin no //üîΩgang gi tshe lha sbyin yin pa de'i tshe ni mchod sbyin med pa yin la /
analyzed: yang yin no // gang gi tshe lha sbyin yin pa de'i tshe ni mchod sbyin med pa yin la /
translated: and also whether Yaj√±adatta exists or does not exist.üîΩWhen it is Devadatta, then Yaj√±adatta does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe mchod sbyin yin pa de'i tshe lha sbyin med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mchod sbyin yin pa de'i tshe lha sbyin med pa yin no //
translated: When it is Yaj√±adatta, then Devadatta does not exist.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang nor bu dang nor bu'i 'od yod pa dang med par brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang nor bu dang nor bu'i 'od yod pa dang med par brtags pa yin te /
translated: In the same way, here it is investigated whether the gem and the light of the gem exist or do not exist.

original: des na snang ba'i don la nor bu the tshom za la /
analyzed: des na snang ba'i don la nor bu the tshom za la /
translated: Therefore, with respect to the object of appearance, there is doubt about the gem,

original: nor bu'i 'od du yang tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od du yang tshom za ba yin no //
translated: and there is doubt about the light of the gem.

original: de'i phyir the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is a fallacious reason that is doubtful.

original: gtan tshigs ltar snang ba las ni don grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ltar snang ba las ni don grub pa ma yin no //
translated: An object is not established from a fallacious reason.

original: de bzhin du 'di na nor bu yod do snyam ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de yang snang ba'i nor bu'i 'od la nor bur zhen pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di na nor bu yod do snyam ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de yang snang ba'i nor bu'i 'od la nor bur zhen pa na /
translated: Likewise, the cognition that thinks, ‚ÄúThe jewel exists here‚Äù is theüîΩapprehension of the light of the jewel as the jewel.

original: zur gcig la phyogs gzhan na yod pa'i nor bu nges pa'i pa'i phyir 'di nor bu yin nam 'on te yul gzhan na yod ces cha gnyis ka 'dzin pa'i the tshom nyid do //
analyzed: zur gcig la phyogs gzhan na yod pa'i nor bu nges pa'i pa'i phyir 'di nor bu yin nam 'on te yul gzhan na yod ces cha gnyis ka 'dzin pa'i the tshom nyid do //
translated: Likewise, the cognition that thinks ‚ÄúThe jewel exists here‚Äù is also doubt that apprehends both parts, thinking, ‚ÄúIs this a jewel or is it a jewel that exists in another place?‚Äù

original: 'di'i yul ni dngos po dang dngos po med par brtags pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i yul ni dngos po dang dngos po med par brtags pa yin la /
translated: The object of that is the imputation of things and nonthings.

original: de 'dra ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de 'dra ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin na /
translated: But since nothing like that exists,üîΩwhat is it that is apprehended?

original: gang zhig thob par byed pas shes pa'i 'di tshad mar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig thob par byed pas shes pa'i 'di tshad mar 'gyur /
translated: How could that cognition be valid knowledge?

original: dngos po ni gcig nyid du yod pa 'am med par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dngos po ni gcig nyid du yod pa 'am med par 'gyur gyi /
translated: A thing would either exist or not exist as one.

original: rgyu gnyi ga'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gnyi ga'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of both causes.

original: gang gi phyir thob pa'i nor bu ni yod pa nyid du nges pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thob pa'i nor bu ni yod pa nyid du nges pa yin la /
translated: Because the obtained jewel is ascertained to exist.

original: shes pa 'dis ni yod par ma nges par gzung ba yin pa de'i phyir gang zhig des nges pa de ni thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa 'dis ni yod par ma nges par gzung ba yin pa de'i phyir gang zhig des nges pa de ni thob pa ma yin no //
translated: This consciousness apprehends the object as not ascertained as existent, and therefore, that which is ascertained by it is not obtained.

original: ma nges pa'i don la ltos nas kyang tshad mar 'gyur ba ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: ma nges pa'i don la ltos nas kyang tshad mar 'gyur ba ni ma yin te ;
translated: Nor is it that it is a valid cognition in reliance on an object that is not ascertained,

original: nges par byas nas 'dug pa na zhes bshad pa dang / rnam 'grel las kyang bsam pa la slu ba med pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: nges par byas nas 'dug pa na zhes bshad pa dang / rnam 'grel las kyang bsam pa la slu ba med pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: because it is explained that ‚Äúhaving ascertained it, it remains,‚Äù and because PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å ava-mrÃ£ta says, ‚ÄúBecause it is non-deceptive with respect to the object of apprehension, it is a valid cognition.‚Äù

original: the tshom ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: the tshom ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
translated: Doubt is not inference.

original: 'di ni tshad ma gzhan yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni tshad ma gzhan yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it another valid cognition.

original: 'di ltar nye bar bstan pa'i 'jug pa'i yul thob par byed pa shes pa ni tshad ma yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar nye bar bstan pa'i 'jug pa'i yul thob par byed pa shes pa ni tshad ma yin na /
translated: This is because a valid cognition is a consciousness that obtains the object of engagement that is indicated by it.

original: 'dis bstan pa'i 'jug pa'i yul ni thob par bya ba ma yin no //üîΩ'di ltar 'dis yul gang gis nor bu bstan pa de ni mi thob la /
analyzed: 'dis bstan pa'i 'jug pa'i yul ni thob par bya ba ma yin no // 'di ltar 'dis yul gang gis nor bu bstan pa de ni mi thob la /
translated: But the object of engagement indicated by this is not to be obtained.üîΩThis is because the object that is indicated by this is not obtained.

original: yul gang thob pa ni 'dis ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yul gang thob pa ni 'dis ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: And the object that is obtained is not indicated by this.

original: yul dang dus dang rnam pa tha dad pa ni 'gal ba'i chos dang 'brel pa'i yin no zhes nus pa dang snang ba la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i skabs su bshad zin to //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rnam pa tha dad pa ni 'gal ba'i chos dang 'brel pa'i yin no zhes nus pa dang snang ba la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i skabs su bshad zin to //
translated: The difference in place, time, and aspect is due to the connection with contradictory properties, because of the difference in capacity, appearance, and so on. This has already been explained in the context of the above verse.

original: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi kyang tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi kyang tha dad pa yin te /
translated: Difference is also due to the reason of possessing contradictory properties.

original: de'i phyir nor bu nyid du khyad par med kyang yul tha dad pa'i phyir na nges pa gzhan yin zhing thob par yang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nor bu nyid du khyad par med kyang yul tha dad pa'i phyir na nges pa gzhan yin zhing thob par yang gzhan yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though there is no difference in the nature of the gem, the determination is different because of the difference in place, and the attainment is also different.

original: gal te cha gzhan la bslur zin kyang nor bu nyid la ni slu ba ma yin @175b no zhes de skad du brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: gal te cha gzhan la bslur zin kyang nor bu nyid la ni slu ba ma yin @175b no zhes de skad du brjod par mi nus te /
translated: If one were to say that even though there is deception regarding another aspect, there is no deception regarding the nature of the gem, that cannot be said.

original: gang gi phyir nor bu nyid kho na yul gyi khyad par can du nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nor bu nyid kho na yul gyi khyad par can du nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of the gem itself that is determined as having the particular place.

original: tshad ma'i 'jug pa'i yul yang shes pa'i bya ba la ltos pa yin gyi 'dod pas byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma'i 'jug pa'i yul yang shes pa'i bya ba la ltos pa yin gyi 'dod pas byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The object of the engagement of valid cognition depends on the activity of cognition, it is not made by desire.

original: des na ji ltar smig rgyu la chur shes pa dngos po nyid du mdos par zhen pa yin yang /
analyzed: des na ji ltar smig rgyu la chur shes pa dngos po nyid du mdos par zhen pa yin yang /
translated: Therefore, although the cognition of a mirage as water is a cognition of a thing,

original: de la tshad ma ni ma yin te chur gtogs pa'i dngos po nyid ni ma thob pa'i phyir dang / gzhan yang mang zung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la tshad ma ni ma yin te chur gtogs pa'i dngos po nyid ni ma thob pa'i phyir dang / gzhan yang mang zung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not a valid cognition, because it does not obtain the thing that is water, and because it is contradicted by other cognitions.

original: de bzhin du yang phyogs kyang khyad par can gyi nor bu shes pa ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang phyogs kyang khyad par can gyi nor bu shes pa ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the cognition of a jewel as having a particular direction is not a valid cognition,

original: nor rkyang ba ma bzung ba'i phyir dang / phyogs kyi khyad par can du gzung ba yang mi 'thob pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on ni mngon sum gyis kyang skad cig ma ma yin pa gcig nes la /
analyzed: nor rkyang ba ma bzung ba'i phyir dang / phyogs kyi khyad par can du gzung ba yang mi 'thob pa'i phyir ro // 'on ni mngon sum gyis kyang skad cig ma ma yin pa gcig nes la /
translated: because it does not apprehend the jewel alone, and because it does not obtain the jewel as having a particular direction.

original: thob par bya ba sngon po'i don ni skad cig ma du ma yin no //
analyzed: thob par bya ba sngon po'i don ni skad cig ma du ma yin no //
translated: But direct perception also determines that the object to be obtained is not a single, nonmomentary entity,üîΩbut is an object such as blue that is multiple and momentary.

original: rjes su dpag pas kyang ci ltar mthong ba ltar skad cig ma ma yin pa gcig nyid nges pa yin la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas kyang ci ltar mthong ba ltar skad cig ma ma yin pa gcig nyid nges pa yin la /
translated: And inference also determines that the object to be obtained is not a single, nonmomentary entity, but is as it is seen, multiple and momentary.

original: thob par bya ba ni gzhan yin no zhe na /
analyzed: thob par bya ba ni gzhan yin no zhe na /
translated: So why do you say that the object to be obtained is different?

original: de ltar mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ltar mi rigs te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: thams cad kyi yod pa nyid ni don byed pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyi yod pa nyid ni don byed pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no //
translated: The existence of all things is based on their causal efficiency.

original: don byed par nus pa yang dmigs pa'i sngon po ni yin te /
analyzed: don byed par nus pa yang dmigs pa'i sngon po ni yin te /
translated: The blue that is perceived is capable of causal efficiency.

original: des na yod ba ni mthong ba de nyid yin la /
analyzed: des na yod ba ni mthong ba de nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore, existence is just what is seen.

original: skad cig nyid dam rtul phra rab nyid la sog pa gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: skad cig nyid dam rtul phra rab nyid la sog pa gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: Whether it is momentariness or atomicity, or whatever else,

original: yod pa ni de las tha dad pa khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ni de las tha dad pa khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: existence is to be accepted as distinct from that.

original: des na skad cig ma nyid ni mthong ba'i sngo po nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: des na skad cig ma nyid ni mthong ba'i sngo po nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: Thus, momentariness is indeed the blue that is seen.

original: 'on kyang de la skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du nges pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang de la skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du nges pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: But it is only ascertained as not being non-momentary.

original: des na mngon sum gyis gzhan tho ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na mngon sum gyis gzhan tho ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that momentariness is established by perception as distinct from the seen blue.

original: 'on kyang mthong ba'i sngon po nyid skad cig ma'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mthong ba'i sngon po nyid skad cig ma'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Rather, the blue that is seen has the nature of being momentary.

original: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pas kyang 'chad par nus pa'i dngos po zhe na par byas la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pas kyang 'chad par nus pa'i dngos po zhe na par byas la /
translated: In the same way, it is possible to explain that inference also establishes the existence of what is capable of causal efficiency.

original: skad cig ma yang de nyid yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma yang de nyid yin te /
translated: And momentariness is just that.

original: de yang thob par nus so //
analyzed: de yang thob par nus so //
translated: And that can also be established.

original: skad cig ma nyid du nges pa ni tshad ma gzhan gyis yin gyi /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid du nges pa ni tshad ma gzhan gyis yin gyi /
translated: The fact that it is momentary is ascertained by other means of valid knowledge.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni sngon po la sogs pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni sngon po la sogs pa de nyid yin no //
translated: Its nature is just that of the blue, etc.

original: de bzhin du yul gzhan na gnas pa'i nor bu ni yul gzhan na gnas pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas par bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yul gzhan na gnas pa'i nor bu ni yul gzhan na gnas pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas par bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, it is not possible to establish that a gem located in one place has a nature located in another place.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin gzhan gzung ba na de'i khongs su ma gtogs pa'i rang bzhin gzung ba ma yin pa'i phyir yul gzhan na gnas pa'i nor bu 'dzin pa ni yul gzhan gnas pa'i nor bu yongs su gcod par byed pa ma yin pas de la tshad maüîΩma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin gzhan gzung ba na de'i khongs su ma gtogs pa'i rang bzhin gzung ba ma yin pa'i phyir yul gzhan na gnas pa'i nor bu 'dzin pa ni yul gzhan gnas pa'i nor bu yongs su gcod par byed pa ma yin pas de la tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when one apprehends a different nature, one does not apprehend a nature that is not included in that. Thus, the apprehension of a gem located in one place does not determine a gem located in another place. Therefore, it is not a means of valid knowledge in regard to that.

original: de'i phyir dam pa'i don ni 'di yin te /üîΩgal te nges pas yul du @176a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir dam pa'i don ni 'di yin te / gal te nges pas yul du @176a * //
translated: Therefore, this is the ultimate sense:

original: byas ba'i dngos po'i cha thams cad ma thob pa de ltar na yang mthong ba las gzhan thob pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byas ba'i dngos po'i cha thams cad ma thob pa de ltar na yang mthong ba las gzhan thob pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If one does not obtain all the aspects of an entity that is the object of ascertainment, then one does not obtain anything else through perception.

original: 'di ltar 'gal bas nges pa'i cha las phyi rol du gyur ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de'i shes pa de'i yongs su gcod par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gal bas nges pa'i cha las phyi rol du gyur ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de'i shes pa de'i yongs su gcod par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the cognition of that nature which is external to the ascertained part due to the contradiction does not ascertain it.

original: dper na sngon por 'dzin pa'i ser po yongs su gcod par byed pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sngon por 'dzin pa'i ser po yongs su gcod par byed pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the cognition of blue does not ascertain yellow.

original: de bzhin du yul gzhan na gnas pa'i nor bu'i rang bzhin yang mthong ba'i rang bzhin dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yul gzhan na gnas pa'i nor bu'i rang bzhin yang mthong ba'i rang bzhin dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, the nature of a jewel located in another place is contradictory to the nature that is seen.

original: nges par ma byas pa nyid kyang tshad ma'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: nges par ma byas pa nyid kyang tshad ma'i yul ma yin no //
translated: Even that which is not ascertained is not the object of valid cognition.

original: gal te skad cig pa nyid kyang sngon po'i shes pas ma nges pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te skad cig pa nyid kyang sngon po'i shes pas ma nges pa ma yin nam /
translated: If momentariness is also not ascertained by the cognition of blue,

original: de'i phyir de ji ltar yul yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ji ltar yul yin zhe na /
translated: then how can it be the object?

original: skad cig ma nyid mi nges kyang sngon po'i yul yin par ni mi smra'i /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid mi nges kyang sngon po'i yul yin par ni mi smra'i /
translated: We do not say that momentariness is the object of blue even if it is not ascertained.

original: 'di tsam zhig ni smra ste /
analyzed: 'di tsam zhig ni smra ste /
translated: We say this much:üîΩMomentari

original: skad cig ma nyid ni mthong ba'i sngon po las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid ni mthong ba'i sngon po las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: ness is not different from the blue that is seen.

original: des na gzhan thob pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na gzhan thob pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is not obtained as different.

original: 'on kyang mthong ba'i sngon po kho na thob ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang mthong ba'i sngon po kho na thob ste /
translated: But only the blue that is seen is obtained.

original: de la nges par byas pa skad cig ma ma yin pa'i cha gzhan ni thob par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la nges par byas pa skad cig ma ma yin pa'i cha gzhan ni thob par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: And the other part, which is not momentary, is not to be obtained, because it is not ascertained.

original: 'dir ni mthong ba'i cha nyid thob pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni mthong ba'i cha nyid thob pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the part that is seen is not obtained,

original: yul gzhan gnas pa nyid mthong na yul gzhan na gnas pa 'gal bas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan gnas pa nyid mthong na yul gzhan na gnas pa 'gal bas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if the object that is in another place were seen, it would be contradictory for it to be in another place.

original: gal te de lta na mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i sngon po ni rags pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te de lta na mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i sngon po ni rags pa yin la /
translated: If that is so, the blue that is seen by direct perception is gross,

original: thob pa ni phra mo yin no //
analyzed: thob pa ni phra mo yin no //
translated: but that which is obtained is subtle.

original: rags pa dang phra ba dag kyang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: rags pa dang phra ba dag kyang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: And gross and subtle are contradictory.

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: That is not reasonable,

original: dngos po gcig nyid ni phra ba dang phra ba ma yin pa 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gcig nyid ni phra ba dang phra ba ma yin pa 'gal ba yin te /
translated: because it is contradictory for a single thing to be both subtle and not subtle,

original: 'gal ba ni gzhi gcig la yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni gzhi gcig la yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because contradiction is based on a single basis.

original: gang gi tshe gcig gi rang bzhin ni phra mo yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gcig gi rang bzhin ni phra mo yin la /
translated: When the nature of one is subtle,

original: du ma ni rags pa yin pa de'i tshe 'gal ba 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: du ma ni rags pa yin pa de'i tshe 'gal ba 'ga' yang med do //
translated: and many are gross, then there is no contradiction at all.

original: 'di ltar skad cig ma nyid ni snga phyi dang bral ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig ma nyid ni snga phyi dang bral ba yin la /
translated: In this way, momentariness is free from before and after.

original: mang po'i snga phyi can du snang ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: mang po'i snga phyi can du snang ba de bzhin du /
translated: And just as many moments appear to have before and after,

original: rdul phra rab gcig ni phra mo yin la mang po ni rags pa yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab gcig ni phra mo yin la mang po ni rags pa yin no //
translated: so one atom is subtle and many are gross.

original: gal te gcig tu sngon po yin na mang po yang sngon po nyid yin pa de bzhin du rtul phra rab gcig phra mo yin na mang po yang phra mor 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gcig tu sngon po yin na mang po yang sngon po nyid yin pa de bzhin du rtul phra rab gcig phra mo yin na mang po yang phra mor 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one is blue, many are blue. In the same way, if one atom is subtle, many are subtle.

original: bden te / rang rang gi ngo bos phra ba mang po rnams kyi mang po'i rang bzhin mthong ba na rags par snang ba yin no //
analyzed: bden te / rang rang gi ngo bos phra ba mang po rnams kyi mang po'i rang bzhin mthong ba na rags par snang ba yin no //
translated: True, but many things are subtle by their own nature. When many things are seen to have the nature of many, they appear gross.

original: 'ga' zhig ni dngos po'i chos yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni dngos po'i chos yin te /
translated: Some are qualities of things.

original: sngon po nyid ces bya bar mang po las yang khyad par med pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon po nyid ces bya bar mang po las yang khyad par med pa yin no //
translated: Blue is not different from many.

original: 'ga' zhig ni 'dzin pa'i chos yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni 'dzin pa'i chos yin te /
translated: Some are qualities of apprehension.

original: gzung bar bya ba mang po nyid la snang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba mang po nyid la snang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which appears to be the plurality of the apprehended.

original: skad cig gcig gzung ba la ni snga phyir yongs su ma bcad na /
analyzed: skad cig gcig gzung ba la ni snga phyir yongs su ma bcad na /
translated: In the apprehension of a single moment, if there is no determination of prior and subsequent,

original: mang po @176b gzung ba la snga phyir yongs su bcad pa yin no //
analyzed: mang po @176b gzung ba la snga phyir yongs su bcad pa yin no //
translated: then in the apprehension of many, there is determination of prior and subsequent.

original: chos de ni mang po dag shes pa gcig gis gzung ba na snang ba'i phyir 'dzin pa'i chos su brjod kyi gzung ba'i chos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos de ni mang po dag shes pa gcig gis gzung ba na snang ba'i phyir 'dzin pa'i chos su brjod kyi gzung ba'i chos ni ma yin no //
translated: When that dharma is apprehended by a single cognition of many, it is called an apprehended dharma because it appears, but it is not an apprehended dharma.

original: de bzhin du rdul phra rab gcig gzung ba la ni rags par mi snang la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdul phra rab gcig gzung ba la ni rags par mi snang la /
translated: Similarly, in the apprehension of a single atom, it does not appear as gross.

original: mang po yul tha dad pa can shes pa gcig gis gzung na du ma'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i mthar thug pa rags par snang bar gyur te /
analyzed: mang po yul tha dad pa can shes pa gcig gis gzung na du ma'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i mthar thug pa rags par snang bar gyur te /
translated: But when many with different locations are apprehended by a single cognition, the ultimate nature of apprehending many appears as gross.

original: mang po rnams shes pa gcig la snang ba 'brel pa nyid rags pa yin no //
analyzed: mang po rnams shes pa gcig la snang ba 'brel pa nyid rags pa yin no //
translated: The appearance of many in a single cognition is the connection itself that is gross.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni so so la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni so so la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it does not exist individually.

original: 'di ni brtags pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni brtags pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not an imputation,

original: 'on kyang dbang po'i shes pa la brten pa dang brtags par yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dbang po'i shes pa la brten pa dang brtags par yod pa yin te /
translated: but it exists as imputed in dependence on sense cognition.

original: mang po rnams gcig gis gzung ba na snang ba'i phyir dang / so so ba la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mang po rnams gcig gis gzung ba na snang ba'i phyir dang / so so ba la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because many are apprehended by one, and because they do not exist separately.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni phra mo mang po shes pa gcig gi yul du gyur pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni phra mo mang po shes pa gcig gi yul du gyur pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is a nature that is the object of a single cognition of many subtle particles.

original: de la yang rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin 'gal ba med pa'i phyir 'di tshad mar rigs pa yin no //
